reviews.review: Beyond expactations. As a kid I always wanted to swim with dolphin and I had the opportunity here, they gave me to realize that dream in a way that I didn't expect. I start to be a bit nervous but they made us be really comfortable. Our dolphin was black and I enjoyed every moment, I had so much fun with the dolphin but also with the guides that were with us. I had sparkles in my eyes and a massive smile for an hour and even after, and he best is that you can see it on the picture. Really good quality, I had some trouble to see it, I had to make a different account but made it work and I don't regret that I paid for these ones. Magical memory, thank you so much for this !

Loved it!. Absolutely loved this. We had 2 young kids and we thought that they wouldn't do it, so hubby and I booked individually. I ended up doing it twice as kids were up for it, although they did have to sit on our shoulders.The experience itself was fantastic, we got a discount as we were staying at Atlantis.The shaming part was price of photos, it's such a downer that you have to pay so much to capture the memories

Very mixed feelings. For one i am outraged by the price! But then I guess you have to pay to meet these wonderful animals! Which is fine but the rip off starts after with the picture business where they charge you a fortune for some ugly pics they take for you!Also some of the instructors are kind and nice but some are terrible! They make you feel as if you are inappropriate and warn you that by the time the dolphin comes around you are not even sure if you can touch him or not! I get that they might be disgusted that this is a form of animal exploitation! But then either close it and let the dolphins free or resign and don't work there! Secondly from what i saw the dolphins have amazing facilities there and they were really happy so not sure what was the instructors problem but she had a bad attitude! For what we paid for 600£ including some pictures was a total disappointment! I get it we touched and kissed these amazing animals but it was all like a 'conveyer belt' experience ran by a few bored and full of attitude peeps (2 of the staff were nice, one guy seemed a bit embarrassed for the attitude of the Lily's instructor and tried to compensate!) And honestly for a quick experience where you touch the dolphin 3-4 times terrorised by the instructor where you don't even smile or move or breath cause you might hurt the dolphin! it is overpriced! We paid it for the little one but honestly we thought it will he the highlight and it turned into the trips disappointment! The dolphins are amazing by the way! Its just badly structured and they need fresh happy staff!

Time of our life. We wanted to see the Dolphins and this was a wonderful chance. My husband booked us a greet with the dolphins and we had the best time. We learned about the Dolphins and got great pictures of the Dolphins.

Fantastic experience!. Wonderful experience and worth the price as included day at the water park & the aquarium (£300 for 2 people) although we bought the photographer photos which were £150 for about 60, expensive but worth it I think as will only do it once. Was very organised and informative, felt safe too. The trainers were great, only thing I'd say is that it goes very quickly - you are constantly being told to pose for the photo/look at camera rather than enjoy the moment interacting with the dolphin but I guess that#s for your benefit for the memories. We booked before we left the UK, on 365 tickets website, all good.

Great experience. I visited this place in Atlantis with my friend. We had a great time with the Dollphins. You get into the water and interact with the Dolphins, by touching it holding it and getitng a ride on it across the water. The Dolpins are very cute and intelligent creatures, and this was my first handson experience with them. Although this is very expensive it is worth the money

Best experience ever!!. Booked it online before we went. Was given access to a locker, towels and a choice of wet suit or vest followed a briefing on the different types of dolphins and how to behave around them. We were split into 2 groups and were allowed to take our cameras to the beach part on our lagoon, however to take photos you could leave the water, but to do that you'd miss bits of the experience. We had one dolphin called Tulega (I think that's what she was called) who was beautiful. She was encouraged to swim past us so we could stroke her back then we took it in turns to kiss and hug her whilst a professional photographer took our photos. We were then allowed to take it in turns to play with her by throwing a ball, a ring or dancing with her. We finished off the experience by having her swim past several times so we could touch her and learn about their body and how they behave. Next time I'm in Dubai I'd certainly book to swim with them. There were showers to rinse off afterwards and we were given refreshments afterwards. I've only given 4 stars based on the cost of the photographs afterwards.
Ok. Nice time with the dolphin however not worth the price tag. Pictures were expensive too. Something to do once but not again.

A Definite Must Do!!!. Caters for all skill levels from young kids to experienced divers - you choose which experience you want to have. We have a family of 3 children aged 14, 11 and 8 and the youngest not the most confident in water, so we opted for the shallow water experience. We were in awe of Lilly our dolphin - ever playful and tender and soft. Tamrin, Molly's keeper was wonderful ensuring everybody had one on one time with the dolphin. It's an experience the kids totally enjoyed - touching, playing, dancing, fetching, kissing and hugging all included - and then of course the obligatory showing off with jumps and somersaults.There is a professional photographer in the water with you, so a little hard to take photos when you can't take your own camera into the water. Prices for photos are a little high I must admit.

Once in a lifetime. What an amazing way to spend your 30th birthday. This place is beautiful. Not only is it part of the lovely 'Atlantis', it is in fantastic settings. It is super clean and well looked after. The facilities are great and the staff are very friendly. We didn't realise when we booked this but we actually went during Ramadan. Which to be fair is great because the tourism is non existent so all the trips you do, you certainly get your monies worth. Normally I believe you would have one dolphin to 10 people. We had 1 dolphin to the two of us so this was a awesome one on one experience. The dolphins are very intelligent and very well looked after. We had Jasmine and I believe she is the youngest dolphin and the only one to be born here. They teach you about the dolphins, you get to play with them, sing with them, dance with them. It really was a magical experience and the best 30th birthday present I could have asked for. The timing was about right, I think it was for about 45 minutes and it didn't feel rushed. The water is lovely and warm too. You also get free access to the waterpark in the Atlantis hotel so make full use of this. It is huge and make sure you take your flip flops with you. We didn't and lets just say our feet got burnt because the ground gets so hot. The only thing I would say is the photos are very expensive. However how can you have an awesome experience and walk away empty handed. Take your time looking through the photos because you will be overwhelmed by how many there are, but a lot of them are the same, so work out which deal is best for you.

Truly amazing experience. Something i have always wanted to do is swim with dolphins, we decided to do this as a family at this resort. We were not disappointed, it isn't cheap but it is well worth it. The dolphins whilst in captivity have an amazing set up and is very spacious, clean and they are very well kept. The staff are very good all around and knowledgeable but were fab with my children who were very apprehensive, i am pleased to say they had an amazing experience and would love to do it again. Thank you for making the experience magical.

This was brilliant. I have always wanted to swim with the Dolphins and this was nothing short of brilliant. I did want to have the deep water experience where you get to swim with them properly but it was a little pricey for us so we did the shallow water experience instead and it did not disappoint. The handlers were wonderful and gave us so much information about the Dolphins. Our dolphin was Abby and we each got time on our own with the dolphin as well as a small group. I got to give Abby a big kiss and a hug which was so amazing to me! Something i would love to do again and have some very wonderful memories to take away with me. The only reason why I haven't marked this review as excellent is purely due to the price tag. Very expensive indeed. Especially as it was me and my husband who did it, so over £300 for just over an hour. BUT, I had the opportunity to swim with Dolphins, so how could we not! :)

Fantastic Experience.. We visited as part of a layover and decided to have a dolphin experience. It is worth EVERY penny!!! We had an amazing time with Abby the Dolphin. The trainers are wonderful and talk you though every step. You get plenty of one on one time and the photographer isn't at all intrusive - we completely forgot they was there! I would recommend visiting without a doubt.

Experience of a lifetime. A fantastic but expensive experience. Family of four, we chose the Dolphin Adventure activity, the smiles on my wife and children's faces as they interacted with Tina our dolphin for the forty minutes was priceless.

Over priced!!. We had the dolphin encounter deal, for the 2nd time, and as usual the kids loved it, I still believe the price tag is exaggerated compared to the time spent and size of the group. The staff are very helpful and well knowledgeable and the kids do learn from them. The facility is well equipped. The pictures are another way of rip off, very expensive indeed. When you buy the ticket, they tell you cameras are not allowed, however, observers are allowed to bring their cameras and picture from the beach, which is slightly further than the photographer. Do I recommend it... YES.

Fun with dolphin. When me and my husband entered the Atlantis Aquaventure we have received personal information regarding all tickets including special offer, difference options for Dolphin Bay and all inclusions. The staff was so patient and explain us all accurately.My husband is better swimmer then me, so he could have more advanced play with dolphin(different option then me). We have the excellent introduction before dolphin session. It was unforgettable experience with dolphin!

My dream came true!. Beautiful experience, don't be afraid the dolphins are one of the most intelligent species in earth. They teach you what to do and when. I bought the Royal Swim which is a little expensive but 100% worth it. The pictures are a little expensive so be ready to paid about 750 AED for you want to keep the memories forever.

Brilliant experience, adorable dolphins!. Starts off by getting changed into a wetsuit or jacket for dolphin encounter experience.. followed by a dolphin presentation in a room.. you get allocated into random groups that have a dolphin each.. usually 4 different groups of ten at the same time.. so 40 odd people at most.. plus 8 instructors and 4 photographers... in which case i thought only ten people in the water.. didnt make a difference but i guess i hoped it was more private.As soon as you are in the water.. it is time to take turns posing with the dolphin while u wait.. once a pose is finished the dolphin will come round towards others so you can stroke until the next persons intimate turn for a shot.. i hoped we would have atleast 20mins with the dolphin one to one but it was probably 2 minutes.. 2 best minutes ever! I love animals and now obsessed with dolphins.. you would appreciate this experience and really love it.. if only the length of time was increased.The experience with the dolphin was 11/10The way its planned by the dolphin bay team is 7/10There are 3 different dolphin lagoons used at different times of the day.. if you have different time slots with families then it worth bearing in mindIn order to capture great moments without having to pay a heavy price tag by using their professional photographer... get a family or friend who isnt participating to take a few shots (they will need the observer pass)Although they wont be allowed to step into water, they will have to take it from the distance, i tried this but ended up purchasing 2 professional pictures (as the ones taken of me were blurry and too far out) As the experience with the dolphin was amazing i wanted a clear shot to cherish.For the sake of the dolphins i give 5 stars

Deep water Dolphin experience. We visited here yesterday as a party of 5 (2 adults, and 3 kids 13,12,9)We had pre booked the deep water dolphin experience (all the kids can swim pretty well) online prior to arriving.Check in was ok, and you are then driven by golf buggies to the dolphin bay part of the park. Once there, after signing a waiver, you are whisked to get changed and for a quick orientation (which was fine, and learnt a bit about Dolphins).Whilst this is clearly not going to be a cheap day, it's also not going to be your average day either. We thought it represented pretty good value, given that we got to spend a good 30 mins with a Dolphin. We were with "Tina", and got to hug, get kissed, pushed round, a belly ride, dance etc with her. The kids faces were a picture, and really was an experience they will treasure (and we thought it was pretty cool too !)I knew the pictures weren't going to be cheap, but in for a penny, in for a pound...there is a photographer assigned to each group (6 max) who snaps away during your experience.We got 272 pictures (yes ! 272), and bought them all (digital - you can download them) as well as a poster and 10 prints which was ~ £175. Given you are normally charged £10-£20 per picture at these kind of things, I didn't think that was too bad, and when we saw some of the pictures of our kids - I have to say they are priceless...So - if you want to swim with dolphins - I'd definitely recommend this. My 9 year old said it was "the best day of his life".As part of our deal, we also got lunch included, and a day at the water park. Given I think entry to the water park was ~£70 on its own and lunch £10, it adds a bit more value to the dolphin package.

Do this before you die. Sorry for the grim title. But swimming with dolphins must be on your bucket list before you die. I'll keep this short and sweet. My Dolphin Adventure experience at Atlantis not only ticked this off my bucket list, but was also one of the most fun and precious moments in my life. Please do not let the price put you off. It is 100% worth it believe me.

Dolphins are so friendly. You better not miss this experience, I have seen dolphin shows and have little photograph session with them but this one stands out. You are with them (Dolphins)and they give all their love and affection. You will be experiencing true world on what all fun they (Dolphins)can do. Dolphin can dance with you, kiss you right , you can hug them and they splash on you.I was scared initially but the experienced staff make you get comfortable and you can roll it from there. Photographer is assigned right there but the pictures comes with price tag. We took one picture which was fair enough for our memory and we have live experience in our heart which always melt for this lovely creature of God , The Dolphins.

Great attraction and interaction.. We went here as a family of three, two adults and one child who was four. We have done this interaction twice before as adults and knew that our daughter would love it. The whole interaction is handled in a very professional way and there is never any rush to the proceedings. The locker rooms are well kept and there are plenty of lockers to store any valuables whilst you are in the water. There is a presentation and a question and answer session you get your wet suit or jacket to wear and then you go out in groups of around 8. You have a fun interaction with the Dolphins and get to play, dance and stroke them. Well worth the money. Professional photographers take plenty of of photos of you that you can purchase afterwards. This is the only way that you will get decent photos of your interactions. They are priced but you get 50 images downloaded to a memory stick for around £100 depending on the exchange rate. You can have a spectator take photos for you but they are not allowed in the watt and you gave your back to them must of the time. You will also get access to Aquaventure with this interaction so make a day of it. Book the 0930 interaction and spend the rest if the day at the water park.

A beautiful encounter with a beautiful animal. As a rule, this is not the type of activity I agree with morally. However, this was the one thing my 4 year old wanted to do during our trip to the Atlantis so I put my beliefs aside and we booked a dolphin encounter. What a beautiful experience it was. The dolphins are clearly very loved and cared for and it was a beautiful moment to see these wonderful animals up close. The dolphin trainers clearly know what they are doing and before you are even allowed in the water you are given a 30 minute talk about the animals and the do's and dont's of your visit. The look on my daughters face was absolutely priceless. If you have any reservations, like I did, try and put them aside because this is a really wonderful experience.

Blade. This was one of the things my two sons and my friends daughter wanted to do they are 4 5 8 so naturally I went along with it and my friend was there as well and it did not disappoint this was an amazing experience that myself or kids will never forget!! Even though it's expensive it's worth every penny and the look on my kids faces after getting a kiss from blade and throwing a hoop and him bringing it back money couldn't buy the dolphins are so well looked after that and the relationship with the trainers is so good u can see where ur money goes the pictures are pricey but it's not often u swim with dolphins so it was worth it all in all I'm glad I spent the money as u can't buy memories but the dolphins make them

You will never want to leave them.. This was just worth every single dollar we paid. We were in a group of 5 and you get a super introduction to basics on dolphins. Take of all your jewellery and hair pins before eyou put on ur wet suit and get into the water with an instructor. This feels so personalised and each person gets time to hug and kiss and swim with the dolphins. My 11 year old son just loved it and you feel an incredible attachment to your dolphin. You get the park free after getting this part over and that's great they include it in the price. No need for towels either. We did buy the album with 15 pictures and the huge picture to frame. Expensive but so worth it. This experience really gets you to appreciate the animals and what's out there in the ocean. You do wish they were free to swim back into the wild. Maybe one day. Till then they have a lot of love to give when you try this place out.
Your kids will never forget this !. If you have kids , you must take them there ! its unforgettable. you will never get a chance to swim,play and even touch the dolphins. booking is a must.

Fantastic experience.. This experience is once in a lifetime. The place and the Dolphins are beautiful. Our dolphin, Alice was super talented as like all the other Dolphins in the bay. The experience was amazing as you get to meet, stroke and swim with the Dolphins. It's amazing. You also get entry to the water park with your ticket. Worth a visit while in Dubai.

Amazing experience. My favourite memory from Dubai ! Such an amazing experience , first it starts off with a presentation of dolphins so knowledge is gained , then your brought out to the dolphin pool to meet your own dolphin, you get to pet the dolphin with safety rules followed to make the dolphin feel safe which I was delighted with how well treated the dolphins are and how rewarded they are, I got to play with the dolphin too by throwing a ball for it to catch, you also receive a kiss from the dolphin super cute, the Dolphins are so playful and intelligent and seem really happy, afterwards you can buy pictures that they take also which can be priced but worth it!
Mrs.. The best moments in my life! I have tried swimming with dolphins in May 2015 and sea lions this year in March. Fantastic! Love that place 100%

A high-class entertainment. The experience about the performance was really nice. However, personally I found it overcharged. I might have the same with much cheaper price in other countries. Anyway, it is just optional for you.

Great Day But Expensive. I did the Dolphin encounter with my husband & 11 year old son which we all enjoyed. The staff where great & seemed to know their stuff, our dolphin was called Central. I would definitely recommend the encounter but it is very expensive and the photos afterwards are another expense. I have to say the staff member that was assisting us with our photos seemed to be getting very impatient with us but we took our time & got what we wanted !You get towels included in the encounter which you can take into the waterpark which will save you bringing or renting towels in the waterpark. You will also get drinks after which you can bring on into the park. The bag search going in was quiet relaxed so you could probably have a few snacks in your bag also, you can bring water in which is allowed.

What an amazing experience!. I swam with the dolphins for my 21st birthday present! My family paid for me to go but when I saw how much it was I was very shocked! But the day was amazing and the experience was speculator. First we had a lesson in the room with a big group of people who told us all about dolphins and their lifestyle. They told us our safety positions etc and debriefed us on what to do and not to do. Then it was time for swimming! We had kisses with the dolphins, danced, spun around and actually swam with them. It was so fun! It's just a shame that we don't get longer with the Dolphins and the only thing I would change is the prices of the photos at the end as they were very expensive.

Unforgettable Dolphin's Kiss. Such an incredible Dolphin Encounter experience which left lasting memorable feelings and smile on the face just when remembering it. People comment below "it's expensive", but ask yourself, how many employees are involved in the process and how expensive to look after dolphins, maintain lagoon facilities etc. All Dolphin instructors were professional and very friendly, easy to engage with people. Special mention goes to instructor Daniel from Portugal. I am planning to repeat this great experience and probably will go for Sea Lions or Dolphins in deep water. Place itself is very well maintained, green and alluring. Thank you all guys for your efforts and see you soon!

THE BEST THING EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!. Granted this was expensive, but it was honestly the best experience that my mum and I have ever had! You have the opportunity to get up close and personal with real life dolphins with cheeky personalities! We even rode one back to the shore! Honestly, amazing.

Amazing experience. We had a wonderful experience at Dolphin Bay. The trainers were very well informed and passed on so much information about the dolphins. My 5 year old daughter also did the experience and she was made to feel very included and part of it. The dolphins are very well cared for and the surroundings are immaculately clean. Worth every penny!

Ripped off. 2 parents, 3 children - it was not only that we paid so much for 20 minutes of interaction (almost a weeks holiday Budget - I. E. ca. 1'000 US $)it was the quality and the how: worst: if you don't buy THEIR pictures, you leave without a pictured memory. "for the safety of the animals..." you are not allowed to take pictures. Then they sell you a minimal version at almost 100US $.the introduction was basically looking at a rather cheep video, that would give you 4 to 5 answers to a question, and lets you choose the correct one. Not very creative and mostly unneccessary. (The truely neccessary Information could be given within 2 minutes, no school room is needed for this. OR: Show a short nice informational video.)Finally the encounter with the animals didn't impress me at all: i came without prejudice, but there was no sign of joy on the side of the animal. all i saw was a well trained and well behaving animal that did what it was told. All after all to receive fish as a reward. Everything else seems to happen in the romantic phantasies of the visitor: the personal connection, the magic moment of touching (i doubt that the animals appreciate to be factorilike presented and touched by strangers) until the personal kiss. All after all: our children loved it, and I played "good daddy", danke with the dolphin and bought the pictures to see them happy. Later in life, they might change their point of view, white yesterday, a wish of theirs had become true.

Expensive but great fun. Visited for the day with my 10 and 12 year olds. The reality is that of course it's expensive. About £150 pp and then paid £80 for 5 photos. But it's something you do once as a memory to last a lifetime. We could also enjoy the waterpark for the rest of the day which was great. Tip ... If one of your party isn't going in the water they would be able to take some great pics from the viewing area.
dolphin encounters. Th event was well organised and left us with a good experience although the price is bit high, the entry to the park comes free which is a great place to spend your day.

WOW����. For our honeymoon, my wife wanted to swim with the Dolphins. So i pre-booked the Dolphin Adventure to swim in deep water.There are 3 different experiences ranging in 3 different price ranges.From start to finish the experience was 5* and i couldn't recommend it highly enough.This 30 minute experience is worth every penny, but wish we had now done the more expensive one for full experience.Dolphins were so beautiful and friendly, or you can do the experiences with Sea Lions.

A truly amazing experience. We chose the Royal Swim which we felt was the best package to really be able to interact more with the dolphins. From the moment you arrive it is extremely professional and efficient from the facilities to the service of all the staff. Daphne had a great sense of humour who gave us the briefing before we had our session. Andreas and we think she she was called, Yvette, from Essex were our instructors who looked after us for the session and they we helpful, reassuring and remembered all our names :-).... The experience itself was really magical and one that I would definitely do again when I return to Dubai next year and one that I would sincerely recommend to anyone.. The highlight of course was the main attraction, our dolphin called Central..... Thanks to everyone at Dolphin Bay for a superb experience in what is clearly a very professional facility with the dolphins well cared for..

An amazing experience!. There aren't many people who don't have swimming with dolphins on their bucket list.Now yes, these are captive animals and there will be those who disagree with that. From my experience the dolphin I worked with and the others that I saw did appear to be happy, well cared for, and playful when alone in the pools. There are a numer of experiences on offer including shallow and deep water. We took one ofthe deep water packages but don't worry, the clothing provided is very bouyant and you aren't teading water all the time. The handlers work in pairs and rotate throughout the session and you after a breifing sesion you get to dance and swim with the dolphins, I say swim, the dolphin drags you along for the ride and that is most exhilarating!It is expensive but if you are staying in the hotel you can get a discount.
Felt in love!. Soft, funny and playful dolphin! What can be more amazing.. It's expensive I know but it's definitely worth it.. They take good care of you

The Best Experience Ever!. What a incredible privilege it was to swim in the deep water with these amazing, gorgeous, athletic animals. There is the only reason why one should go to Dubai & that is to swim with the Dolphins. The amazing team of trainers have done a terrific job and are very thorough in their briefings before we even get into the water - it's clear they have the animal's welfare very much to the fore. Holding onto a dolphin whilst it pulls you, very fast, across the water (a lot of salt water swallowed!) was exhilarating; feeling the animals gentle kiss on one's cheek...oooohhh - I was so on cloud nine. Whilst it is not cheap, it is so very worth the money spent. There is a shallow water experience for families and an official photographer who takes lots of photos for you to later select from - it's not permitted for anyone to take photos from the beach. The only odd point is the too many steps in the process from time you arrive at Atlantis until you get into the water but I guess Dubai is very labor intensive and it gives jobs to the many foreigners who come to Dubai to work. Cost of this ticket also gives you free entry to the rest of the wonderful Atlantis water park for that day.

Swim with the dolphins. A special treat you should not miss is swimming with one of these wonderful mammals at Dolphin Bay. My partner being a lover of creatures had to swim with the dolphins and was not disappointed. The whole event was well organised and the dolphins looked after with the greatest of care which we feel is most important. A must do in Dubai.

Lovely experience. Visited Dolphin bay during our recent trip to Dubai and the whole experience was great. The main purpose of the visit was for our animal mad 4 year old as we knew how much it would mean to him to see a dolphin let alone meet one.Everything about the experience was well organised and professionally handled. A brief factual presentation was done and then it was straight onto the experience.We were in a group of approximately 10 people with the dolphin named S2, both George and the trainer for S2 (we didn't catch his name) were outstanding. Our son was nervous and wouldn't leave our sides and they were both flexible and patient to ensure we didn't miss out.An unforgettable experience which has fuelled our little boys love of animals.Photos are expensive but on a par with the usual theme parks (Disney, Alton towers etc) if you wish to buy more than 5 photos then go for the USB as its the same price and you can print at home.

Fabulous experience. I did the shallow water experience with my two girls and it was simply fabulous. We were in a group of around 10 people and met the lovely dolphin Sol. He was beautiful and we were given clear instructions of how we should touch him and kiss him. The photos were a little on the pricey side but with my husband also taking pictures there was no way that any of them could have been as good as that of the photographer so we had to buy a few.

Have you got extra cash to spare.. A wonderful experience but not worth the price. The atlantis offers different options to visit the Dolphins. However the staff had no accurate knowledge about the Dolphins. It was like reading from a script.Having a 4 year old with us, narrowed our options to only the shallow waters encounter. Worth going for the first time but not something one should do again.

Dolphin Encounter. This is a truly breathtaking experience and certainly not to be missed. Suitable for all ages and possibly a once in a life time experience. Words and emotions are difficult to describe but I just felt fantastic!

Great memories but expensive. Me and my 6yr old daughter booked the dolphin encounter and it was a great experience. You were taken by golf buggy to the dolphin bay area and given a wetsuit or life vest (your choice) before being seated for a 15 minute briefing. It started a bit haphazardly though as a number of participants arrived late and ruined what was an interesting talk by one of the staff. Once done we were put into groups of around 9/10 and taken to the shallow area of the enclosure where we met our dolphin. First off came the photographs, all seemed a little shoehorned in rushed to be honest. The trainer then told us about our dolphin and gave us the experience of touching and getting close to them. Finally they have us the option of dancing with them or throwing a ball or hoop before the final picture. The last thing came a short demonstration of the dolphins jumping out of the water and splashing is which was nice. The actual time with the Dolphins was roughly 20-30mins. Make no mistake, this attraction is expensive when looked at in isolation. We paid 750 Aed each (£140 each) and that included a 100 Aed discount each for booking more than 2 weeks prior to attending. The official photographs are even more expensive. The cheapest photograph was 75 Aed (£14 per photo!) which came in a flimsy paper pouch with certificate. The hardback cover was 100 Aed (£19) per photo. Other packages were offered but were eye-wateringly expensive. What made this bareable was free entry into Aquaventure water park next door which is usually 250 Aed (£50) each. One word of advice though. If booking the dolphin encounter and you have a friend/family member that wants to watch/take photos from the beach viewing area - do NOT pre book this via the website as they charge 300 Aed (£56) per person. On the day when collecting the dolphin tickets we were offered this for a family member not taking part in he encounter for just 40 Aed (£8)!!!It was a great experience, especially to see my daughters face and to have those pictures/memories forever. However, it was more expensive thank it needed to be and I wouldn't need to do it again.
Life time experience. Amazing experience, friendly environment, and very knowledgeable staff about mammals!It was my second time and I love it, definitely I will do that again and again

Memorable day. Was t sure to go or not & still have my doubts on animals performing ' but to be fair too Atlantis you can tell the dolphins are well looked after ' it was good that before you entered water with dolphins you were told all about there back grounds and facts on dolphins when in water with dolphins the staff main concern is respecting the Dolphins which a thought was well organised ' & if dolphin didn't want to perform it didn't have too we had Lexie the dolphin my son who is 10 had a ball was a bit expensive £300 to have experience with them each then a was £180 for pictures but to be fair must cost a fortune too look after the Dolphins to a high standard ' can't remember ladies name the trainer was South African very nice full off fun so good day had by all

Highlight of our trip!. We picked the dolphin encounter experience and it was truly fantastic! All the staff and instructor were friendly and welcoming. The dolphin we played with, Hilma, was obviously wonderful. No camera was allowed but the photographer captured all the memorable moments. The photos were not cheap but we'd recommend to purchase the digital version so you get to have 50 photos saved on a USB to take home. There were about 8-10 people per dolphin. Everyone got equal and enough time to experience, kiss and play with the dolphin. It wasn't cheap but it was well worth it.

Very nice. The dolphin encounter is a great experience for young and adults. Here dolphins are well treated and their life expectancy can double than in nature. Before the meeting a staff of professional provide very interesting scientific information on this fantastic animal. This is an experience Forever lasting.

Honeymoon treat - very expensive!. My new husband and I treated ourself to the dolphin experience as neither had done this before. We went for the most expensive option of the Royal Swim. We were fortunate in that we had only 1 other person in our group with us and our dolphin. The trainer was very knowledgeable and clearly loved the Dolphins and his job. He was great at answering our questions.The experience was awesome and I'd love to do it again. The only downside was the price of the pictures. We did not want the print outs but only a few copies on a USB stick. They don't do that. We did buy the pics and all copies on a USB stick but felt ripped off. They need to make the prices more reasonable.

precious moments and memories for life. precious moments and memories for lifethis is a must do once in a lifetime was an amazing experience for entire family their overall package is superior snd shows what can be created as a unique business model all throught though from animals to humans and the interaction windows the rooms the clothes the works !!! age no bar ... ensure you do of you are in dubai Ps the momento and pictures shopping is hugely over priced so build it in your cost planning ...

Fantastic Family Experience!. This trip really made our family holiday, our four year old daughter absolutely loved it...and to be honest so did mummy and daddy! A truly magical experience, worth the cost and the photographs we purchased were ideal to remember the moment. We got plenty of time with the Dolphins, we have done a similar experience in Cuba but Dolphin Bay was miles better for the time you actually get in the water with such beautiful animals! Definitely worth the money!!!

Amazing encounter. Swimming with dolphins is possible here. They live in this bay and they are wery well kept. Medically followed and good food allow them to live longer than in wild nature. A nice scientific explanation is given before the meetings. Nice for adults and small children.

Paradise for animal lovers !!. I melted away !! Really enjoyable experience !!We visited dolphin bay at atlantis and booked for the shallow water encounter with dolphins. It was a bit expensive but perhaps a once in a lifetime experience. A full half hour interaction with our dolphin. We were in a group of 10 and each one of us got the chance to dance hug and kiss with our lovely dolphin. The package gave us access to all the rides of the waterpark and we tried a few which was great fun. Lunch at the park was really good with a lot of things to chooce from. The place IS CROWDED which is expected but if you go earlier in the day things seem a lot better !! I am an animal lover so i dont regret i did this and i will always treasure the memory !!
Amazing!. A once in a lifetime experience! Not cheap but worth it. Ticket gives you access to Aquaventure all day.
The best day ever. Fantastic experience, swimming with dolphins. Its so organized and amazing. After that you get a free access to Aquaventure waterpark, which is amazing too.
Memories for a life time. It was very organized and the staff was amazing. I think it's overpriced but the looks and smiles on my daughter's faces was priceless. A definite must do.

Memorable experience. My hubby + I decided to treat ourselves to this. It was a lovely experience, very memorable.However I felt they were very overpriced compared to other places I have done this + they should be absolutely ashamed at the price they are charging for the photo CD.

Brilliant but expensive. Went for the first slot in the morning Royal swim, no queues and free entry to the water park after. Amazing experience with lovely animals and was happy to hear the dolphins have a choice- they can stay inside if they want to. Photos are expensive but you can have one of your party take some from the beach (potential to ask another person on there...). Trainers were knowledgeable, passionate and caring.Wouldn't go again due to cost but would certainly recommends to others.

Moments not captured!!!. Though a nice experience with the Dolphins, but the experience can be as good as the moments captured by the "professional" photographer who is there.. paid 750 euros for myself, wife and two daughters and did all kinds of pauses as per the instructions.. unfortunately, very poor photographer not good photos.. the dolphin name is blade.. i don't know the name of the associated photographer..Where you get your photos, ithe person in charge started to give absurd excuses rather than apologizing...Poor value for money...

Worth it.. Costly but really worth it. We booked the encounter but had problems with our booking when we checked in. The staff went out of way to help us sort it all out. The Dolphins were amazing and again the staff were lovely to me (frightened non swimmer) making me feel at ease. Only thing which could be improved was changing rooms. Showers in separate room to lockers and the changing room was just one small room - no privacy and not much room. The photos are also expensive but worth it and you get lots to choose from so you can choose the best ones to print. Lots of time to decide and lots of options to suit all budgets.

Nice. Family enjoyed a dolphin encounter. I went to take pictures (which still cost 100 AED) but with all the rules about staying on the beach, they ensure only their photographers can get close enough to have decent pictures. Should have brought my telephoto. Otherwise good fun.

FABULOUS TIME. What a great day. We booked this though Atlantis website and was given free access to the water park. The dolphin encounter was fantastic. got to spend 30 minutes interacting with the dolphins. A must do if you are in dubai

Wonderful experience. Thoroughly enjoyed this experience. All the staff were really professional throughout and made me feel really comfortable. The interaction with the Dolphins was great but I wished it could have been for longer, a lovely experience.

Fun. I've always wanted to swim with dolphins since I was younger and so coming to Dubai it was a must. The experience was great as I was able to touch play kiss and even dance with the dolphin! The hospitality and service was outstanding all the staff were helpful, kind and always smiling (as I would be if I looked after dolphins all day!!) the only reason I wouldn't give 5stars is because of the value, I spent about 10 minutes with the dolphin in a group of 8 and a pass to aquaventure, all for 895 AED where a normal pass to the park is 260 AED making a dolphin encounter cost about 635 AED est. £127!!! All in all the dolphin encounter was great fun wish it would of just been a little longer

Its dolphin time!!!. It was best moment in my life. When i had first a interraction with the dolphins.. Got a kiss from the dolphin... Its was a fabulous day with all my friends in dolphin bay..Amazing experience with the dolphins...but quiet expensive. They have a half hour orientation before entering to the water. The trainers and the staffs are really helpfull and polite.You get have half and hour interaction with the dolphins... Which i feel is very less amount of time. If you want to take photos.. They have their own photographer who captures the memories and do sell it for a good price.. You get to hug, kiss, touch, and dance with the dolphin.
Dolphin Encounter. Great day, we did the dolphin encounter an really enjoyed it. We were taken in a group of around 15 people and introduced to the dolphins. They also posed with you for photographs.

Amazing, Fantastic, Awesome family treat. We were lucky to have this organised during our stay at Atlantis. We can not thank all at Dolphin Bay for all the amazing work they do. A special thank you for the use of the beach wheelchair allowing our daughter to participate in the Dolphin Experience. Magical time playing, dancing and kissing Sol the Dolphin. So fantastic and emotion I found myself tearful when our time with Sol was over and we had to say goodbye.

Dolphins & Sea Lion wonderful experience. We went to Atlantis Palm in Dubai for a short stop on our way to Maldives.Our little family is fond of sea of any kind.The show we share with dolphins and sea lions at dolphin bay was top we have experienced so far (already 5 five of that kind before)Well organized. Warm welcome. Very professional .

Awesome experience...but costly!. My husband and I booked the dolphin encounter in late February. Our booking was for 9:30am so we were in the first group of people to go in the water. We were first taken to the change rooms and then through to the orientation, all by very friendly helpful staff. For the actual encounter, you are divided into groups of roughly 10 people, After being given strict instructions on where you could, and could not touch the dolphin we were allowed to kiss the dolphin, hug it and then dance or play with it. The trainers were very knowledgeable and seemed to have a good relationship with the dolphin. I found the actual encounter a little short for the hefty price paid, as it probably lasted 30 mins for all 10 people. Thereafter you are given complimentary drinks and use of towels. To purchase photos of the encounter was a little bit of a shock...the price is AED100 for one photo! All in all it was an awesome, once in a lifetime experience but I am still not sure if it was worth the price!

The best experience of all in Dubai. Dubai is kind of like Las Vegas, it all flashy and shiny but very little of it is authentic. Except for the dolphins.This was a memorable experience and absolutely the best thing we did in Dubai. I definitely recommend this, especially for the kids.Basically you sit in a shallow pool and play around with a dolphin learning stuff about them under the supervision of instructors who are very friendly!One little note though, the price of the pictures is a rip off. The Dolphin Encounter experience costs around 700 AED (175 €) per person if you book ahead, but nowhere it is mentioned that you must pay for the pictures separately. A USB stick with 50 pictures costs 550 AED (137,5 €)!!!

Dolphin encounter. I highly recommend this to all family's! We had a great day! We had a four year old and 2 eight year olds and a 10 year old.They provide you with all that you need. You get a wetsuit or a floating vest to wear and all the soft drinks you want.The only thing I can really complain about is the price of the pictures they sell you. Since bringing your own camera is not allowed.

Great encounter. Our family had the opportunity to meet Tulagi, and her trainers. Though our youngest was quite scared of the dolphin both trainers went out of their way to make her comfortable and at home with Tulagi. Definite must do while in Dubai

Memorable experience.. This was my first experience with dolphin. I could never believe a dolphin is doing all that action. really wonderful experience. From somewhere I read that dolphin an Intelligent animal but now a day I have also feel that.

Awesome Experience. Just an amazing experience. We are a family of 5 with three teenagers and the half hour in the water with our dolphin and trainer was certainly the highlight of our stay in Dubai. Expensive, but it also gave us a full day at the waterpark which was superb as well, so a really full and exciting day highly recommend it!!!!
great expierience!. Dolphins are very cute) All actions are very good organized, we had Royal Swimm, that was extremly cool expierience! Dont think about, try it! :)

Wonderful experience. We did the Dolphin encounter with our two children (aged 6 and 8). Everything was done very professionally from the orientation to the trainers in the water. Our girls absolutely loved the experience and the trainers were fantastic with them. It lived up to expectations.

A must do in Dubai!. Did a shallow water experience with my wife and two little children . The trainers were very nice to us and helped the children to relax and interact with the Dolphins . It was an experience of a life time! We all enjoyed it very much. It's expensive but worth it. We also had lots of fun at the aquaventure for the rest of the day !

Very well managed and a fun experience. I tagged along with a buddy who had been eager to try this out. We opted for the basic dolphin encounter, which was still great and allowed up to get up and close with a dolphin. The entire experience was very well managed and the dolphin we played with seemed well cared for. The facilities are very well kept and massive! My only word of caution is be prepared for lots of young crying children; it is definitely a family-focused venue.

Very expensive and over rated. The experience wasn't up to normal standards within the Palm facilities and far too many people booked together making the experience very impersonal indeed, don't waste your money until they stop being greedy.

A fantastic hands on experience!. Lived up to the hype, taken care of really well throughout with very knowledgeable staff. We undertook the dolphin adventure including a kiss, hug, hand spin, and belly swim across the lagoon. The dolphin trainers clearly care for the animals and have developed strong relationships with them. Brendon and Jenny were great as was 'Hilma' our 14 year old dolphin. Would highly recommend to anyone who like me has this on their bucket list.

One thing off my bucket list !. Interacting with dolphins has always been one of my biggest dreams. The Dolphin Bay was the best option for me as I do not swim and swimming with dolphins in the sea would not make me comfortable. The environment is very friendly, and the whole experience is really fun if you want to get really close to those beauties of nature. Every participant is given a quick training on how to interact with the dolphins, which I think is a good thing and the trainers looked experienced. The experince is ideal for small groups and also children, and you can choose to swim with them or only interact and play tricks/dance with them. I had a bit of doubt before going as I am against the idea of animals in cativity in general... but I saw that they were treated, trained, and fed well. A bit expensive however for a less than an hour experience but worth it as it's a unique experience and you also get access to the waterpark and a few other things with your ticket.

Once in a Lifetime. We chose the Dolphin Adventure, quite expensive but to us worth the money being pulled along by Jasmin. The ticket also included the day in the water park which was a good addition.

Wonderful encounter!. Waited many years to do this encounter and wasn't disappointed! We were welcomed and spent some very peaceful interaction with a wonderful creature and great staff, it was a great time spent and I would highly recommend it to anyone wanting a calm interaction experience in a small group. very informative also.

once in a lifetime !!. first a long introduction , this is needed to know wath to do once you meet the Dolphins ; the feeling you got wen leaving this attraction is worth every penny . Kissing a dolphin makes you feel totally lost ... like the first time kissing your girlfriend !!

Worst. It is just like a cheating center in palm jumeria. They charge 790 AED as a entry ticket.After that, they show you dolphin and that's all.Instead of that you should visit Dubai Creek and see Dolphin Show.

What a wonderful Experience. We did the shallow water experience with small children (22 months old and almost 3 years old). Was a fantastic time and enjoyed by all however the introduction was too long and tedious for smaller children. We saw most parents heading outside with their kids after the first ten minutes or so. Souvenirs were expensive (as expected) but there were plenty of options and the photographers were good.

A must do!. Keep in mind that Dubai excels in organising activities with surgical precision and professionalism. The result is total customer satisfaction!!!The dolphin encounter was worth every single dirham spent!! Excellent facilities, gear and briefings. Saying that our 8 yo old was the only one who enjoyed it, wouldn't be true...All of us enjoyed it thoroughly.The only down side was at the end at the "photo" collection counters...A messy, confusing and extremely expensive experience...1 print @ 75 Dirhams (+/- 20$) waaay exaggerated

Good luck to get a picture with any dolphin. without paying 100-500 UED, for ur pics u will never any picture...enjoy touching a fish and kissing a fish and thats it....u can take picture or selfie you outside or inside the location, thats it...other wise , wasting ur time ,money and nothing more..so coming to atlantis and going back to ur hotel 200 dirham at least with 200 dollars...means 250 dollar for 1 hour swiming, plus free entrance for aqauventure ..anyway with this money i payed my flight from europe to dubai back to europe..think wise

"Heart broken at the cost of photos". What a special experience. A belated Christmas present we had been looking forward to for weeks. Dolphins and staff were incredible. When we went to get us photos the packages and individual costs are a complete rip off. Us$30 for one printed photo but they charge extra if you want a soft copy. Over 30 photos of you taken which are all precious and memorable but if you want a USB you are limited on how many and charge you Us$ 150 ( almost as much as the experience itself. )We ended leaving sad we only got a photo each.
Different. Its very different and amazed experience, here u can play with dolphins, and u can got its tickets in some cheap with emairats airline website, got it
Good one for the kids. Kids will enjoy the Dolphins show. May have to wait in the Q for long time. So, please plan accordingly.
Beautiful. Lovely place, beautiful view, peaceful environment. enjoyed a lot with family. Helpful staff but for my family felt No one to talk with in Hindi.

Privilged private viewing. Just by sheer chance, when we asked about Dolphin Bay at the ticket office, the lovely boy on duty took us to watch the dolphins having a training session. It was beautiful and we were truly privilged to witness the session and to have such a well informed, knowledgeable and charming escort into Dolphin Bay.

Great time learning about dolphins. Young or old, this one attraction leaves fond memories of one's interaction with the Friendly Dolphins. Very nicely maintained, professionals at work, one can see the efficient way things done in this place. One should be reaching 15 mins. early than the appointed time, otherwise one may miss the event itself.Due to traffic we got delayed and missed, luckily rescheduled to evening.Had a great time understanding about Dolphins, interaction with them, lightly touching them also. Good thing about this is the Photo session.

Out of this world !!!. Dolphin experience was a treat to our nephew who was turning one on that day. We were 4 adults and 5 children altogether and it was AMAZING....We were given a short introduction with some information on different types of dolphins on arrival and asked to remove any jewellery. All of my kids enjoyed swimming, singing, dancing and playing with our dolphin, who was the youngest (5 years) among all. She was well tamed and very friendly with all.The dolphin "Lily" sang Happy birthday song to my nephew too..;-)They provide cold drinks and towels after your excursion.

A must do during your visit!. Fantastic interaction with the dolphin within a small group and doing the "Royal Swim". The trainers are genuinely happy to pass on their knowledge about these wonderful creatures and the whole setup from start to finish is well polished. Just wish we had longer!!! Free entrance into the waterpark afterwards! Will be back again.

Great experience with the kids. Four of us first went last yearThis holiday season I'm back with another 7 members of my familyPaid for us all to do the deep water experience Eye wateringly expensiveKids got a lot out of itI'm always a bit torn with the whole intelligent wild animals in captivity thing, that said the kids were absolutely blown away and left with even more respect for these beautiful and intelligent mammalsLike I say, it just jars a bit how much money is being made vs how much science is really going on?

Good but they get you. The whole experience was ok with the dolphin and the staff were great, you will enjoy yourselfNow they get you, they take 60 photos, the usb photo package only has 15 photos for 500aed. For all the photos you need to spend 850aed on the usb and 12 prints. Wait 1hr and queue again.

Rushed Encounter. Spent most of the time queuing for wetsuit as there was only 1 member of staff handing them out. The orientation which I was finding interesting was then cut short. The actual Dolphin encounter was very good, but felt there wasn't enough time and that more than 1 ride could have been done as it didn't last very long, especially considering the cost.

Awesome and magical. These two words spring to mind. Best Dolphin experience I've had so far. I recommend the Royal Swim, although IT's a bit expensive. Tip: bring a waterproof watch if you visit the waterpark before your Dolphin experience, since there are no clocks in the waterpark. Tip 2: there are lockers at Dolphin Bay, so take your cash or credit card with you for the great photos they make.

Nice experience ... Very Nice experience with assisted and supervised by well trained coaches .. you cay swim, play and take photos with those amazing Dolphins .. highly recommended and don't forget to take good shots before you leave ..

I kissed I dolphin and I liked it ☺. I joined the dolphin encounter there. The staff was helpful and explained everything very well. With a small car they drop you there right in front the building. Every dolphin have a group of 6 people like that. You can dance or play ball with the dolphin. I choosed the ball. I loved it. It was a great experience there and I would book it straight again. It looks like the team cares a lot about the dolphins. They have good relationship. It's an adventure for the whole Familie. Go there ☺ it was really memorial day for Me

A unique experience, although a little expensive. So, you can tell people you swam with Dolphins after this one, which is cool. Although, the experience itself is not mind-blowing. Water is usually a little bit cold - best done around summer months, when the rest of Dubai is a Sauna. It's a little pricey, but how many times do you get to swim with dolphins? The royal experience is not all that - the mid-option is excellent.

Its a pleasant experience. We did the Dolphin bay this week. There are two packages. One where you swim with the Dolphin and the other where you are kneeling down till your neck in the pool with the Dolphin. Personally, I did not see the difference. One is on a shallow end and one is on the deeper end. Both places you get wet completely cause the Dolphin splashes you with water and you have kneel down to take a picture with it. Also, its better you leave everything in the room- if you at staying at the hotel. You are not allowed to wear any jewellery or hair accessories including hair ties. Your hair is going to get wet. I thought it was nice. They do small tricks with the Dolphin and you get to know some information about it. I suggest doing the first program of the day at 930 am cause it is relatively more private and quiet. The trainers are good and can speak well. Over all a good experience.If you are hungry and it is very early in the morning- there is starbucks right in the area for a sandwich!

amazing experience - fabulous space. the Atlantic was an amazing day trip, one of the best water parks Ive been to, and Dolphin Bay was the highlight of the day. fantastic memories and great pictures to capture the moments

it was a nice experience and you get free admission for the day to water park included in the price. I agree not cheap but the dolphins are in a large lagoon...unlike the downtown dolphin experience.. and it was a rare treat to spend time with these beautiful creatures,The facilities were really good, the trainers very friendly and the dolphins amazing, with a baby dolphin zipping across the lagoon as you were in the water.Really enjoyed the deep water experience, great photos and the water park looked fun, but busy and was included in the price.

Great experience. I've always wanted a dolphin interaction and was left with great memories!!My mum was able to accompany me as an observer. She was allowed to take photos but from a distance (and was not allowed to enter the water).Would recommend for all ages!

Very special experience!. Great fun! Would recommend everyone to have a try! :) But the Dolphin Encounter is enough, no need to go for Dolphin Adventure if you just want to have some fun and take some nice pictures.

Everlasting experience!!!. Something which was you see on TV but thrilling in real life.. They give a Little lecture which is very interesting at the beginning. Followed by an extraordinary encounter with a dolphin. Wished it was longer! Drinks came included.. Some good would have been nice.. Something to always remember!!

Bucket List Tick. It's one of those cliche things that you always hear, but after getting the chance to interact and play with a dolphin and watch them jump out the water you really feel like you've had a once in a lifetime experience.The Dolphin Encounter was run brilliantly, we were all provided with wetsuits/vests and given a safety briefing. We then went into the bay in groups with our instructor to meet our dolphin.The whole experience didn't feel rushed at all, we had plenty of time learning about our dolphin 'Lexi', starting by stroking her, then taking it in turns to hold, kiss and hug her.We then had some fun splashing about and learning about dolphins, before we all had a chance to either dance or play fetch with Lexi.Then after we had got changed, refreshments were provided and we made our way to view our photos taken by a photographer who had been present for the whole experience.The trainers were all super friendly and enthusiastic and were great at dealing with younger kids as well as some scared adults.Definitely recommend that everyone try and do this.

Great experience. you could touch the dolphins and dance with them.it would even kiss the cheek.they have trained the dolphins very well.Only the price is a little on the expensive side.But if you can afford ,it is once in a lifetime opportunity.

Expensive and over rated. £200 for 30 mins with dolphins with a group of people is a rip off. Disappointed but i guess it was on my bucket list so i had to do it. There is a dolphin place in Downtown Dubai and i believe that is cheaper.

Amazing. This dolphin experience is well worth the money. We did the full royal swim which means you get pulled along by two Dolphins and you do a high speed push off by a dolphin. You also get to do loads of hugging and kissing and general interaction with the Dolphins. Best experience ever. We did pay extra for the photos but they are worth it.

Dream come true. Has always been on my bucket list. A wonderful experience that I will not easily forget.A little commercial and not quite as intimate as I was hoping for. Still something I shall never regret doing.
Fun. Super fun adventure. The staff there was helpful and the dolphins were great, very friendly :)Would recommend this to everyone, children and adults.

First time experience for my better half :). This was a surprise present for my wife on our visit to Dubai. She loves animals and she is a good swimmer, so I knew I was to score some points with this lol.anyway, the whole set up, from the moment you arrive till the moment you leave, everything is simply amazing.The cuddles, the kisses the ride with the dolphin left a memory of a life time.The added bonus of day entry to the water park is simply great way to finish a memorable trip to Dubai

Best experience everrrrr. Dolphins Bay in Atlantis the palm resort is a must try. It was my childhood dream to swim with the dolphins and i finally did it!!! Perfect encounter with professionals in the field to keep you and the dolphins safe. If you cannot swim, you can chose the option to simply encounter the dolphins in shallow water where you can touch them and kiss them without the swimming and spinning part. You will not regret it.

Amazing morning x. If you can , I would recommend coming here while staying at thehotel, for 3 of us it cost around 400 pounds, but it's worth every penny, this was for the dolphin encounter, in shallow water.
Lifetime expirince. Fantastic experience for affordable price. Great activity as for adults as for children. The only bad point is price for photos they take.
Heavily overpriced. For a family of 5 (3 small kids) you spend more than 1000 USD and other 200+ for photos. It is great for small children, but should be priced differently. Poor value for money.

Amazing up close encounter with dolphins. My boyfriend bought me a Royal Swim for my birthday at Dolphin Bay. I loved the belly ride and being towed by th dolphins. It was an amazing up close experience and I would definitely recommend it. Next time I would like to try the dolphin scuba diving so I can see these animals as they swim along
Amaizing. It was a wonderful experience! The stuff was kind and helpful. The waterpark is beautuful as well. Thank you!

No Dolphin Show, only interaction. It is located at one corner of Aqua Venture of ATLANTIS.When we went there, there was no Dolphin show. Only Dolphin encounter, in which they let you touch the dolphin for AED 650. If you find this price affordable then only review other family packages, which are quite confusing in my opinion, and pricey.

Amazing Experience!. The dolphin experience at Atlantis resort is a great way to spend the day! You will get to interact with the dolphin one-on-one as well as in a group setting. The trainers were informative and very friendly. Included in the ticket admission price is the waterpark and access to the Aquarium. You can really make the price of the ticket last you the full day. One recommendation would be to avoid the summer months. You will be out in direct sunlight for the experience, although the water temperature is very cool.

Dophin Bay. What a wonderful and unique experience! I had so much fun learning from the trainers and swimming directly with the dolphins. I would highly recommend this experience, even though it was a little expensive.

interactive experiences. Dolphin Bay is less about watching shows and feedings and more about interactive experiences. The Marine Mammal Specialists at Dolphin Bay offer five different interactive options, each catered to different ages and swimming abilities. Each experience includes entrance into the resort’s Aquaventure Waterpark as well.

Amazing experience. Awesome park and rides . Pl keep in mind that they close at 5:30 pm so pl start early !!!
Yummy food and great personal tents available.
Well run. Its a great experience for the kids. I would say it's overpriced and they charge you a lot for pictures.

Unique opportunity to get up close and personal with Dolphins. Very friendly environment both for the animals on display and also visiting families. Whilst expensive it provides a unique insight to Dolphins. Educational and safety briefing is followed by 30 minutes in the water with the dolphins where you are further educated and provided opportunity to sit in the water and get close to these animals. Lots of photo opportunities with the professional cameraman and would recommend purchasing the USB to take home and explore/print at leisure. Unforgettable for the kids.

Worth every penny!!!. Kids had a blast and so did I!! Dolphin bay as 40% off online deals... which makes it quite reasonable. More than enough time spent with the dolphins. The aquatic staff was very friendly, knowledgeable and professional! One of the best things to do at Atlantis

Great Chance to get close to the dolphins. Have been twice - the whole family loves this experience and often asks to go back.The staff are excellent and the experience of interacting with the dolphins is great for all ages

The most amazing experience of our lives!. We had the best time meeting Tulagi the 21 years old Dolphin. The children were mesmerised and they loved every minute of it. What a fantastic experience. Thank you. memories to treasure for life

love it, really good experience. It was the great experience to share time with Dolphines, sweet and smart creature, and know about them. I got to play with them, touched them and donce with them. the end of the session, all the dolphines got together and dance for us infront of the beautiful sunset, it was amazing. It was not cheap but you do not get close to a Dolphine every day. All worth it.

Amazing. We swam in the deep water with the dolphins and it was a fantastic experience. The group was small therefore we had longer with the dolphin. The trainers are very knowledgeable and were able to answer all the questions we asked. The photos are expensive, but the best value is to buy the memory stick with 50 photos this is approx £90.

An amazing experience. We took our nine-month old baby to Atlantis and booked the Photo Fun experience for all three of us. Babies under 2 aren't able to do any of the other dolphin activities - but Photo Fun is perfect. Alongside a parent, they can interact with the dolphin - we got kisses and were able to 'dance'. You get a lovely photo at the end which we will treasure forever.

Loved this experienced. Purchased the summer package for the shallow dolphin encounter with my two children aged 5 and 9 which included food really reasonably priced. Fantastic experience, the down side the pictures are very over priced but had to purchase them due to the once in a life time experience. Very enjoyable experience for children with sensory/learning disabilities very calming. Staff were fantastic and very friendly.

My Dream Came true. I've always wanted to swim with dolphins and i got the opportunity in Dubai.I choose the deep water and not the shallow water. Shallow water is for those who can't swim.Before you are allowed to swim with the dolphins, you have to go trough a short brief with the instructors. They explain were and what to do when you are in the water with the dolphin. Different techniques to make the doplhin come and kiss, hug and play with you. It's really interesting. So the best part, In the water you are in a group of 6 people and there are two photografers on each side of the water to take a snap of your precious moments with the dophin. I had so much fun doing this. If i ever go back, i will definitely do it again. I have my photos as a memory i will cherish for life. My dolphin Yasmin was a stunner. Love her <3

Lifetime memory for the kids. We took the adventure package which the kids enjoyed very much. You get to hug the dolphin, belly swim with her, pet her, receive a little kiss on the cheek along with a few other tricks performed by "your" dolphin. Let the professional photographer take the pictures, they come out really nice. You can have 50 of them on a USB stick for 500 AED.

Expensive but memories created. Yes a very expensive experience (but book online in advance by 14 days and get a slight discount) but it was well worth it as made my daughter happy. I did feel it was all slightly rushed...I had a 3 year old to get changed and by the time we were changed our group had moved on and I didn't know where they had moved on to and we ended up in the wrong place. They really should have checked that they had everyone out of the changing rooms. Thankfully one of the staff noticed and took us to the right place. The photographer did take OK pictures but they don't really care how good they are. Our family photo with the dolphin hug was ruined as my 3 year olds face was hidden behind the dolphin's fin... he could have at least pointed it out and asked me to lift her higher but it all seemed so rushed.....have your turn, quickly get a photo taken and move on. Photos cost over £100 for a USB with all the photos from the session (about 60) and 10 printed photos. For the price it would have been nice to not feel so rushed and have some more time with the dolphin, but still an unforgettable experience.
Kids loved this. My kids loved this. And we purchased some great overpriced pictures. Was very expensive - but thought once in a life-time experience at that price - but had to do.

A Money Making Factory that fails to deliver a "Special Personal Experience". Facility looks great and staff were enthusiastic and knowledgeable. However, the staff's routine with the dolphins is strictly timed and I felt slightly rushed through a tick list of items to do with a dolphin. I did the Deep Water "Adventure" with my 11 year old son. My wife did the Shallow Water Encounter with our 9 year old son. I noticed one overseer hurrying up the dolphin trainer to keep them strictly on schedule. Last year we swam with sea lions in Lanzarote which was less than a third of the price and felt more personal and more fun. It's basically become very commercialised at the Atlantis Dolphin Bay due to the high demand for the activity and fails to make the experience feel as "special" as it could do. Photos are another VERY expensive extra, e.g. AED 650 or c£125 for 10 prints and a USB stick with all the photos of your family on it. You can't blame them for running it as a business, and you do get the impression from staff that the dolphins are very well cared for. How could it have been better? A chance to watch the dolphins interacting with each other. More time doing something resembling "swimming" with a dolphin. Let the customer throw the dolphin a fish. They could have split the customers up across the three pens, rather than having 32+ people all in the same pen with more limited space and it feeling like a factory-style process to make money.

Must do - especially in couples or with kids. I did the Dolphin Swim at Dolphin Bay (Atlantis hotel) on my recent family trip to Dubai. This is an amazing and unique attraction, especially for nature lovers. Although the price is very steep and burns deep holes in your pockets, but it is totally worth it.You get to spend 30 minutes with a Dolphin and have option of kissing it, dancing with it, making it do tricks. The trainers are very amazing and make sure that you do not feel scared.You are not allowed to take photographs of the attraction yourself if you are in the water as they have a designated photographer. However, if there are people accompanying you (Needs a reduced price admission ticket), they can take pictures from a distance from the beach (Can't get in the water). If the zoom length is good enough, there is scope for decent shots. However, I suggest that you take their photographs. All photographs for a family can be had on a Thumb Drive for ~600 Dirhams. The quality of the photographs definitely makes up for the price and this is one experience which you would definitely want for prints etc.The place has good locker and towel facilities. There is also free non-alcoholic beverages at the end to cool off.

Session is ok, picture is a nightmare. Session was ok with a dolphin. Little too much commercial, but great experience for kids the shallow water excersise. Get pictures is a huge problem. Customer service awfull. We selected the USB drive option. In the place you can not check what they are loading to USB. I have checked back to the hotel and of course a completely different family was there. And they always talking about data privacy. So I wrote them an email, but no real response so far just we are looking for it sentences. Not a great customer service for a money what we have paid. No pictures, no money. This is what I call cheaters. Still fighting with them.
must do with kids. must go activity with kids..the trainers are good and know how to keep kids engaged.however book early to avoid disappointment

Brillaint but dont get the Photos. Booked this experience for my Daughter and myself - the staff were fantastic from the moment we walked in - Sarah was our guide and our Dolphin was called Cathy - Fantastic - be warned the staff in the shop and Photo department are completely different - curt and show no interest what so ever, under staffed with the staff that are there looking like they would be anywhere else - shame they let down a fantastic experience.

Over Rated Over Priced Over Crowded !!!. We were lucky enough not to be staying at the Hotel but visited for the day so that my Daughter could swim with the Dolphins, We arrived to queues and that is pretty much how we spent our day, the place was mobbed and I felt as if I was in a Disney Florida in the peak of Summer, We were given no instructions just ushered along the queue and sent on our way. The Swimming with the Dolphins once we found the place was fantastic and I cannot fault the staff that ran the swim with Dolphins - a lady called Sarah looked after our party and she was brilliant. Unfortunately that was the end of our great day out - The staff in the Shop were rude, bad tempered and seemed as if they didnt want to be there anymore than I did, whilst serving us the girl on the till was shouting down the phone that she was due her break and it took 2 hours for our Photos to be processed - in fact it took so long I demanded a refund as was by this point just losing the will - but the best was yet to come honest !!We left the Hotel and went to ask for a Taxi so we could go back to out Hotel but were told 130 UED - when I questioned why the Taxi fare had gone up by 100 UED from the morning was told if you want to pay that rate you have to join the public Taxi queue which we did - 1 Hour 15 mins later we got into a Taxi with the promise we would never in a million years return to that Hotel ever again.

Great experience - appears to care for the dolphins well. Overall, really great experience for all of us. The kids had a blast and the staff was generally great. I attempt to be a considerate consumer, so also looked like the facility was doing a very good job of caring for the dolphins they have on site. Staff were very knowledgeable about their well-being as well and also seemed genuinely interested in ensuring they had a good, albeit, captive life.Experience was great, with a lot of attention given to ensure that kids and dolphins were safe and comfortable. Not the cheapest afternoon, and the picture options are of course expensive, but worth it for a really memorable day.
Nice but too rushed. Nice experience but far too expensive and pictures were very expensive too. This ask so only lasts 30 min if that

Wooow!. Located inside Atlantis the Palm,booked for a swim with dolphins, went on time, there was a welcoming session and then an interesting orientation, complementary drinks were provided, amazing kind staff and trainers, the experience was super nice, i had the chance to swim and play with dolphin Lisa, it was a great thing to try! highly recommend! but price is high to non locals!

Swim with the dolphins. Truly an amazing experience and even though slightly expensive well worth it and would do it again. The dolphins are so gorgeous you just want to throw your arms around them. Very informative and guides very knowledgeable. Not to be missed.

HIghlight of my holiday. We did the dolphin encounter and it was the highlight of my trip. I loved every minute of it. It was great for the kids aged 11 and 8 and I felt it was better than the swimming with the dolphins as there was more interaction.
