My fiance and I enjoyed a morning swimming with dolphins and learnt lots of great details and information while doing so. The group is small enough that you feel like you are having a one on one session with a trainer and it gives you opportunities to interact. The facility is really clean and very easy to navigate to - make sure to get a photo as they are worth it for the memories!

Wonderful Experience. This was a great experience for my 2 children - I just have 1 regret; that I did not go myself. I observed and took pictures from the beach but was so jealous. We chose the encounter and they had 30 minutes in a group of 8 with the dolphin but it was done so nicely that each individual got their own special moment and they ensured the instructors moved out of the way so you could get pictures with just them. The photo packages were extremely expensive so I was glad that i paid to observe and take my own pictures and also to see the pure delight on their faces!
Great Birthday Present. It was a really great Birthday gift to go and swim with the dolphins. Unforgettable memories. The staff were attentive and helpful.

Does what it says on the tin. You pay for a kiss, a hug and a dance/ball/ring, and that's what you get.Some travellers reviewing this attraction seem to be yearning for an individually tailored experience they haven't paid for. The numbers of people they're dealing with mean that a tight schedule and good organisation are key to getting everyone what they ordered (no more, no less).The USB stick is better value than anything else because you get all the photos of your family (and yes, some other people too because you're standing in a line, but most of them are of your family). It's still very expensive... though don't try taking photos yourself.The staff were knowledgeable and bouncy and the experience was fun. We did the Encounter so it was more paddling with Dolphins than anything else.Free entry to the waterpark Aquaventure is nice, but I don't think much of their security/lost people policy, which is thoroughly useless.
Wonderful experience. My daughters had their dreams come true here by swimming with the dolphins. On entering we were greeted by June who made us feel very welcome. The whole experience was worth it.

AMAZING!!. Super professional and friendly staff. The dolphin swim was a bit too short for me. Wished it lasted longer. Thankfully my partner was able to take photos by the beach with the observer pass, as the photos taken by the professional photographer they have, were overpriced, too few and well, I didn't look good in them hahaha.

Dolphin Encounter. We booked to do a Dolphin Encounter via the atlantis website having heard great things from friends. We booked the shallow water experience. We were given a brief talk on the Dolphins and what the experience would involve. We were disappointed to learn we wouldn't be swimming with them. The trainers are very knowledgeable and really look after the Dolphins. We had a dolphin called butterlilly who is 5 years old. We were able to stroke her and play with her but in very strict circumstances ; brief touch/kiss encounters only a few seconds at best. for the money paid we expected more interaction. The photographs are very pricey - we got 3 photos for 225Aed. It may be cheaper to pay for an observer ticket and get someone to take lots of photos for you. The USB sticks with all photos on were 500aed. We still had a lovely day and enjoyed it but really did expect more for the money.
Excellent. The Dolphin Bay was very good for the Kids. They had a fun time watching the show and an even better time in the interaction

Up close and personal to the Dolphins. Once you're past the debate as to whether it's right to keep these beautiful creatures in captivity to perform tricks for entertainment. You will enjoy the experience. Regardless of which package you buy (we did the adventure one), you will get to touch a dolphin and admire how it glides through the water.Tip: Spectators get to watch for free, so if there are two of you, suggest you go at different times (one after the other), so that one of you can take all the photos you want. As a participant, you're not allowed to have a camera with you, which allows the resident Dolphin Bay photographer to charge you a fortune for that memorable moment.

A must "do".. Swimming with dolphins? Nuff said! The animals looked well and happy which was our main concern and loved the attention to conservation. So get over how naff you look in a wet suit and tick it off the list!
Love the dolphin experience. Got to swim with the dolphin, which was on my bucket list. Dolphins were nice, the water park also was beautiful. Service as usual was perfect in Dubai. Loved it

A must do visit. We had a great time here. We paid extra for the deep water swim and was worried about having to tread water for 30minutes, but no need and the wetsuits helped keep you afloat. If you have your photos onto a memory stick you can then add your waterpark photos later in day

The Dolphin Show. Dolphins are said to be the cleverest aquatic animals & when one sees the Dolphin show, it comes true. 3 Dolphins dance, play & perform exactly as instructed by the trainer. a must watch show.
Unforgettable experiance. We got much information about the dolphins and we had always the impression the staff take care for the animals.

You can actually be with the Dolphins. We guys with my 3 year old son went to this place in Jan 2015 and it was a wonderful experince. You get to be with the Dolphine and swim with them and get your photo clicked with them.The staff was very professional and they all had a very nice ambiance of the area. The Dolphin's were very well trained and they were trained in such a manner that even kids like 3 year old could also be near to them with full comfort.Thank you all for giving us the best of the best experience.

A must-do!!!!!. We spend 4 days in Dubai with our three children and chose our daughter's birthday to offer her (and us :) ) a dolphin encounter where we could touch and kiss and hug the amazing mammals. It is a birthday she is not ready to forget I guess (neither are we). It was the first time we got so close to dolphins, and it was beyond our expectation. The dolphins are so well trained, and the staff so nice and professional, so close also that they made the encounter unforgettable. We were able to cuddle and kiss and hug the dolphins, even dance and play with them. Both adults and children were sooo happy and excited!!!! It is an experience worth every single penny paid! Do not miss it... we are just waiting for our three kids to be old enough in order to take the chance to swim with those sweet mammals! (There was an age limitation for two of them this time). A special thank again to the wonderdul staff who took their time explaining and informing and advising. You are amazing!
Awesome. you will enjoy the dolphin show to the fullest. The dolphins are fully trained. The trainers also are very fluent in their task. You will definitely enjoy the show.

Great experience. A very nice experience, good educational info before the dolphin encounter. Nice facilities, good staff.
But very expensive. The photograps of the encounter taken by staff was way to expensive (about 600$ for 20 pics)

A very special 40th Birthday for my partner. Had an amazing time with Danita the dolphin thanks to all the staff and the experience itself. Ok, we are both grown adults but who cares!
Couldn't think of a better way to spend it.
Thank you to all (Hello George)
All the best Anil & Alison

Wow. Absolutely amazing experience!
Both myself and my 9 year old loved every minute!'
Staff were amazing and really loved what they do!
Would recommend to anyone

BEST experience ever!!!!!!!. I have absolutely loved Dolphins since i was a little girl. My dream came true when I met one up close. She was amazing, a young female called Lily. She was fantastic with big friendly eyes and a warm smile. It was absolutely breathtaking. The trainers were great, and gave us personalized, one on one attention. Van and his Cuban assistant were very warn and informative. Definitely value for money when you see how happy and well looked after the Dolphins are. Unfortunately the pictures weren't at a level that i would call "experienced" The memories will last a life time so defo a 5 out of 5 for me!!!

Royal swim. My daughter did the Royal Swim while I purchased a beach pass so that I could take photos. My daughter loved the experience and she could not believe how powerful the dolphins were.There was a good information session before the swim and all the equipment was provided. It was quite expensive but my daughter thought it was worth every penny and she would highly recommend it

OUTSTANDING. I visited dolphin bay for the 9:30 interaction. We had the most incredible experience. Butterfly was absolutely amazing and I could see that she loved being around all of us. The staff at dolphin bay were really attentive and the check in was a breeze. I was lucky to be in a small group of 5. Jenna and Tamra were very informative and catered to our groups needs as we were all adults. I have friends who recently visited and said the trainers were very showy and over the top but I didn't feel that at all. It was intimate and very educational. You can see they really care for the dolphins well being. Definitely recommend it even though it is expensive. It was the highlight of my Dubai trip.

Staff Autocratically imposing views on us. No customer care.. ok, so let's start with the bad. Took wife on her birthday to interact with dolphins. Was met by friendly staff at first. Taken to changing room for wet suit and vest. Upon exiting we met with a person seeking to impose her views on us in a very autocratic and inflexible way.Got yelled at by employee called Chere re wife's earings, jewelry and headband. Previously told by Atlantis staff Abbas that it was ok to leave a few items on. chere yelled, scolded and scorned us with no explanation. Upon asking to talk to a manager she lied flat out in front of us. A friendlier staff came and treated us nicely, to which we happily explained the situation and complied. Airport security is a breeze compared to way Chere dealt with us. Friendly manager went to get Chere to apologize to us and then came back saying Chere refused to claiming this was the normal way she dealt with people. Okay... Then during the swim, the dolphin tail-kicked my wife in the stomach. The result of which was she got yelled at by the trainer, someone called Younis, for claiming she did something that she didn't - yes I recorded the entire incident and wife was not at fault. In pain and under duress, Younis did nothing except force her to wait on the side whilst she got no medical or staff attention at all... The good The photographer and another staff who were not part of the group came by 5 min later and tended to her. Younis was still yelling at her in the background (yes, I have that recorded on video as well). Director Yuri then came by to see how things were going. We explained the situation to him and he kindly said that he was going to get Chere to come and apologize. He claimed she would not apologize and had left to go home, given that she was upset but 5 minutes later we saw her walking around the dolphin bay still peeved. Your experience will vary. As we have seen positive reviews and the not so good. Wish you the best of luck when you get there. It is like most things, all about the money...

Exellent! Must do!. From start to finish the service was excellent.Check in was quick (we booked online) and we were buggied across to Dolphin Bay. We booked the Dolphin Encounter.There we changed and got briefed about Dolphins. I know some of you will be concerned for Dolphins welfare, but these guys really seem to love and care for these Dolphins. They check the Dolphins health regularly and really put the Dolphins first (before our pleasure) We were put into groups (4 adults 3 kids in our group) We had the best dolphin handlers, Carlos & Ismael who were just fun and hilarious! They made the experience for us, and Sol our dolphin of course! They were informative and fun. We were the group that laughed the most and half of us were little kids. My daughter is 4 years old and you never know at that age whether they will freak out or not. The handlers really know how to make kids feel at ease and teach them how to handle the dolphin. We had our pictures taken throughout and left with 10 printed photos and a usb which cost us 650 dirhams. Usb containing 60 photos of the experience. All in all the best Dubai experience we had and we did a lot!One tip, if you do want to book the Dolphin experience, do so in advance! The prices go up quite the later you book.

Not to be missed. My wife and 6 year old daughter loved the experience. It is a great family activity and not to be missed. Of all the activities with sea animals, this is the only activity fit for a 6 year old. You get to touch the dolphins and learn about them. Worth it.

nice. liked the ambiance and cleanliness. the show was great and the services were also good
Keep it up and enjoy

Pricey but nicey. We did a dolphin encounter here and it was wonderful moment with the most friendliest animal species ever. Everything was conducted professionally and it was a value for money since it included the access to water park. Highly recommended for kids. Snaps are bit expensive but if you are travelling with a group of 5 or more best is to buy the USB for AED550 which will have all the soft copies to take home.

Great value Dolphin encounter. The wife and daughter did the dolphin encounter at Atlantis the Palm and it was excellent. They loved it. We watched the whole thing and I have to say, it was great value for money and they got to spend a decent amount of time with their new dolphin friend.
Fantastic. Very good, my little son like itThe place on left view was not fantastic but it's okay. One should think for a place in the middle

Great morning!. I went with my boyfriend and we choose the mid package. We were quite lucky as we only had 5 people in our group including us. I was a little nervous but the dolphin trainers put me at ease. It was lots of fun and a day I will remember. Photos at the end are very expensive but I guess it's once in a life time experience!
sea hunt. may i say wow i never dreamed playing with a dolphin but it happened it dolphin bay wroth of every penny i paid for it

It's OK. If it has been your dream to touch a dolphin then I understand but don't expect much of a swim. Go and watch before you buy, then you will know what it's all about and which option suits you best. Remember 30 minutes with a chat about dolphins at the start which was really informative and being fitted with wetsuits or jackets. Then 30 minutes in the water with the dolphins but in a group. The children we were with loved it. We watched from the free viewing area if you are lucky enough to be in the middle pool.
Amazing experience. I felt it a bit expensive, but worth a visit. If you have big pocket you can swim with the Dolphins, hug them, dance and even kiss them.
Expensive for what you get.. Experience was similar to Sea World but it was more relaxed at Discovery cove with food included. Pre-swim was a little long.
Amazing experience. My two boys (ages 7&8) had an absolutely fantastic time here. The Staff were amazing as was the whole experience.
Memories that will last forever!. Great day, great photos, professional staff and lovely Dolphins, definitely one of the best experiences you can have whilst visiting Dubai.
Dolphins!. The experience was superb! Well worth every penny. Really had fun playing and swimming with the dolphins! Outstanding job Atlantis!

Great experience!. A great experience at Atlantis. Well worth the money and you get your money's worth. The only thing I would say is that online it says that observers need to pay 300 dhs but actually you can stand by the side for nothing. You also don't get any photographs for the price you pay and are expected to pay 500 dhs for a usb with 31 images on there of your experience.
Fun Time!. Dolphin Bay was so fun. Atlantis is beautiful and the waterpark has zip lining, a lazy river, water slides, dolphin bay and you can have your photo taken with the dolphins!

Once in a lifetime. I bought my granddaughter this, as a treat , it was lovely to see her face, however, it did eat into our day in the waterpark, my advice would be to book this either early or the latest one,, it took 1.5 - 2 hours, and some of this was a talk about the dolphins, informative, but I don't think it need to have taken 45 mins. However, it was wonderful to see, and we got some great photos.

Dolphins for Kids. Very well trained Dolphins and amazing dolphin show. Must see for first timers. Kids will enjoy a lot. This place is little far from city and less food options available. Plan your food timings accordingly. Maximum you can enjoy an ice cream.
Super experience for kids. The Dolphins are just a great experience for kids ! Highly recommended. You can touch them, play with them, the experience is really good organised.

Fab fun. This excursion was excellent. I was there with my 2 young daughters and we all thoroughly enjoyed it. There was a chat about dolphins at the start which was really informative and then we got into the water after being fitted with wetsuits or jackets. I'd definitely recommend this.

Unforgetable and amazing experience. We have booked Encounter with the Dolphin programme for the second time because the first expeience was Incredible and we really wanted to do this again. We have played with the dolphins, hug them, kiss them and dance with them. Also we have found out a lot of things about them. The personnel is very friendly and explain YOU in details what to do. The programme is in English language, the water is a bit cold, so we recommend the suit,not the vest, for a better feeling.
Dolphin Bay | Atlantis. Very cool place to visit. Nice waterpark. Very suitable for day trip in Dubai. Meeting the Dolphins is super great experiment. Totally worth the money.

Reminded me of Disney. We booked a ‘shallow water interaction’ and on the day, we attended a short orientation session before meeting Lisa the dolphin. The dolphin bay area is immaculate and reminded me of Disney. The experience lasts around 1½ hours and was very well choreographed. Although around 30 people attend each session, you are broken up into 4-5 groups each with a dolphin to ‘play with’. The water is chilly even in Dubai temperatures, and you are given the choice of wearing a dolphin bay wet suit or jacket. The official photos are expensive but as you can’t take any yourself (unless you’ve paid as an observer), you are a bit of a captive audience.

Amazing experience with the dolphins. Only downer is the price tag associated with it but otherwise it is one heck of a place to be to enjoy the companionship of dolphins. Extremely smart creatures and it is really an experience to go and play with them. May put a hole in your pocket but if you are there for the experience of it, then its a must do for sure!
Swim with the Dolphins!!. Wow, what an experience! A must experience of a lifetime, I have done this the second time...worth every penny, even though a bit pricey!!!

Awesome experience !!. It's was an amazing experience with the Dolphins! You are allowed to dance, kiss n hug the Dolphins post the orientation session. You are not allowed to carry your camera to the dolphin bay, they have professional photographers to get your moments with the Dolphins.. But remember the price you pay for them will burn ur wallet:) it's worth it at the end of the day!!

Educational and fun!. Me and my husband deliberated over this experience as we don't agree with animals in captivity. But our 6 year old loves dolphins and it was her only wish for the holiday. Before you meet the dolphin you are given a lengthy but interesting talk on them. this was great for the whole family (children aged 6, 11 and 14). The whole experience is very slick and well organised and the time with the dolphin is made new and special for each person.

Overpriced. Atlantis hotel certainly managed to create a legend about this activity but having experienced it with my family and kids I can tell that it's more a tight ship spirit, clockwork, that a legend. The price is SKY HIGH for what one gets at the end. Most of the time it is blablabla in the dolphin centre. The stuff tries to win the time making silly jokes and repeating few times the same facts about dolphins.Once you are in the water of the bay at last, it passes by very very quickly. It is a group activity and you don't have a feeling to be in contact with the dolphins. I've got a feeing that the time in the water was more for taking pictures by their photographer that anything else. By the ways the quality of the pics was quiet disappointing. My daughter is 5, so I had to go for Dolphin encounter with her. My son is 10 and he swims well, so he went for Dolphine adventure with the father. They push you to accompany the kids and pay for adults as if they didn't have enough cheap labor stuff to go to the water and accompany the kids. The girl who was leading the activity in the water was quiet rude with us. My daughter behaved very well and was quiet shy and I personally don't care at all about dolphins but the girl spoke to us in the way as if we were aggressively attacking the dolphin. Sincerely I didn't want to touch it at all and found rather stupid what they proposed us to do. My daughter was nearly scared by the aggressive behavior of the coach.My son experienced different package and said that it had been "OK", not more excited than that.For a family of 4 we paid nearly 1000 USD. No, it is not worth of the money.

We Loved Black and Ini. My husband and I visited Dolphin Bay at the Atlantis Palm Dubai and we had the time of our lives. I participated in the Dolphin Encounter program which is done in waist-high water for non-swimmers, children, or those like me who are afraid of water. ;-) My dolphin's name was Ini and I was able to hug her, kiss her, and dance with her. If you didn't want to dance, you had the option to play ball with her. It was so exciting and for my birthday, she sang Happy Birthday to me! I wanted to take her home with me!! My husband participated in the Dolphin Adventure program which is for the more experienced swimmers held in the deeper waters of the lagoon. His dolphin's name was Black and he was able to hug and kiss him. Black spun him around as he pushed his hand and took him on a belly ride across the lagoon. The price for the Encounter was AED 795 and the Adventure was AED 960 for guest who were not staying at the Atlantis Palm. The prices included admission into the Aquaventure Waterpark, so schedule your dolphin experiences early so that you will have time to take advantage of the waterpark that's open from 10am to sunset (approximately 6pm). Another tip is that if 2 or more of you are participating, book your programs separately so that you can take each others pictures as the souveneir pictures that will be sold by Dolphin Bay are quite expensive at AED 80. My husband and I both enjoyed our experiences and can't wait for our children to experience it also.

Lovely Lexi the dolphin. Had the dolphin encounter experience at the Atlantis palm hotel. Really glad I did it. You get to interact with the dolphin more than I realised, plus they also teach you about the animal too. The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable, they clearly love their jobs and who can blame them.

Great Experience. This was always going to be pretty special and it was but i have to say the trainers made it even more so. they were relaxed & joked but at the same time kept you on the right track safety wise! special mention to Sheldon who had us in stitches!

Mixed feelings on this experience!. We had been so looking forward to this and I have to say it felt like a money making exercise. We did the seal lion experience first and really enjoyed this we felt that the trainers priority was the welfare of the seal lions. However I am not sure I can say the same for the poor dolphins:( When we arrived we were shocked to see 6 dolphins in a row with 10 people each. At our slot there were 4 dolphins with 10 people. I feel this is too many people for the trainers to ensure that people treat these magnificent animals with respect. There is a lot of sitting around waiting and queing and I felt guilty that I felt the animals were not enjoying the interaction. Our dolphin Amy had scratches on her face. I would like to think that all this money they are making that they are putting money back into some sort of rehabilitation programme. Think its probably better to just see them in the wild from a boat!

stunning. You get so much more than just time with the dolphins, you are split into groups of 6-8 people and you can touch stroke pet , kiss, dance and hold the dolphins, you also choose which photos you want, and they will give you the best price package, ignore the very high prices they are shown at,

Close encounter with dolphins. Interaction with dolphins is a true interaction; during your experience you can touch the dolphins, you can play with them or even dance with them. The animals are calm and even children can meet them safely

love the dolphins. Spent my birthday at Dolphin Bay, did the encounter. I loved being able to play and touch the dolphins and the trainers were so knowledgable and will to answer any questions. The dolphins are healthy and treated well, and seemed to have as much fun as we did. Of course, like all things in Dubai, the experience was very expensive, but worth it!
Family. perfect for family activity. there is not much to do in Dubai, because is too hot to be outdoors. but this is a nice way to be in the water and the coaches are really nice

Speechless!. Since dolphin are my favorite animals I pleaded my dad to go to the enclosure. Our dolphin was called Blade. He was so adorable. We got to touch the dolphin, kiss the dolphin, through a ball so the dolphin can catch it, dance with the dolphin, hug the dolphin.To finish our experience with the cute, adorable, friend and playful dolphin they did a show they showed of their tricks: jumping, saying bye, making dolphin noises and many more. To any of you who have never shared and experience with a dolphin, I will say this is an unforgettable experience!

A great experience... I was great to see that the marine life were treated with compassion and integrity. My 13 year old loved it - dont buy the USD 20 voucher to watch as you can just over a little fence.

Worth it!. The attraction is pricey but definitely worth it! I took my three year old and he had a whale of a time. The entire experience is an hour long. You touch and interact with the dolphin all the time and they are very friendly.The water was a bit cold for my child so the 2.30 pm slot suited us just fine ! I would recommend it for all children. The dolphin bay gives you free entry to the water park so after the dolphin bay we spent our day there .

Dolphin Delight. During our Easter break, we took our 3 kids to enjoy the Dolphins. 3 of us on the Adventure and 2 on the Encounter. Obviously not a cheap activity but simple to book, brilliantly organised, really friendly and engaged staff and most importantly a lovely up-close experience with the wonderful Dolphins. If you accept the pricing, ignore the photo nonsense and take advantage of the free entry to a Aquaadventure, they do this day very well indeed and its a 'memory maker' that is easy to recommend. Good fun.

An experience of a lifetime. Great experience for kids of all ages. I took a shallow water experience with the dolphins along with my 1.5 year old son and he had a great time. The staff is doing a great job to make it a very memorable experience for all who opt for it.

Great fun. My sister and I swam with the Dolphin it was great fun although pricey, it was her birthday present. People not swimming have to pay to watch from the sand. Photo's are pricey but there are some deals. Had the Dolphins do some great things in the hugs and kisses also was pushed ashore holding a board and the nose of the Dolphin pushing your foot.
Great Experience. the kids really loved this experience although we felt it was too short. They learnt a lot about the dolphins.

Fantastic Dolphin Encounter. Amazing experience of playing with the dolphins. The session is tailored for families and everyone, including kids, has a chance to play with the dolphin. Something really worth doing.

Expensive but worth every penny. Took the kids to swim with the dolphins and spend the day at the park.
What a magical experience swimming with dolphins is.
The water park is also fantastic, only negative is the price of the food whilst you are there.

AMAZING!!!!. Took my 85 year old mum to the Dolphin Encounter. This experience is for non swimmers but you can also do the swim or snorkel experience.The staff were absolutely fantastic and really looked after my mum.Wet suits were provided and a safety talk before the experience.The staff are really knowledgeable and are happy to answer any questions.The group we were in only had 6 people and the other groups were small too. I've swum with dolphins in Cancun but it wasn't even close to the experience at Dolphin bay. It was so clean and the pools are massive. Would definitely recommend to anyone.Thanks to all the staff for your help with mum!

Brilliant. Staff were amazing and very knowledgable and were really great with the children. It wasn't overly busy so they allowed us a little more time with the dolphins than usual. Our eldest, (four), absolutely loved it.

Dolphins will dazzle you!. This is an epic experience! If you like\love animals\fish, this is a must do! It's a tad expensive though once you do this activity, you will forget all about the money spent and return with cherished memories of the whole experience!You are up, close and personal with the Dolphins for almost 30 minutes!You get to pat, hug and kiss them! Also dance with them! :)It's a superb experience!

Quite Simply Amazing. To meet a Dolphin is something I have always wanted to do. On our recent visit to Atlantis The Palm, my dream became a reality. It was a Birthday present from my husband.The whole experience was overwhelming and amazing.On arrival, you get a wetsuit then a talk/orientation, with interaction both ways, about the Dolphins from some amazing people who care about these wonderful mammals.You are then taken in groups (ours was a group of 8) into the water to meet a Dolphin.There is a photographer who takes lots of photos, which you can later purchase. Not cheap, but well worth it. Everyone in our group said their experience was amazing and something they would never forget. I read an earlier review encouraging people not to go here? The reviewer did not believe Dolphins should be kept in captivity - my question is, why on earth did you visit this place if that's how you felt? Were you expecting the Dolphins to swim in from the sea? Anyway, each to their own I guess.Personally, my experience at Dolphin Bay was wonderful and lots of others said exactly the same.
Good for Children. This is a good place to visit, especially Children as they are mesmerized by the performance of Dolphins and will surely love it

Best experience. We did this as a family of four and my son and daughter absolutely loved every minute of it. The dolphins are so very special and really friendly. This was a great experience which I would definitely recommend
Do play with Dolphins. Its pricey, but its great experience and fun. And don't forget to take pictures taken by professional photographer.

Such a treat. This was one of the best birthday presents I have ever gotten. There is just something so special about interacting and swimming with a dolphin. Process:- They provide you with a wetsuit, give you a quick briefing, and then allocate a maximum of 6 people to one dolphin (they group likewise people together). - Everyone will go into the water, and one-by-one you will have your personal experience with your allocated dolphin. Our dolphin was Lisa and she was such a star. - There are professional photographers taking photos of you all the time as you are not allowed to take a camera with you into the water (dangerous for the dolphins).You can collect (buy) your photos from their kiosk after you session. It isn't cheap but definitely worth it, and luckily you can also get your photos on a USB flash drive.- Afterwards they provide you with soft drinks and you can also stick around to watch the next session if you want.Tips: - When you book the Dolphin Experience you also get free entrance into the waterpark :)- Go early so that you can enjoy the whole day at the waterpark before or after your dolphin session.- Be on time for your dolphin experience, it just makes the whole experience perfect and relaxing.- There is a nice Starbucks at the Dolphin Bay area. Great for a light snack afterwards (their food is a little bit better than the other takeaway places on the premises). Enjoy :)
Excelent. An excellent experience .... was lovely and i can t wait to go there .. very nice stuff ...The dolphins are awesome .. i danced with Barbie ... ask for her ;)
Amazing Experience. Worth every penny! Very educational, exceptionally well run with a big emphasis on safety for the Dolphins and guests alike. Going for the Sea Lion Experience next time!

Amazing experience!. We spent an unforgettable few hours at Dolphin Bay, myself and my two children (ages 12 and 8) whilst my husband was able to spectate and take photographs from the "beach". We did the Dolphin Adventure which included a brief introduction and orientation, some nice (dry!) wetsuits and a couple of instructors per group of 6 people. Our instructors were really good with both the dolphins and the people taking part, they had a good sense of humour and we never felt rushed.I would say that if you are thinking of taking young children then ensure they are a good swimmer because the life jackets won't hold them up in the water and they are required to tread water for quite a while.The photos are obviously expensive but you don't have to buy them there and then if you are staying in the hotel. We got a few in a package with some of the other photos we had taken around the hotel and water park.My son especially couldn't stop grinning the whole time and now wants a dolphin for Christmas!

Fantastic experience...but expensive. My wife wanted to swim with dolphins for her birthday treat..and this is the place to do it. The orientation and getting on the wetsuits takes 45 minutes and then wow...what a delightful privilege it is to interact with these beautiful creatures for 30 minutes!Each dolphin has a group of 6 which means you get a fantastic opportunity to dance, hug, kiss and even ride on your dolphins belly. We actually found it quite emotional because they are so intelligent and are happy to interact with you.As said in other reviews, the photos are expensive but what option do you have? Just take a deep breath and enjoy taking away your souvenir of a memorable experience. We thought the best value was the memory stick with every photo on it for 500 AED.One bonus is that your dolphin ticket allows you to enjoy the Atlantis water park for the day and it is a lovely place.

The very sad truth..... I visited Dolphin Bay last week. I was staying at the Atlantis and it had always been something I wanted to do, as Dolphin Bay was short walk away I booked up for the Dolphin Adventure.I came away from the whole experience feeling sad and ashamed. The dolphins are truly amazing, they are really are, but there was something unnatural about being with them in these man made surroundings where they trained to do tricks for fish.The staff and trainers at Dolphin Bay clearly care a lot for the dolphins enjoy their jobs. They do their best to make sure the experience is a memorable one but that didn't stop me from feeling like it was wrong.We have to stop buying tickets for these kind of experiences, as we are endorsing the captivity of these wild animals for our own pleasure and these corporation's financial gain. These animals should be left to live fulfilled lives in the wild. I apologise to Dolphin Bay for the negative review but I just cannot condone the captivity of these animals.

Amazing Experience. We did the Royal Swim at Dolphin Bay at the Atlantis Palm Dubai and thought it was a great experience. Even though it was on the expensive side it was worth it as it is a once in a lifetime experience. We also had free access to the waterpark which was really fun also. Overall we had an amazing day out and would definitely recommend it!
up close and fun. fantastic facility and staff, had a great time with the Dolphins not only a must for kids but for adults as well. highly recommended/

Fantastic experience, worth the money!. My sister and I booked into the dolphin encounter in February and it was one of the best things we did while in Dubai. Yes it's expensive and it goes very fast but for the experience that you're getting, it's completely worth it. The staff are very friendly and informative and the dolphins are spectacular creatures. Our dolphin's name was Ini. You're in the water for about 30 minutes and have a few one on one interactions with your dolphin where a photographer is nearby taking professional pictures. The photos are expensive as would be expected but again, completely worth it. A good option is to get all of your pictures on a USB key for 500 dirham - this can work out cheaper than getting several of your favorite pictures printed and takes away the difficulty of having to choose.They supply you with towels, a choice of wetsuit or vest version which I found more comfortable and a choice of water/fizzy drinks.You get a free pass to the waterpark (which is great) when booking a dolphin encounter so it might be best to go early and then spend the rest of the day on the water slides to get good use out of it. You also have access to swimming pools and the beach which has a lovely view of the Dubai skyline.We got a taxi and our taxi driver knew where to go but for one who doesn't you can just ask for the palm atlantis and then take the right turn after the hotel entrance - there should be signs. You then need to walk in through huge doors that have a sign for a restaurant beside them and you'll find yourself beside a starbucks and other hotel shops. Keep following this hall around and you get to the entrance of the waterpark/dolphin bay.

Expensive but worth every penny. Took my two children (7 and 1) we had a fantastic time with the dolphins and in the waterpark Yes it's expensive and yes the pictures are expensive but my opinion is that it is a once in a lifetime experience and well worth the money.Bonus that you get tickets for the waterpark!

Pricey but worth a visit. We recently swam with the Dolphins at the dolphin bay. It was something the mrs wanted to do for along time. We paid nearly £300 for 30minutes of interactions with the Dolphins which in theory was worth it as its something you can tick of your bucket list. However saying that I dont think I would do it again for a second Time for the same price. Definitely a must do once in a life time.

Hectic start, but gorgeous dolphin action!. Completety hectic arrival system - hideous overcrowded & stressful - but once you're in it calms down a bit & then the system works well...The photo choosing situation at the end is a pain. It takes ages & is a bit stressful if you've got little ones. I'd just get 1 pic & have done with it!

A wonderful experience. Being able to touch and swim with these wonderful animals is a wonderful experience. The personnel is friendly, highly professional and the dolphins are treated with respect. Highly recommend this experience!

Great experience. We did the shallow water dolphin encounter. There were 8 of us with our dolphin Jasmine and 2 trainers. The trainers were interesting and informative. We loved being so close and hands on with the dolphin. It's not cheap, but was a truly memorable experience.

Just do it !. My life is different after the memories from the condact with these incredible ,intelligent creatures!The information and training from the instructors,trainers of Dolphins were excellent!kisses,hanging and dancing...with them ,just ..imagine it !touching and feelin the energy of the body of this animal is something out of mind,you feel a telepathy communication with it !If there is only one thing to do in Dubai DO THIS!nd remember it for the rest of your life!

Royal swim not worth the price. Although the staff were excellent, the dolphins were adorable, I wouldn't spend the money for the "royal swim" dolphin encounter. It cost $300USD for about 40 min. in the water with the dolphins. We expected much more interaction - the "swim" with the dolphins was a 20-ft. drag by two of the lovely creatures that lasted 7 seconds.I am happy to report it appears the animals are well loved and well cared for. The environment is lovely. I would check into the less expensive packages as I believe you get the same amount of time.
Back to Nature. This was very informative - a little crazy when we were getting the pre- presentation as kids loud and couldn't really hear. Swimming with the dolphins was really special.

Dolphins!!!. amazing mammals aint it? located at one of the most exquisite locations in Dubai it is one of the most amazing sights to see the mammals perform. However being an animal lover I am not sure I should promote this or not?

Dolphin Patting. Compared to some other dolphin shows this was very tame. Great for people who want to actually pet a dolphin, but there are other places, even in the wild where you can get up close to dolphins. The viewing area was also a long way from the action.

Sea Lion Encounter Was Spectacular. My family of 4 did the sea lion encounter (full wet suites, in the water, with the sea lion). We have done plenty of other wildlife encounters (dolphins, etc) in many parts of the world, but this was the best of its kind we have experienced. We were by ourselves with the trainers and the sea lion and spent almost 40 minutes in the water. We were with an older female sea lion with a lovely disposition, and who obviously loved the attention. We must of touched or handled (gently and respectfully of course) the beautiful creature more than a dozen times each and were able to see / feel the top and underneath coat and the flippers fins. We even even got a whiskery kiss on the lips - which tickled my daughter into fits of giggles.

Worth the Expense. This is not a cheap activity, although a day pass for the water parks is included. This is done well for the volume of people who go. There is a bit of waiting around and quite a painful 'talk' once you are wet suited up. I would recommend a wet suit, you are given the option of just a vest but actually the water feels cold and that was the biggest challenge for my 4yr old. The dolphins are amazing and the trainers seem to be top of their game. Our negative experience was down to the photographers. The system for ordering prints was shocking and I would certainly recommend that if you can, divide and conquer, 40 mins of my life were lost in a queue with 2 fidgety boys! The photo packages look very fancy on the price list too but there is a basic memory stick one, which you get all the photos on so don't waste time watching some inefficient girl print your pics, take your stick and enjoy the rest of your day.
great experience. if you have a scuba diving license you could dive with the dolphins and swim with them under water its a different experience that just swimming with them over water.
WOW. Bit expensive, but worth an experience of life time. Fantastic visit to swim with Dolphins. Need to book in advance
Fantastic experience. You get to kiss, hug, and dance with a dolphin and have a belly ride. The staff are very good and knowledgeable.

Brilliant Royal Swim. We are a family of three with the daughter being age 21. She did the Royal swim while we observed with a camera on the beach. In her words, "I loved it. It was fun, interactive and well run. The staff was great." If you could see the pictures showing the grin on her face, you would know she had a great time. Everyone from the greeters to the trainers were polite and accommodating. The park itself was very clean and easy to get to with the golf carts taking you along the beach. Lockers and showers are right there after you peel off the provided wetsuits. We observed several other types of activities going on, but this swim is the best if you are a confident swimmer.

Encounter. I booked this for my son to do as an experience even though he was not keen on the idea (aged 12). However the kid in me also came out and i too decided to do this with him. I have to say from start to finish it was a great experience and even for my son he said after he would like to do the Royal swim next and loved it all. On paper it seems expensive but there is a discount if you stay in the hotel. You also have access to the water park after. You have the option to wear a wet suit or just a wet suit jacket. Regardless of Dubai temperature the water remains at a constant 24C so can be very cold when you are sat in it for a while. Plenty of pictures taken but be prepared to spend (700AED - £130) because it will be hard to decide which to keep or which to get rid of. We opted for the 10 photos and the rest on a USB so we kept a record of the experience. Fantastic day. My suggestion would be to book a session in the morning. This way you have the rest of the day to enjoy the water park.

AMAZING experience. Like other reviewers have said, this is an amazing experience. The only negative, and it is an imposing one, is the greedy prices they charge for photos. Almost everyone who experiences the wonder of swimming with a dolphin is going to want photos of their experience. These guys know this and screw you big time. I spent close to $250 on photos when the experience itself cost $300. NOTHING beats the feeling of hugging a dolphin, however I got the feeling while I was making new dolphin friends, management had their hands in my wallet taking money for a few pictures. Accept they should charge, but $35 to $50 for one picture?

Overall worth the small fortune to do it. My husband, 3 year old and 1 year old did the 'shallow water' experience. Pros- because we were a family of 4 we had our own private group with a dolphin to ourselves. Lots of fun getting to be so close to the dolphin and my boys really enjoyed it. Also we got some beautiful photos that their photographer took.Cons- super expensive and my little ones were full price even though my 1 year old was held by me the whole time(water too deep to stand)...I think it was around 6 or 700 euro for 1 hour. At least 30minutes of that time was spent in a presentation room learning about dolphins and the changing room getting in and out of the wetsuits. Btw water pretty chilly so I advise a wetsuit for a child rather than a life jacket. The photos afterward that you are of course going to buy if you paid for the experience are also a small fortune. If you have someone to be an 'observer' then they can take pics for you but it was just us so we felt inclined to buy. All in all a lovely experience for my boys but definitely an expensive one:)

Must try experience in Dubai. Atlantis Hotel in Palm Jumairah is not only a hotel, it has many attraction within the huge area overlooking the water front of the Palm. One of the most see attraction is the Dolphin pay. The chance to swim with Dolphin, touch, and being with him in the water is a great experience no one would miss it if living or visiting Dubai. They provide the special dress for this attraction. There are two areas for swimming with Dolphin, one is shallow and another one is deeper and you can chose. I chose the shallow one. The attraction starts with a group of attendees in the water with one dolphin a coach. The group plays with the dolphin and photos are taken all the time. At the end you can collect your photos in hard copy or all the photos on CD, both with extra charge which I think very expensive charge.

Amazing! But book in advance!. Honestly not to be missed. Whether you are travelling with children or not. I was with a friend, both adults and we had a fantastic morning at Dolphin Bay.The session was booked 3 months in advanced for an early session to avoid the height of mid-day sun. We were also lucky enough to be in a fairly small group so had more time with the dolphins.Free entry for the rest of the day is included in the price.Only downside is the cost of the souvenir photos. I had seen this before I booked, and some saying the photos weren't great quality, but we were very happy with ours and bought them all on USB.Do I recommend it? Absolutely!Would I go again? Absolutely!

A dream come true. We had a deep water interaction with Alice the dolphin. It was a dream come true to be so close to such a beautiful and intelligent animal. You can tell how well cared for they are and their handlers have a wonderful relationship with them. During the deep water interaction we got to kiss, hug, dance with, spin around and get a belly ride with Alice. It was all wonderful and very emotional to look into her eyes and be so close. We will never forget the experience thank you. The photos are ridiculously expensive but I knew his before hand so just sucked it up, there was no way we were walking away without those photos!
Swim with Dolphins. Fantastic visit to swim with Dolphins. Not cheap but once in a lifetime. You probably need to book two weeks before your visit to obtain the package you want.

My dream - my moment - Royal Swim. I have always had the dream of touching - swimming with a dolphin. I succeeded even with two dolphins (Royal Swim), and then with my loved once. I swam with wild Dolphins in the Ocean at Mauritius great experience, but couldn't swim so fast, so I could touch, interact with them :) which we could at Dolphin Bay, Dubai. I had to do it.We all took the Royal Swim at Deep Water. We have to admit it is very expensive, but you feel comfortable surrounded with very professional and friendly staff members to make sure the Dolphins and you are safe. The Dolphins seemed good and healthy to me, which means a lot, now they don't have a chance of swimming as free Dolphins in the Ocean.It was an amazing experience, and you could sense the staff very professionally checked us out - for instance to see if we could swim? Well done when we are in Deep Water. The staff kept an eye out for us the whole time, which we greatly appreciated.We had a ball and when we look at our photos, we can see how happy we all look one big smile.A good advise get one to take your photos from the beach - they cost an arm and leg!!!Uhhh.(However it is good photos).Greetings to the staff and dolphins from the two Danes and the Aussie

Lovely experience, kids loved it. Swimming with dolphins is a pretty amazing experience. You get that lovely gooey feeling that comes with interacting with such fabulous creatures in the sun. The only reason it lost the final 5th star is that "check-in" took far too long (Over 45 minutes until we were presented our wet suits) and the presentation prior to the event was weak. The slides were dated, we couldn't hear our presenter at the back of the room and the whole thing was frankly, quite boring. You'd be better off watching the dolphins from the sand.However, once you're out in the sun you forget that bit and enjoy the rest. But the marketing team need to freshen up the first half of the customer experience IMHO.

Magical. We did the dolphin and sea lion experiences and had the most amazing time. The staff were so professional and informative at all times. It is also so obvious how much the staff care very much for these amazing creatures. Dolphin Bay is immaculate and a dream for these amazing dolphins and sea lions to live in. Thankyou everyone, especially Ini - our dolphin- and Molly - our sea lion :-)))

Great experience. We booked the royal swim. Introduction before the interaction with dolphins was very interesting and staff working there did great job. Royal swim was amazing and the dolphins are very well trained an taken care of. Overall experience is a bit pricy and at the end not a single picture was included in the price. And with the pictures their phitographer took were not that great, so that was a bit dissapointing. I would recomend to have someone from friends or family to take the pictures for you because if you want to take USB with all the photos its more than 100 euros.

Best day ever!!. We booked the dolphin encounter before leaving for the holiday, and having got there early they bumped us up to the earlier time slot. We were given wet suits to change into and then had a little presentation by one of the marine specialists about dolphins and what to expect and how to behave. We were then put into groups (ours was a group of 7) and then we went off in the water to meet our dolphins. ours was called Abby. We had 2 lovely guys leading our group. One was called Ewan/Ian(?) and he answered all my of questions (even the silly ones)we were given time for one on one interaction and photos as well group interaction too! half an hour flew by! and I wish the session had been longer. It was a fantastic experience and if you can afford to do it, I'd definitely recommend it. (photos were PRICEY. But having researched and prepared by myself before hand to fork over so much money for them, the blow was a little softer. They also give you complimentary knick knacks if you buy a photo but honestly I'd rather they take ££ off the photo then give me useless free stuff)

great experiance. went with my wife to see the dolphins, amazing attraction indeed. the surrounding are perfect for dolphins, if you have kids a must see and do activated. unlike most countries the size off the attraction is large and lots to see. will recommend o anyone to swim with these lovely dolphins.

a very magical day I will always remember.. Did the dolphin experience, booked one day in advance. Had the most amazing time, staff were so Proffesional, they tell you everything you could ever want to know about the Dolphins.It's immaculately kept, and we sat and watched the Dolphins afterward as they don't hurry you out, which was lovely.Thank you so much Dolphin bay for such a special day.

sea lions. Last year we did the dolphin experience which was lovely.This time we went to the sea lion experience which was even better.We were the only 2 there so we had individual interactionthey are such intelligent animals.It was costly but well worth it.

A great experience!. We took part in the Dolphin Bay photo fun as it was the only experience we could do with our 5 month old baby, but even that was great fun and we enjoyed watching her reactions to the dolphin.Can only imagine how amazing it would be to get into the pool with them which we will be sure to do during our next visit.A must see, especially for young children.

Great Dolphin Encounter!. I went for the dolphin encounter with my 4 year old daughter. The dolphins are such intelligent and loving creatures. We hugged, kissed, played and danced with them. The instructors are very friendly and observant and make you feel comfortable with the dolphins in no time. My daughter loved the dolphins so much that she was not ready to come out of the water :) My husband had an Observer pass, so he was able to take pictures from the beach. There was a photographer who was clicking without our permission. They later sold those photos at 80 AED each which is very expensive.After the encounter, we went into the ladies changing room to change out of the wet clothes. You'll be given lockers, towels and hot water for bathing. But in the changing room there's no privacy while changing clothes.They give you a complimentary can of aerated drink. You also have food-courts there to buy food.
dolphin experience. children loved the shallow water interaction and spouse loved the deep water interaction together with a dolphin ride. Worth the expense.
Dolphin encounter. Please note that you will not be able to swim with the dolphins. No foot push etc. It was a nice experience but quite pricy.
A dream come true. We had the Dolphin interaction, we could have stayed there all day and played. Beautiful mammals and they appear to be very well looked after.

Amazing Experience. Both myself & my wife did this for her 40th, i arranged well in advance over both internet & phone the staff were great, upon arrival you have a briefing with all the do's & don'ts then your led out to meet your dolphins ours was Tina & she was beautiful! the staff are so knowledgeable and you get a whole hour in the water doing different interactions, this is a Must if you've ever wanted to do this its a very special experience & the dolphins live in 5* accommodation too.
great!. Great experience, you can pet, kiss and hug a dolphin, good for kids! Staff are friendly and speak good english, french, arabic.Very expensive!

a dream come true. I always dreamed about swimming with dolphins. When we booked our stay in Atlantis, we immediatly booked our dolphin swim. Time flew by, wish time could stand still! An amazing experience!
Amazing. Liked everything! Ive done it the 2 times I was there. Friendly people, well organised, easy to book if you are a guest at Atlantis.

A bit pricy. Ok, this place can be a bit pricey, but you're in Dubai! I rate this "very good" and not "excellent" based off of the price/value only and not the experience. I opted for the group scuba experience packaged with the Aquaventure Park. I went early on a Friday morning (please not that Dubai's metro does not run on Friday mornings, so unless your hotel is close by, expect to pay a taxi quite a bit). I got there around 0700-0730 and because it was so early (and the taxi drive dropped me off at the wrong entrance to Atlantis) I was given several different directions before finally getting to Dolphin Bay. Once there I had no problems. I showed them my dive card (must have to do the dive experience) and then found out that I was the only one for the morning session!!! I was thrilled because I got the one-on-one experience for the price of a group dive! I was able to shake the dolphin's fin, feed her, get a kiss and get a ride/towed. I had a younger dolphin, Danita, who had a bit of a playful streak. The team took photos (purchased separately) and I walked away with great memories!

Atlantis Dolphin Bay best experience ever. The peace at Atlantis Dolphin Bay is a must. I loved swimming in serenity and synthony with my Dolphin Abby, and hugging and kissing her. Is one of the only place in the world where you can interact with dolphins in such a way, and they are not dangerous as the trainers are really good. Great job from all the trainers, and staff members, has been the best experience of my life. Thank you!

Amazing experience. If you are travelling to Dubai, you should not be missing Dolphin Bay. This is an amazing experience and the price is quite expensive. The interaction with the dolphin is amazing and especially if you have children they enjoy a lot.

Simply amazing. The shallow water dolphin interaction at Dolphin Bay in Aquaventure Park at the Atlantis resort of Dubai is truly an amazing experience! You get a great opportunity to get up close and personal with the dolphins in a small group of 10 or less and you get admission to the waterpark.
Good experience. Was a great experience. The Dolphins are adorable and the trainers are well trained and witty too. Its a great experience and I would recommend it to everyone.
Good Place. We had a very nice experience at Dolphin Bay and the people there. The Dolphins and Seal training at this place were beyond imagination.

great experience. absolutely excellent, friendly staff who gave good explanations, dolphin swimming session focused on the animal not on the fun for the visitors, although it meant also a lot of fun for everybody
Best experience!. What an incredible experience and the best place to do it - not the cheapest price for the 20 minutes you are with the dolphins but still so worth it if you can.

Loved it and apart from unhelpful staff when purchasing photos. The staff were so unhelpful when we tried to purchase the photos after our wonderful experience. For one they didn't speak English and wouldn't explain the prices, only the expensive packages. Apart from that the dolphin experience was wonderful. It's something I've always wanted to do but hating deep water I was very worried but the life jackets and staff were really nice. If you can tread water you will be fine. My husband did cut his foot in the pool too, not sure how but he has a nice little scar from the experience.

It was amazing but not good value for money. The actual interaction with the dolphin was indeed amazing ! Hower when entered the attraction, it was so overcrowded and chaotic ! Even with prepaid tickets the queue was endless and we were charged for a locker. At the actual dolphin bay a lot of time was spent in the briefing room , this was also chaotic and disorganised as the briefing was done to Groups of at least 30 people ! The most upsetting was after the dolphin experience having to wait more then 20 minutes for a shower as the room has only 2 showers . In short the leading to and after experience was a big let down and one to improved.
Excellent. Nothing I disliked apart from too short and expensive. Albeit worth it to experience this fantastic animal
Excellent. Excellent experience for our kids. The whole program was well organized and very professional. We will definitely recommend it to others.

Awesome experience. I know swimming with the dolphins is a pretty generic holiday activity...and a very expensive one, but Dolphin Bay at The Palm was amazing and well worth it if you have the time and money!  We booked in for the shallow water experience as neither of us are great swimmers and we had a great time! We Were wet suited up and in groups of ten lead out to a shallow bay where we were met with a trainer and a dolphin. We were able to stroke, play and hug the dolphin and any family members or friends who did not wish to get in the water were allowed to watch on the beachside.  Plenty of photographs were taken ( all for a charge of cause. We paid 80 Aeds per pic) and all the wetsuit,towel and shower facilities were included. A must for dolphin lovers!

What an experience !!!. If there is one thing to do in Dubai, this is the one!!! The experience of swimming and interacting with this highy intelligent mamal in its own environment, givew you an one in a lifetime experience!!! Book early and go for the Royal Swim (it worths every single cent0!!!
Unforgettable. Amazing experience swim with dolphins.Our dolphin was Jasmine. She was so cute and naughty a bit :)Finally if you would like to swim in cold water, you should come here :))

Uplifting and superb experience. Two adults and three kids. What a thoroughly professional performance by the instructors. One of the participants not too strong a swimmer and nervous in water but instructors adapted superbly and made sure the full experience was offered. They displayed amazing energy and nice humour throughout. Overall great and uplifting experience.

Beautiful. Look, whether you agree with dolphins being kept in captivity or not, we found the experience with the dolphins at Dolphin Bay today absolutely amazingThe environment that the dolphins call home is large and immaculateThe dolphins appear well cared for and the trainers patently care deeply for their chargesThe organisation was top notchThe experiences - we had too types, a shallow and deep water encounter, were both amazing and they teach you quite a bit about dolphins (certainly things I didn't know)Thoroughly recommendOne slight cautionary note is the amount they charge for the photos afterwards - but you're a captive audience I guessWhat worked for us was that we had one parent in each back to back session, meaning they could take lots of photos from the "beach" area

Simply Amazing!!. No words can describe how beautiful and serene this experience is! My children absolutely loved every second of it and spending the time with the dolphin named Kathy was an unforgettable experience for them. She was friendly,smart and gentle,she made our day!The staff was great too making sure we are all calm and relaxed during our session with the dolphins! Expensive- yes! But worth every single dirham!

Amazing experience. We did this for our anniversary and had such a great time! We chose the " swim with the dolphins option" and the group was not more than 6 people so each had quality time interaction with the dolphins. So much fun, amazing pictures, and priceless memory. Cant wait to take our Nieces and nephews in a couple of months! Pricey but worth it!

A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!!. I have completed other dolphin experiences but this far superior.The area that the dolphins were kept in was fantastic, the changuing rooms, toilets and other areas that we were shown were all clean and the staff were lovely.The dolphin trainers were all great, very friendly and happy to answer as many questions, they gave plenty of information about the dolphins before the swim.The swim itself was truly fantastic, the groups were kept small (in ours there were 5) this meant we got more interaction with the dolphins, the range of activities that we took part in was fantastic, a dorsal fin pull & foot push were the highlights.I did the royal swim.My husband paid to take photographs on the beach and we also purchased photos after from the Dolphin centre photographers.
Best feeling ever. Great experience, it's little expencive but you need to try. The dolphin trainers are so friendly and nice!

Worth every penny. Swimming with the Dolphins definitely comes at a cost. But it is definitely worth it. There are a few different types of swims depending on your level of swimming expertise. I did the shallow water experience. The trainers are wonderful-they take every step to ensure your safety in the water. The experience starts with an orientation where you're acquainted with dolphins and their habits and then you go into the water. You're provided with a wetsuit but don't forget to carry your bathing suit to wear under it! Once you're in the water,you get a chance to dance,play,kiss and cuddle with the dolphin. It is an experience of a lifetime. Complimentary soft drinks are provided after the swim. Also,a professional photographer is at hand to click pictures of you throughout the experience. Mind you,the photos are a little expensive when you go to buy them. It's about 80 dirhams a piece. But they do have a few packages available from where you can choose the one best suited for you. One of the plus points is that the cost of the day pass for the Aquaventure Water Park is included in your swim cost. Observer passes cost extra. But all in all,it's definitely something worth experiencing.
Nice Experience. My Children really loved it. it was super amazing experience.if you have the chance to swim with Dolphins then do it! It was quite expensive but worth every penny!

Dolphins. It had to be done, but it was expensive and we seemed to spend more time in briefing room than in the pool with dolphins, but understandable. IT was a good experience with nice and friendly staff and happy to have had the chance to try!
Amazing experiance!. If you have the chance to swim with Dolphins then do it! It was quite expensive but worth every penny!

First encounter with dolphins. The guides are very helpful and experienced, they gave much information about dolphins and the park in general. Good and wonderful experience, will repeat it as soon as possible.

Fantastic. Dolphin EncounterI have always wanted to be up close to Dolphins but I am a Non swimmer.I explained this to the trainer as she gave us an induction on Dolphins before we went into the lagoon all I can say it was the most fantastic experience I have ever had touching dancing even kissed her nose and then learning that she was blind I think the Dolphins name was IneyWill never forget the day thank you

An amazing (and costly) experience. We were in Dubai for only 2 days on a stopover for sydney to London. After whittling down the endless list of things we could do, swimming with dolphins made it and we weren't disappointed. While it can seem pretty expensive, it isn't exactly the sort of thing you do everyday. If you want to buy pictures, they cost 80 dirhams per print or 500 dirhams upwards if you want a USB with them on.That took nothing away from the experience that the trainers and the dolphins gave us though and we would recommend dolphin bay to anyone.
Wonderful experience. We had a comprehensive brief and then spent at least 30 minutes with the Dolphin, it was an amazing and moving experience.

Wow wow wow!. Did the dolphin encounter with our 3 year old twins. The trainers were excellent especially as our son was very nervous. Because of their calmness and encouraging words both our kids had the most amazing time!! It is very expensive but well worth it and you get nearly 30mins in the water. During our time we had many opportunities to stroke the dolphins, a kiss, a hug, throw the ball or ring and dance. The dolphin also did some jumps and showed us teeth etc. There was a good education session as well. We purchased the USB with all our photos for 500.The only warning I would give is that if you have young children and here in the winter, the water is cold cold cold!! Even with wetsuits their teeth were chattering!! But this didn't spoil our fun! ;-)
Not what you might think...a great experience. Never sure with captivity encounters but this was great. Professional, well run and a geninue treat for the kids.

Swimming with dolphins. I was unsure of this before I visited as I wondered if the dolphins were ok in captivity. While I'm still uneasy after the experience (they should be in the ocean, right?) at least these dolphins seemed very well cared for, and the operation was extremely professional. Aside from scuba in the open ocean, it's probably the best way to get up close and personal to these amazing animals.All guests are given a full briefing on dolphin safety and care, and all the do's and don'ts. You get half an hour or more in the water with the dolphins and all day access to the adjoining waterpark is included.

Learn a little and Have fun!. It was a really nice experience you got to learn a bit about the dolphins as well as having a play with them. We did the Royal Swim which was 30mins and in that time we did two exercises were the dolphin pushed and pulled you a hug and a kiss so it went pretty quickly. Only wish you could do more even one on one!

We did the DOLPHIN ADVENTURE at Dolphin Bay at Atlantis Dubai. My partner and I booked the "Dolphin Adventure" and highly recommend it. We went separately at the recommendation of some here on tripadvisor so that we could photograph each other and save on photos, however the professional photos were so great we bought them as well anyway so may as well have done it together! Be ready to fork out over $300 for the package of professional pics if you want them, so between our 2 "adventures" and the photo package it cost us close to $1k, however it was one of those things you do once in a lifetime and treasure the memories and the pics to show them. I LOVE the pics of it. I was disappointed to find out my dolphin was not "rescued" or "bred in captivity". They bought some from out in the Pacific, I think it's the Solomon Islands, and it was probably once wild. Having said that, if it stayed in the Solomon Islands they probably would be even worse off. They do seem very happy and cared for here and the handlers seem very good with them. All in all we had the most awesome day.
Fun times. A perfect family outing! The Dolphins are friendly and love to show off! Children will love the experience!
Quite expensive but worth it. Great staff, nothing was too much trouble, great experience for my 14 year old daughter and dad ..........................
Magnificent. I didn't actually swim with the Dolphins but my daughter did and I just stood at the side taking photos. She had a fab and fun time and would highly recommend this.

Great experience, awesome staff!. We booked the Royal Swim package and weren't disappointed, we spent over half an hour in the deep water with the dolphins, including experiencing being towed across the lagoon with two dolphins' dorsal fins, being pushed across my a dolphin pushing our feet and one to one time to stroke and kiss the dolphins. Photos were at an extra cost but were very good quality and worth paying for.
special friends. We love the experience,but expensive.One photo with the dolphins is 80 aed =17 pounds.They are special,maybe once in a lifetime you have the opportunity to swim with them.
Dubai. If you can afford it do the dolphin bay experice its great - free access to Atlantis water park with booking
Excellent. Nothing to dislike. The process, the staff and the dolphins were all excellent. Go for the smaller group size if you can.

soemthing you have to do but not worth the money. If you are staying atht ehte Atlantis you have to swim with a dolphin but i think the organisers know this. The time spent with the dolphin was limited, you didnt get much for your money. However the staff were very friendly and were excellent with our little boy. So do it but accept that you are not going to get value for your money
Loved it. it was great, the dolphins are so nice and the staff are very friendlyIndeed an amazing experience. A must!!!

Can't Fault Swimming with Dolphins. The crew are all very good at working with the dolphins and making the experience memorable for the holidaymakers. It is Dubai and the health and safety they go through with removal of jewellery and everything else is a bit OTT. The deep water experience is better than the shallow water experience if you are a competent swimmer - this is the one where you can ride on the back of the dolphin.
Amazing Dolphins. The Dolphins were awesome what a lovely hour we spent with the Dolphins swimming with them stroking their tummies was just amazing. Want to go again.

Playing with the Dolfins. Our two years baby really appreciated it. Wonderful experience for adults and children. Ticket gives also access to the aquatic park and the private beach of the Atlantis Hotel.

very safe, well run but slightly contrived. Atlantis Aquaventure is not for me, it's a totally impersonal bling experience and walking through it I thought I had made a big mistake. I'm not sure what I was expecting but it was Disneylike. The Dolphin Lagoon is set apart and not quite so gruesome, but I did find the experience a little contrived. There is no doubt that the staff treat your safety with utmost respect and are extremely good, giving clear instructions. I did the Royal Swim which was expensive but allowed me to really interact with the Dolphins. All the tricks are controlled by giving treats, which is I guess how all animals are taught. It definitely took the wild away from the animal. The lagoon is a reasonable size but still seemed rather cramped. They are wonderful animals and the experience was good, but I think next time I will stick to watching them in the wild.

wonderful Experience. Did the Dolphin Encounter, got up really close and cuddled and hugged a beautiful dolphin . Had alot of interaction would like to do it again. Only downside was the cost of the photos after, very expensive.
Awesome experience. I and my kids had fun swimming with dolphines, they are so beautifull. The trainers are very attentive.
Amazing. Loved it , everything is very throughly explained . lovely experience . better to come in your own swimsuits and get a jacket on instead of their swimsuit .

great experience. Really had a great experience and my kids loved it. Only downsize was that the 30min in the water with the interaction with the dolphins was very quickly gone. Well run activity and when we arrived, we were given and introduction to the encounter and to the dolphin. Very useful presentation. Once in the water the two handlers where very enthusiastic and told us a lot about the dolphins. Close up pictures and a lot of cuddling of the animal. Once the encounter is over you can by some pricey pictures and remember this great day out, with such a great animal.

Very professional AND very expensive. It is an amazing experience to be able to interact with the dolphins. A warning however, the interaction is very limited, strictly controlled and not really "swimming with the dolphins". I would still highly recommend this experience. The trainers and dolphins are exceptional. The trainers are informative, communicative and nice both to visitors and to dolphins. They are highly professional and make the experience unforgettable for EVERY visitor. The dolphins are as you would expect it: intelligent, playful, they execute everything on cue. You also get the firm impression they are treated exceptionally well.While the expensive ticket for the experience may be justifiable, because it involves a lot of expenses both for staff and for dolphins (and they both earn their livelihood with excellent work), the price for photos (for security reasons you cannot take your own photos) is excessive. Unless you adore dolphin-shaped usb keys. Maybe you'd be able to team-up with the others from your group and select all the photos on one key and then copy them, but split the costs.

perfect experience for anyone. first experience with Dolphins - definitely a kodak moment - slightly overpriced but when you're next to the dolphines you forget about it all and enjoy the moment - amazing

Dolphins. Wow, this is most awesome, this dolphins are like humans, they act and displays like humans, their level of understanding to commands is wonderful, Infact they do all kind of things, it is a must witness for tourists in Dubai.

amazing experience. amazing experience with the dolphin encounter definitely worth the money although it is very expensive. pictures should be a bit cheaper £80.00 for a UBS full of the pictures is very steep!staff at Atlantis very friendly and informative, next time would do the dolphin dive.

Amazing. We stayed at the ATLANTIS so had a good rate, but my partner and I had always wanted to swim with them. We choose the adventure package and were not disappointed at all. Staff were excellent, very informative and we felt as though they gave us a first class time. Excellent value.
Swimming with dolphins. Great fun, well organised. Not cheap but we all loved it. 5 in a group and plenty of hands on time with the dolphins in deep water. Shallow water options for younger children
Bad service. Not enough signs , security staff herd you which is unacceptable, seems very dis- organised, However the dolphins were amazing, as was teh education center,
Magical. We did the Dolphin Adventure. It is pricey but completely worth it. The experience is really well organised and explained. Swimming with the dolphins is magical. Do it if you can...
