Wonderful Experience. We took the Dolphin encounter package with our two small children we loved it the dolphins are amazing and so clever. It was an experience not to be missed whilst in Dubai.

One of the best experiences I've ever had !. I've never thought that swimming with the dolphins might be something special, but after the session was over my previous thoughts got destroyed ! It's one of the best things I've ever done ! The place is amazing, the coaches are very friendly and very professional. Definitely recommend it for everyone, doesn't matter how old you are, the dolphins will put a smile on ur face :)

Dolphins!. What an amazing day and dream come true to swim with Dolphins! As always, everything was very well planned and the experience was wonderful. The only thing that let is down, was the price of the photos!

swimming with the dolphins. We were in Dubai for leisure and heard about the Dolphin Bay at the Atlantis Hotel. We went out there one morning and signed up. So much FUN! The instructors give you a history of the dolphins and instruct us how to behave around the dolphins. Lockers are available and you change into wet suits. There were three dolphins in the lagoon. The instructors gave us a lesson on what to do while in the water with the dolphins..At one point two dolphins came up to each of us, one dolphin on each side. You then grabbed hold of the dorsal fins and off you went - being pulled through the water by dolphins. Another time, we held onto a Styrofoam surf board, straightened out our right let. A dolphin then came up and pushed us through the water with his nose pushing on our foot. Great experience. There were around nine in our group that morning and all had fun. Pictures were taken during the outing and available for purchase afterward. The cost of Dolphin Bay also got you into the water park. This is not a lazy river type water park. They have an abundance of different 'rivers', some with rapids up to class three along with many rides going through chutes. It was a great way to cool off. Places to eat were also available, as were rental lockers.

Swim with Dolphins. Fantastic experience with staff that obviously love the dolphins. We were able to interact with the Dolphins while learning about this amazing creature. The staff were friendly, helpful and the water park is a fun way to spend the day.

Very helpful - arranged the perfect proposal. As stated, very helpful staff, arranged for sole use of the dolphin pool (& Tina the dolphin) to help pop the question. Facilities were very good as were the pools etc for the dolphins. All appeared very well kept with pletny of space

Wow what a day, now to convince the kids it is once in a lifetime. £500 for a day out for the 4 of us has got to be classed as a lot of money in anyones book. But what a day, the staff throughout the park, especially around the dolphins were fantastic. Everything is run like clockwork, and although very commercial it is also quite intimate. We were put with another family of 6 so the 10 of us 'shared' a dolphin (Lily) for the Dolphin encounter package. We all got to have lots of photos taken by the in house photographer, both individually and as a family group.We purchased a memory stick with all the pictures on for 500 Dhms (£80) and would recommend this is the best way to do it. However had I known that all the pictures taken in the water park later in the day could be added to for the same price I would have been a lot happier with the price.We visited on a Monday in February and the park was busy but not packed, although all the sunbeds were taken quite early. The lockers are next to useless so I would recommend that you travel light, food and drink was reasonably priced (for the most expensive city in the world).As I say a great day out, my daughters (6 and 8) loved every minute, although there is little to do in the water park for the youngest (just under the 120cm limit for most of the good slides)Word of warning, the taxi queues are huge at the end of the day, and the fixed price hotel taxis are half as much again as the city cabs.
Very expensive. While the swim with the dolphins was a wonderful experience, it is expensive for a family and four bottles of water cost AED56 where you can buy them elsewhere for AED 2 per bottle

Royal Swim not to be missed, Photography policy poor turning out to be a rip off.... In principle a very nice experience and certainly a most welcome Christmas present which we certainly enjoyed apart from ...Royal Swim or "Royal Rip Off"? First they don't allow you to photograph yourself as the "Dolphins could swallow the camera" if you take it into the water, then they advise they have "professional photographers", finally they present the images they made in packages from EUR 100 to all the way fancy packages of EUR 500 and even more. When you ask for details you get vague answers, no one knows. Asking for the resolution you get directed to a ~A1 or A2 size frame on the wall in good quality. Opening the USB stick at home you realise the Royal Swim is a "Royal Rip Off" for mediocre 1.6MB jpeg files.... This after paying approx EUR 400 for the experience for two. Bottom line, prefer to spend double and triple but see the animals healthy out in the open sea even if you don't get as close...On a positive note. The South African counter staff was very helpful with the "expired voucher" that didn't carry a date so one could realise that ...after the 3 colleagues making the reservation based on an e-mailed copy of the voucher failed to do so.
Dolphin encounter. Great way to meet and feel dolphins without the swimming.We were given information going out in the water.My 8 year old daughter had the time of her life dancing with the dolphin.

A wish came true. So my wife want to swim with the dolphins and yes finally her wish came out.You can use also the waterpark but when you arrive and you want to use the water park first just go to the ticket office of yor dolphin booking.They will work it out for you walking to the dolphin bay is very easy and arriving there they will check your booking and they will give you a buzzer.After a briefing you go with a group of 6 people in the water.The Dolphin swims in front of you and the trainer gave you a lot of information about the dolphin.You can touch the dolphin ,drop a ball ,kiss it and so on.Really nice pictures are made but don't book it seperate it cost's you more and there are only 4 included.The whole package without prints are 500 Dirham on a USB stick it's worth it.The trainers are very polite,friendly and professional and yes you have to listen to what they say because it's the best for the dolphin.We are very happy that we have this experience it's cost you some dirham but it's worth it.

A dream come through. Kids loved it and for once something to do all the time!!!! Dolphins, seals, sharks and lots more of marine live for all to look at and learn too, kids swimming with them and water rides to observe them at their natural habitat

Great experience.. Went with my partner who can't swim so we did the encounter one.You are with every one who has chosen to do the same at the beginning when you are handed the wet suits, lockers and told what will be happening. There where over 50 people with young children so was quite annoying when you are trying to listen and every one is just ignoring them! Would be nice maybe to have a family session and an adult session.Once you are in the water you are put in groups of 10 per dolphin.You get to do different things on your own with the dolphin and a professional photographer takes your picture.You can buy your photos after, there about 80dh each to print or you can get (we did) all your pictures on a USB for 500dh!! well worth it we had between 2 of us over 30 pictures on there!! Great experience good value for money as you get the water park included!
Great Experience. I did the Dolphin Photo experience which was amazing. Great price and you get to touch the dolphins and then get a photo afterwards.

expensive but good fun. this is an expensive trip but worth it for the experience staff are great.the cost includes entry into the aqua park a drink after and towels too. id advise go early on a week day weekends are sooo busy . also not much shade and loungers are snapped up quick . try and stretch the budget to hire a cabana for the day esp if you have small ones and its hot
Great experience. Such a wonderful experience. I recommend it to everyone! The trainers are very nice and the dolphins are fantastic!

Memorable experience. We enjoyed the Dolphin Bay in Atlantis. We had a 11:15am slot and reached on time. After they check you in, they take you for orientation and give you a kind of uniform vest or wet suit to wear before meeting the dolphin. The group stays near the beach in knee deep water (depends on which package you take - ours was the basic). The trainer brings the dolphin and everyone gets to touch, kiss, and play with the dolphin. You can take shots from close by by buying the 100 Dhs spectator ticket or buy professionally done shots. It is a nice experience.

You have to of this once...but be aware of what to expect. Dolphin adventure is a unique experience for sure. There are not many times you get the chance to be with a dolphin in the water so when oppty knocks, answer. Yes this is really pricey and yes it's at a mega resort that specializes in vacations - the kind where your vacation is also everyone else's vacation - so don't expect personalized, at your pace visit as you might expect for such a large price tag. The program is well set up but at the same time you feel like you're being processed through a series of stations, poses and activities. I guess there needs to be some structure to these things but overall felt like we were just the 10:30 group being herded through. Photos where nice to have at the end but again, expensive. Once you have made the investment in the experience, you kinda feel compelled to document it with a photo. Photos can be taken from the beach but again, to do do you need to purchase an observer pass for 300 AED.
Dolphin magic. This experience does not come cheap but when you see your kids in a pool playing with a dolphin it sort of makes up. Great photo opportunities and our kids were really impressed!
Very enjoyable. Enjoyed this experience. Was expensive but glad I did it. The dolphins are just gorgeous and the Dolphin Bay facilities are very good.

Awesome experience but very expensive. The experience turned out to be way better than what we had expected. The dolphins are very well trained and the handlers are a friendly bunch. My daughters were thrilled to be so close to the dolphins. Only one crib. They dont allow any photographic equipment. That means you have to buy the photos from them and they are crazily expensive. I dont remember the exact figure but I think I ended up paying almost SGD 250 (or about USD 200) for the package I selected. The saving grace was that the photos turned out awesome.
Wonderful experience, not cheap but worth the money. Very well organised and a lovely experience, my daughter was 17 and still loved swimming with the Dolphins, so did I at 47!
Well worth a visit. Very good, staff are excellent and dolphins very well trained. Great experience, although the souvenir photos are a little expensive.

Great dolphin experience; but hated the facilities.. We had the best time of our lives scuba diving with the dolphins. But we hated the pre and post experiences at the Atlantis Resort. The dolphin de-brief by so called dolphin expert was a joke. Not only could he not operate "Powerpoint"; he prolonged the suffering by making pointless jokes. Basically, a 5 mins presentation got dragged on for 15mins. Luckily his supervisor stepped in and took us to the Scuba team.The scuba diving team was spot on! Very professional and patient. We were newly Open water certified. Accordingly, buoyancy was still a work in progress. The team gently helped us out. Once we got the hang out it; the dolphin and her trainer were showing us tricks after tricks. It was a surreal experience.Once out of the water; the poor rating continues. One would think for AED1400 per person, one would have a decent changing and showering facility. Not expecting a five star treatment; but since it was at the Atlantis resort, we expected something better. The change room and showering facility were separated by a common public area. And the showering facility is pretty low class. The package also allowed us to the water park. But because of different venues, we needed to transfer our personal content from the Dolphin Bay lockers to the Water Park lockers...which was not a big deal. But looking for the new lockers were an adventure all in itself. The water park staffs were completely clueless. They kept pointing their fingers to the direction of the lockers but without actually knowing where they were. After 5 mins of the following the fingers with several staffs; we confronted a staff and asked him to physically escorted us to them. Being led back to the front gate, we realized we were in a sea of chaos! There were hundreds of people lining up for tickets and lockers. We decided it was not worth the trouble.Now we were ready to leave by taxi back to the hotel that we were staying. You'd think looking for the lockers in the water park was fun...well, not getting fooled by official Atlantis Taxi agents was the farewell game here. These agents kept pushing for the limo rather than taxi. As it turns out, the limo's metres jump 2x - 3x faster than the regular taxi. Basically, the dolphin experience was great; but don't use any other facilities. So what does that say about the actual Atlantis Resort? I won't know and I don't really care.
Amazing. Smoothly run, and not to be missed,really get to meet and interact with a dolphin, staff were excellent, and someone's taking your photo with them or even you but not so close :-)

Expensive but worth the price. We booked the Dolphin Adventure and although it was pricey for one adult and one child it was most definitely worth it. It was magical to interact with the dolphins and to see my son enjoy it so much. Staff is very friendly and speaks several languages. All in all it's very well organised and most definitely worth it if you are willing to pay that extra money.

DOLPHIN ATTRACTION. Very disappointed. I won't ever recommend this attraction. Overrated. Do not ever choose the deep water. I would only recommend if you go with children but be prepared to pay for it....
WOW. We thought this was a little pricey at first but every cent was well spent. Magic encounter in the water with the dolphins and an unforgettable experience!
great experience. My daughter had a lovely time with the dolphins. Adults need to pay extra to get close to watch and take photos.
Great Experience. My daughter was book onto the Dolphin encounter. staff were excellent, dolphins were lovely. She was able to spend plenty of time in the water and absolutely loved the experience.

Expensive but the smile on my daughters face was worth it. We booked and paid for the photo experience in the UK. We arrived at the Atlantis and was taken to dolphin bay by golf buggy. Then we meet the trainer who told us what we needed to do when the dolphin came out. We got to hold his fins whilst dancing and got to kiss him that was it. Your photo was taken during your own interaction. It was over within minutes. However the smile of joy on my daughter face was worth every penny. The photos were lovely and a great keep sake. Next time we visit we will swim with them.It also included admission into the water park which was fantastic and we spent the rest of the day there until closing.

Swim with a dolphin. Smoothly run, and not to be missed, although you're there with a hundred other people, they break it up into groups of 6, so you really get to meet and interact with a dolphin, staff were excellent, and someone's taking your photo, without being in your face

A bucket list item for my fiancee. A large dolphin habitat that caters to visitors of all ages and skill levels. You have the opportunity to observe, touch and interact with beautiful dolphins in their own habitats, which was a first for me and my fiancee (who had always wanted to do something like this).For small children and those who can't or don't want to go swimming, there is a shallow pool in which you can stand and interact with the dolphins. There are deeper pools and more in-depth experiences for those with more advanced swimming skills, so there are opportunities for every member of the family to spend time with the dolphins. You can even scuba dive with them if you want to, although we did not do this to keep the cost down. The cost of Dolphin Bay is a little bit high, but avoiding some of the extras is a good way to cut costs. Plus, your ticket comes with admission to the Aquaventure Waterpark, which is a lot of fun on its own. All in all, this marine park is well worth the price if you love sea life / dolphins or are just looking for something different to do in Dubai.
It's ok.. Very expensive but also a tad disappointing having previously swam with dolphins. Limited interaction.
Dolphin Bay at Atlantis. This is one of the best places I've visited so far and though its a bit over priced, its worth it. Worth a visit.

Great Fun. Having done Discovery Cove in Florida, I can say this is better for the actual dolphin experience. We did the Royal Swim which is part in shallow and part in deep water....fantastic!. Thoroughly recommend it.
expensive but worth it. amazing experience but costly after your done the photos are produce £90 for photos if you want them but thats just dubai

Very overpriced for a short visit. Yes I enjoyed it, but it's very expensive for a short time, we visited the seals, which I also thought a bit cruel cooped up in a pool and don't really like animals doing tricks although they are very intelligent creatures. But a few tricks and a photo for the price is quite steep.

A little expensive but worth every penny!. This was such a great ride for my 14-years old sun, who got to touch and play with a dolphin and got absolutely thrilled by it. This was on July 2013 and after the dolphins we spent the afternoon at the water park, which is also great.If you are on a family of 3-4 and want all to do the same it will easily cost you around AED 2000-2500 to do it, but you will not regret at all.

Incredible experience. Wonderful experience to interact with dolphins. We did 'shallow water encounter', which was perfect for our 6 and 9 year old. Lasts approx. 1 hour and it speeds fast.You get individual hug or kiss with the dolphin (and photo taken) and also a dance, or the chance to throw a ring / ball and the dolphin retrieve it.There is an official photographer on hand to take lots of photos, but as with most things in Dubai, they are pricey.

Wow! Dolphins are such amazing creatures. 6 of us did the Dolphin Encounter at Dolphin Bay and it was worth every pound!The way in which the whole experience was conducted and the friendliness of the staff and dolphins made this day one of our best.We got the stroke the dolphins, learn a little about them. We also got to kiss them and dance with them :)The dolphins appear to be happy and I had no problem with my young boys being around them. They enjoyed every second of it.The only gripe, and one I've come to expect from Dubai, is the cost of the official photos. 500 AED for all of them on a USB!Seriously though, do it. You'll love every minute :)
Fun with the dolphins. We spent 30 minutes with the dolphins in Dolphin Bay and really got close to them. The children loved it and the event was extremely well organised.

Amazing Experience, Worth every penny!. This made the Holiday! What a fantastic time we all had at Dolphin Bay, Atlantis. We decided to go for The Royal Swim. This is by far the best option compared to others in which they offer. In this package, you get a wet suit and a life jacket. Other packages on offer you only have one.We had a party of 6 which was great as that was the maximum people allowed per dolphin. This was a bonus as we didn't have to share Tulagi ( the name of the dolphin.)The staff were very friendly and polite throughout are visit at dolphin bay. The photographers capture great snaps of you're experience. I must admit they were pricey to purchase but hey ho.... Great memories to look back on and share with friends on Facebook! HaI will defiantly recommend Dolphin Bay to everyone I know and will return when next in Dubai

Memorable Experience. Myself, my husband and our 9 year old son booked the dolphin experience direct with the Atlantis before we travelled to Dubai. The website you got this a bit cheaper (you also got entry to the Water Park) but I'm not sure how much cheaper it was to be honest.We had the basic dolphin experience and it was fantastic, there is about 10 people per dolphin and I think there was six dolphins at once. Before you enter the water a guide tells you all about the animals and really gets you in the mood! You get to dance/play/kiss/hold/stroke the dolphins - who are absolutely gorgeous! A photographer is taking pictures while you are there - they were about £10 per picture. Definitely worth the money especially as we got entry to the Water Park as well.
Interact with the Dolphins. This is a unique experience, where you interact with these wonderful animals in a perfect environment, both for humans and dolphins.You have to try,Carlos A. Oliveia

excellent family experience. Well run, friendly staff, good with children all ages, very informative We did shallow water experience which was ideal for 5 year old and 7 year old who were quite nervous but both loved it. Unfortunately the photographer was terrible so alot of shots did not have childrens faces in so could only purchase 3 of 25 taken
amazing. the staff was amazing we booked the dolphin adventure and didn't realise it was 10 ft deep but they looked after us and put us at the end and was still involved in everything and more

Swim with Dolphines. This was our favorite family highlights of our entire trip to Dubai. We shoes the 3M dolphin adventure with 2 adults and 3 children (14, 12, 11 years old). It was very informative and we felt very safe with 2 instructors per group of 5 to 6. Since we were a large family we had a dolphin all to ourselves. The staff couldn't have made it any better!

Awesome. Had the pleasure of visiting with the dolphins twice in my visits to Dubai. Both were exceptional. I have the pictures on my wall and smile each time I pass them. The staff are wonderful and the rescue program commendable. Great job hope to get back some day. Atlantis is not just a swim park but a truly remarkable marine life habitat. Many thanks to all of you.

Fantastic experience!. We chose to do the royal swim with the dolphins here as it wasn't too much more than the other packages and having done this we are very glad that we did. The experience was amazing, small groups, friendly trainers and great facilities make it all the better. You feel like you get a personal experience and you get a lot longer with the dolphins than many other places offer. Photos were not too expensive either, we chose a package of 4 prints and all the photos on disc (53 photos) for about £80. This was much better value than 1 photo for about £15. We also received free entry to the waterpark after which we thoroughly enjoyed, and a discounted entry to the aquarium. I would recommend the early times for dolphins, we started at 9:10am, it is a lot less hectic than arriving later in the day once the waterpark is open and queues were a lot larger.

Most Memorable Holiday!. Brilliant time at the Dolphin Bay!!Me and my partner did the royal swim which meant swimming with two dolphins, and having some photos taken.Had such a fantastic time, only downfall is that it didn't last that long, so make sure you cherish the moments you have there :)Such wonderful service and staff, definitely worth doing!!

Great fun for all ages!. What a lovely thing to do play and swim with the dolphins. It is just great. The staff is lovely, well informed and very professional and the dolphins such fun and superbly trained. The place is typical fancy and beautiful Dubai style. A trip not to be missed. Choose the half hour session at least you won't regret it.

Highlight of our honeymoon!. The whole experience was brilliant and we loved every second. The dolpins were awesome and being able to swim and interact with them was something we'll never forget. The staff just ooze professionalism and expertise. They love their job and their enthusiasm was infectious. Even this grumpy faced woman was laughing by the end. (The photos are ridiculously expensive.. I'd recommend asking a spectator to take shots. Either that or negotiate hard to get the price down)

Great experience but expensive pictures. I was at first very sceptic about swimming with dolphins. After seeing the pictures from Taji in Japan where yearly hundreds of dolphins are killed, while the most beautiful ones are selected for delphin shows around the world, I was worried.After some emails and beeing assured that non of there dolphins came from Taji I deceided to give it a try. Booked for the Royal Swim, which included beeing pulled by 2 dolphins and a foot push.After checking in and signing the paperwork, you get your wetsuit and get changed. After they take you to a "classroom" where they tell you how they train and treat the dolphins and what to do and especially not to do in the water.Once in the water, 2 trainers took care of our group of 6 and the one dolphin. All the time you can ask questions and the trainer continuously reassure that you are fine and enjoying.Once the half an hour is over, which unfortuneately happens way too quick, refreshment drinks are offered and you can shower in the locker area.Very positive, with your Dolphin Bay pass, you can enjoy the waterpark next door for the rest of the day as well.During your in-water experience, some photographers are around and taking pictures of you. You can buy them before leaving the bay area For me, they are way too expensive, 1 single picture costs 80 AED, if you want all picutres of your sessions on a stick, we are talking about 500 AED or more. I would have bought more picture, if they would be priced more reasonable. You can bring an observer to your experience for only 100 AED (haggle with the cashier possible, we got him down from 300 to 100), the observer can then take pictures from the beach of the bay. Like this you can get more pictures for a reasonale price. Make sure you bring a camera with a good zoom lens, as the beach is stil a few meter away, especially for the deep water stuff.It's not a cheap attraction but worth the money, but I hope the rethink their pictures pricings.

Enchanting experience. We booked to do this as its been something I've always wanted to do. I was a little worried that it might seem a bit too forced and was concerned for the animals welfare. I need not have worried, the whole experience from start to finish is geared up with these beautiful mammals in mind. The trainers and presenters are knowledgable and walk you through what's going to happen and when you are in the water are extremely vigilant and move the animals around so humans and mammals get the most out of the experience. We loved it! a forever memory for me!

The Best Experience. I loved the dolphin bay experience at Atlantis. We visited Atlantis with family last summer and then went back this April to experience the dolphin encounter. It was amazing and well worth the money. Yes it is expensive but it is such a great experience for adults and children alike. The dolphins are so happy and friendly and well cared for. My partner proposed to me at dolphin bay (with the help of one of the dolphins) and he said that the staff were really helpful and I had no idea what was about to happen so top marks for discretion as well. It really was the best :)

Outstanding !!!!!!. One of the greatest experiences I've ever had! We had 6 people and a VIP group! Got to swim with the dolphins, touch, kiss and hug! The photos were amazing ! Absolutely recommend !!!
Nice experience, too expensive. Nice place to visit, definitely will enjoy it, the dolphins are adorable!! however super extra expensive.

An experience to treasure.. Three of us treated this as the highlight of the holiday and with parents in the encounter (shallow water) and daughter in the adventure riding the dolphin.We were all certainly bowled over by the experience.The trainers were excellent and the setting ideal with Jasmine (our young dolphin) showing her enjoyment of the whole experience by being playful throughout.A stunning experience.

My Dolphin encounter!. i was given a dolphin encounter as a gift for my birthday, it was always a dream of mine and I cannot have imagined making this dream come true in any other place that at Dolphin Bay, Atlantis! the trainers were fantastic and the surroundings so idylic and pretty, the dolphins were beautiful, so happy and playfull and it was an experience I will never forget, thank you!!

Best experience ever. Went with my sister to celebrate her being in Dubai and my birthday. Had our instructor Marcos and our dolphin was Pifaly. What a experience. Amazing, worth every dollar and i will always remember this amazing day. Marcus made the dolphin kiss us and sing happy birthday.Thank you Atlantis for this amazing day

Worth every dirham!. This was a lovely, fun and unique morning adventure for anyone who is a certified SCUBA diver and hasn't yet swam w/ dolphins. Atlantis has a briefing prior to the dive, then it's in the water with the dolphins. Terrific experience and great trainers.

Dazzlingly Dolphin-tastic!. As we live in Dubai, we had often thought about visiting the dolphins but never quite got around to it as thought it may be a bit too "touristy". For a special birthday we finally booked - wow what an experience. Yes it was pricey....Dhs 950 per person.....(gulp).....however they do offers once in a while so keep your eyes open! As it was the run up to Easter we took the first booking at 9.50, so were lucky that it wasn't too busy and there was only 5 in our group. After getting kitted out in wet suits and vests (leave jewellery and hairbands at home) we were taken through a safety/education briefing. We had opted for the adventure package which was in deeper water - would say if you can swim - go for this one! Had fantastic hugs, kisses and a ride on Booker ( the alpha male) - out of this world!! Yes a bit cheesy....but what the heck!! Loved it!! There are loads of towels available and complementary drinks after. Yes we bought the photos.....how could you not!! It is NOT a cheap morning out!! Couple of points.....try and go early as there were much bigger groups going after us, there is a Starbucks just outside to grab a coffee and cheap(ish) lunch! Take advantage of the pass into aqua venture water park. Enjoy.....and remember to smile for the photographer!!

Brilliant. Had a great afternoon in Dolphin bay, we chose the shallow water and we were in a group with about 8 other people from various parts of the world.The experience lasted about 90 minutes and the trainers told us all about the dolphin we were swimming with. The experience is very hands on with the dolphin and this included a kiss, playing throwing games with them and some people even choose to dance.Overall a very good experience and a credit to Atlantis. Really enjoyed it.
unique experience. Excellent interaction with dolphins. I did not like the poor quality of the photos taken by dedicated photographer, absolutely poor.

fun fun fun. Dolphin bay at the atlantis was quiet an exciting experience..The staff and the dolphins are extremely well trained and friendly. The pictures with dolphins definitely make amazing memories. A must do activity for family with children!!Book early in advance online for better deals.

My personal opinion. Went there yesterday. Lovely staff sorted out a good deal for our group of 5 peopleThat's how it went We chose 1:30pm slot, were given wet suits (option of a vest too was given) and lockers. Then onto the orientation, which I found very tedious, but once that was over we went straight into the water My 3 year old loved it. We stroked the dolphin, took photos, kissed, hugged and danced. Then my daughter got bored and walked back out. The photo the professionals took were great so for AED600 we got all photos on a USB stick. I personally didn't think much of it but then that's nobody's fault. It is what it is. Not sure if it's worth all that money, I paid AED830 per person. Not sure if i would recommend it but after uploading photos on Facebook so far most of my friends can't wait to do it. So it really is for a photo op
Dolphins. Nice area but very expensive to swim with dolphins; owould have preferred them not to be in captivity.
A good place to enjoy swimming. Dolphin Bay is a good place to enjoy swimming. Or even if you are not good at swimming, it's still wonderful to watch dolphin swimming in water.

Amazing dolphins!. Meeting with the dolphins is an extremely rare activity and it was like nothing I've ever done before. You get a lot of time with your dolphin and it is very humbling to be in the presence of this amazing mammal.We had Alice and she was beautiful! We got spinned around, got kisses, hugs, kissed back, had a water fight and got a belly ride.Pictures that the photographers took are available to purchase. All pictures on a USB for 500 AED (around 52 pictures on me and my friend) is a lot of money and personally I would have appreciated if the quality of the pictures were better. If you're a normal visitor with no photographic skills the pictures are fine.All in all we spent approximately 1400 AED per person for the whole day with traveling to and from by taxi, food, activities (Aquaventure + Dolphin Bay), photos at Dolphin Bay, souvenirs etc. It might sound like a lot but I wouldn't think twice if I had the chance to do it again.Special thank you to all the dolphin trainers. You have a lot of passion for what you do and it is easy to see the connection and joy you have caring for the dolphins. I am jealous and now strongly considering a career change.
Once in a lifetime. Dolphin Bay was an amazing experience, to be up close to the dolphins was fantastic, being pushed along by a dolphin and getting to hug one was awesome

Dance with the Dolphins. Had a deep water experience on my recent visit to Dubai. It was a great experience and you get to interact with one dolphin in a small group. It is a great experience and the organization is superb. Your ticket also includes your entrance to a fabulous waterpark at the Atlanntis Hotel. A bit expensive but a once in a lifetime experience.
Exciting. Playing with the Dolphins is the most amazing feeling, for the whole family. I recommend a visit here whenever you are in Dubai. This should never be missed. AMAZING
great fun. great fun and educational! the staff were amazing and very knowledgeable. the pictures we purchased were amazing as well. we are interested in trying the new attraction, sea lion point.
Dubai Indoor Aquarium. Great view and important to note is that it's indoor, underground aquarium with an opportunity to enter the aquarium for a fee

Wonderful.....but expensive!!!!. My partner actually swam with the dolphins and I was an observer and for that privilege I paid £50, that's alot of money!! And I only did that to take some pics. However, you can buy all the photos for about £60 which are excellent quality!! Having paid - this also gives you access to the Aquapark, which I didn't use!!So, be VERY careful how you spend your money!!!NB!!!! On leaving the park, we waited an hour for a taxi, and because the Hotel was calling them the starting charge was more and DON'T!!! forget.......different type of taxis cost more!!So, DON'T just jump in the next car, check the price first!!ALL this makes for a very long wait, not very efficient at all!!We were told taxis were cheap.......if someone tells you this, ask them to define cheap...they aren't!! Also, my partner is hearing impaired and we informed the staff. Their understanding of this was to shout at him, as I could hear them from the shoreline but he still couldn't.I think if anyone has a disability of ANY sorts they should investigate how the event caerers for this.The staff are nice enough and were good with him, but I could see their paience wearing with him.They definitely need more training!!
Once in life experience. This was not only another tick on my list of things to do ...This was one of the best experiences EVER...little bit overpriced. ..but...amazing memories..

love but too heavily priced..... its lifetime ,amazing ,unforgettable exp.. but price are so high .in my group only i enjoyed this but As mentioned by many others the pictures were way to expensive and not very good. i didn't buy any. its cool

Swimming with Dolphins. Its nice. But don't expect too much. Its more a photo opportunity to show at home that you were swimming with Dolphins. Because of the amount of people there in your Group you have only always a few seconds with the dolphin.

Just incredible!. So glad we did this, well worth the money for an unforgettable experience with a highly intelligent creature. So good to see the dolphins so happy for & cared for by such knowledgable & loving trainers. If you get the chance definitely do this!

Great experience. Expensive ? Yes. Worth every penny ? For me : yes.
It was all very well organised. We got a short, but interesting explanation about the dolphins, how people work with them, how they may feel ... It was great to be so close to them. If I 'll have the posibility I will definitely do this again

Dolphins. Brilliant time for the family but if family members don't want to go in they will need to pay 100 to sit on the adjoining sand in the Dolphin Enclosure or sit outside with other people watching behind the barriers.

Wooow,amazing experience! Need to try this!. It is one in a lifetime experience! I smile even now when I remembered it! Dolphins are amazing and remarkable. Words can't describe the feeling when you touch,kiss,hug or play with them. You need to try this! Book in advance and you will save some money AED 50 (I think it is minimum of 2 weeks in advance) and book as early term you can (9.10 AM Royal Swim) because you need to have time for Aquaventure Waterpark afterwords (The entrance for the Waterpark is free of charge when you buy any of the Dolphin swimm and you get 25% off same day admission to The Lost Chambers Aquarium if you want to go there). We had Royal swim and it was so much fun when dolphin pushes you through the water (foot push). I was laughing so hard and screaming of joy. It is even more amazin when two dolphins drag you through the water. The cutest part was hugging and kissing the dolphin. Amazing feeling! You can't take pictures on your own. You can buy them afterwards. They are too pricey but they are a memory on this special event so I think it is worth to have them. (if you don't want to swim with dolphins you need to buy observation pass and then you can take pictures from the coast of you family and friends. The whole experience is very well organised. And the trainers are kind and cary and you can see how much they love the dolphins and also how much dolphins love them. The whole experience lasts around 30 min and there are 6 of you in the same group. There is also 15 minute orientation with a Marine Mammal Specialist before going into the water. I truly recommend this magical experience! It is a little bit pricey but the memory will last forever!

Love love love this. This was such an amazing experience for our teens. The experience is so well designed, everyone is put at ease and safety is number 1. What a great experience and especially that the dolphin's seem so well cared for. Even the trainers seemed so happy. A little pricey but well worth it!
Swimming with Dolphins. A very magical experience, the trainers are amazing and the dolphins just want to please, Lots of different packages to suit all ages and budgets.
Do Swim with them. Don't miss out on this, it was amazing, hugging, kissing a dolphin, there were young kids and olds so no excuse, do it!

Not worth the money. My son at 6 and I had booked the encounter and my husband and daughter at 9 the royal swim. The children love all kind of animals and really been looking forward. They liked it but it is was not amazing. Not the experience they remember the most from our holiday. We - the adults - was pretty disappointed. I don't think you get much time with the dolphin and everything is so perfect organized and prepared that you are almost afraid of taking a wrong step or touching the dolphin in a forbidden place. They are wonderful creatures but I didn't have the time to feel connected with them in any way. As mentioned by many others the pictures were way to expensive and not very good. We didn't buy any.Entrance to the waterworld is included when booking dolphin experience and that saved it for us. Great great thrilling waterslides. loved it. A little cold i february - we needed to bring a towel around with us.

Very Good but somewhat pricey. My wife & I really enjoyed interacting with the dolphins and the hands on experience.The whole thing is done extremely professionally our only gripe was the price, but it is a once in a life time experience and not to be missed
Near human. Interactive,intelligent mammals,very loveable,highlight of my visit,too short,beautiful surroundings.good ,informative lecture

Amazing. Amazing Amazing AmazingDid the Royal Swim with the dolphins, although this is not cheap, it is worth paying the money. They are such incredible gentle mammals with an amazing level of intelligence. The nose push was a highlight. I could not recommend this enough. Unlike other dolphin places that I have checked out, the research and development seems to be at the heart of this attraction and I do hope that we learn more and more about this amazing creature.
Holy Bijesus!. Swimming next to dolphins - the coolest thing ever! Scuba diving with them was even more of an adrenaline rush! You've gotta try this!
pricey but worth it. my son loved it and so did I. feels too little time but we were there for 30 mins. must go if you are in dubai.
Dolphine show. better than Hong kong Dolphine show. dolphin show some excellent movement by the dolphin. to reach is one of the easy way just take metro and reach Dubai healthcare.

Encounter with Black the dolphin. We surprised our 7 year old niece and she just loved meeting black the dolphin and keeps saying she will never forget this experience and it was her first time.The staff at the Atlatis were very good and made the day a super day for our family.

Nothing extraordinary. We liked that we could get close to the dolphins but given that there were lot of visitors the opportunity for that was limited (unless you paid extra for private access). Also the price of £400 for family of 4 (that we had to pay extra on top of our hotel accommodation) was disappointing.

It is worth it. Deliberated for a couple of days of whether to pay out for a 2 teenagers to do Dolphin adventure and glad we did in the end as they enjoyed it and will have lasting memories of the adventure. The Dolphin instructors were polite and ensured everyone got their turn to interact with the Dolphins

Swim with the dolphins. Our four daughters had a wonderful time swimming with the dolphins at Dolphin Bay. They received a very informative briefing before and during the experience. Expensive but worth every penny and we got some fantastic photos.

An AMAZING experience!. What an amazing experience! We got to swim with our dolphin, hug her, kiss her, dance with her...it was brilliant. Totally worth the money - the staff are so knowledgeable, they have a great relationship with all of the dolphins and ensure that everyone in the group gets the most out of the experience.

A dream come true. From service and the friendliness of the staff to the swimming with dolphins I could not fault anything.We chose the Royal Swim and it was worth every penny. We were in groups of 6 and you got plenty of time to touch the dolphins and have your photo taken. the photographs at the end are expensive (£100 for 4 printed and them all on disc) however it was a once in a lifetime and they provide great memories.If you want to swim with dolphins and are visiting Dubai, I can definitely recommend Dolphin Bay.

great. Went with wife daughter, grandson. Excellent experience. Staff very knowledgeable, kind & were great with me having a mobility problem & needing a walking stick. Plenty of patience. Very clean.Expensive but well worth the experience. The photos are not cheap but we got the usb deal with all our photos on & lots of dolphin pictures as well on the stick. This was the best deal. If you go with Emirates get yourself an Emirates skywards card from their website. You get 15% with this in Dolphin bay, Aquaventure park & in the Atlantis hotel etc.

Dolphin shallow water encounter. Had an amazing experience, Dolphin shallow water encounter. Did it with my kids since policy is that kids had to be accompanied by a paying adult. You get a presentation about dolphins, wear wet suit and go one of 3 lagoons in groups of 10 maximum. You get to touch the dolphin and stroke it, you get to kiss it, hug it, and then either dance with it or throw a toy to it to let it pick it up. All of these of course get photographed by a professional photographer they have. At the end you get to watch the dolphins jumping up in the air. The experience is nice but expensive, as an Atlantis hotel guest you get a discounted rate though. The pictures as well are very expensive. You can get each print for 80 AED, or get the pictures on a USB and pay 500 AED.

Worth every penny, highly recommended. The staff were very enthusiastic, helpful, and added to the overall first class experience. Everything was perfect, even the professional photos taken were very reasonably priced for this once in a lifetime experience - well done Dolphin Bay Staff!!
dolphins yourbest friend. It is true that Dolphins are men best friend.we cannot describe the great experience being around dolphins. very friendly, very smart. must try

What a great experience!. This was the icing on the cake of a great vacation. Our children (7 & 9) really enjoyed interacting with Blade, our dolphin. The trainers were very friendly and knowledgeable and made the experience one we will never forget.The photos we purchased captured the experience wonderfully. Worth the price paid to document a great experience. Highly recommend this add on.
Wonderful. Loved every bit of the experience being with the dolphins. The rides at the park are also good. Its a little expensive but worth it considering the place.
honeymoon. loved every minute of this. swimming with dolphins were out of this world and the rides are awesome. be prepared to spend a lot.

Dolphin royal swim. Excellent session. Very good trainers. Very safe. Wonderful experience which I will never forget. Was able to purchase photo album for lasting memories of the session
Dolphins amazing.

Must watch..... I have seen dolphin show in Singapore and Bangkok...but I feel this was the best....specially...when u with kids....it's a little overpriced.....so use the entertainer vouchers....one on one
A must do. Great value for money for the amount of time and interaction each individual gets with the dolphin. Great staff, really informative and learnt a great deal as well as having fun.

Strange "no video" policy... I paid extra to enter with my two sons as they assured me that I was allowed to take photos, but they didn't mention I couldn't record the experience until we were about to start.The group of 6 persons interacts 100m away in deep water and it's hard to get a good pic., and leaves little time for each participant with the dolphin.Besides, I had one of the staff members controlling me all the time, looking over my shoulder, and every time a spectator even stepped into the water to get a closer shot, they would be pushed back. I didn't bought the "privacy of attendees" policy, for me it was more Atlantis ensuring you buy their expensive photos.I thought it was very disappointing and not good value for money, but my sons liked the interaction.

Pricey but well worth the experience. Of all the touristy things in Dubai, our family enjoyed this experience the most. We were up close and personal with the dolphins for 30 minutes and got to experience them first hand. It is expensive though and there was a lot of waiting and shuffling around before we finally got to experience them. Also beware, the water was cold for this time of the year and our 6 and 10 year olds were shivering in the water. Finally the photo packages, while very expensive, proved well worth it as there were a few priceless shots of the kids with the dolphins.

Excelent entertainer.. Dolphin ride &show. What ever they arranged this show it's very nice superb I have never seen this type of things earlier my kids are very happy after see it. almost half day I have spent there and enjoyed food and kids play zone also.

Royal swim - dream come true. During our stay in Dubai we had pre booked two different interactions at Dolphin Bay. I went for the Royal Swim while my parents and three younger siblings all decided to do the Dolphin Encounter. Both interactions includes an educational talk and then 30 minutes in the water with the dolphins. Since I did the Royal Swim I got to hug, kiss, stroke and play with the dolphins. However the absolute best was the boogie ride and the ride between the two dolphins across the lagoon.The staff are really friendly and good at their jobs. They genuinely care about the dolphins and seems to love their work. Lockers, towels and wetsuits are provided as well as refreshments (a can of pop or water). Photographs must be purchased separately at the end of your encounter. I did not do this since I did not find the photos very good and my family had taken better photos with my own camera from the shore. However the rest of the family bought one photo since I had not been able to take photos of them since their time was during my introduction. I have always dreamed about swimming with Dolphins and am so glad that we had this experience while being in Duabi. It is pricey, yes, but so worth the money.

Experience of a life time!. Swimming with dolphins has been a life long ambition and finally in my 40's I've done it and it far exceeded my expectations! We chose the Royal swim which worked out to around £150 each. The whole experience was incredibly well run. The trainers made us feel very special, were very knowledgable and treated the dolphins with such kindness and respect. We were in a group with two other couples and a dolphin called Audrey who was so beautiful clever and I felt very privileged to spend time with her. I found the whole experience very moving and therapeutic.It was very expensive but I felt it was worth every penny as it's a once in a lifetime experience that I will remember forever!

Sweet Dolphin. Me and my daughter went to swim with the dolphin , his name was S2 , we were so exited , although they kept us waiting for some time but we went through changing then went for a short review of how to deal with the dolphin , it wasn't a long session but we were able to hug , dance and kiss the dolphin , pictures were a bit expensive but I had to take the full collection as it won't happen every now and then , it was fun :)

Dolphin Adventure. tookpart in the Dolphin Adventure with my youngest duaghter, quite apprhensive at first, staff made you feel at ease, explained thorougly what to expect, the interaction with the dolphins was in groups of 6 with each individual having seperate activities withthe dolphin, an awesome experience glad i did it

A must do in Dubai. Free of charge to watch! As amazing as it is to experience this - it's also expensive. However it's almost as fun just to watch the other people interacting with the dolphins. I would recommend visiting even if you arent going to swim with the dolphins yourself!
Great experience !. Had a awesome time with the dolphins and staff. Water was extremely cold but worth it all ! Plan to visit again with family in the future.

Nice to see dolphin in Dolphin bay. Nice experience along with the children. They enjoyed a lot after seeing Dolphins @ Dolphn Bay. It's very safe to see the dolphins. Even seeing Dolphins in desert....unimmaginable.

Fantastic experience, well managed but expensive!. Great experience, extremely well managed and caring trainers. You get to kiss, dance, and swim with the dolphins. Expensive at $200 a pop, but a rare experience, and a highly recommend. Easy to book online, in peak season, book in advance.

Over priced. We enjoyed our Dolphin experience and found the staff friendly, but it was extremely over priced for such a short event. You were not allowed to bring your camera, and then to add insult to injury, the official photo was not included in the price and was again ridiculously priced! We were a group of 6 and there were no group discounts etc. Overall, nice afternoon, but severely out of pocket!!

Expensive but worth it. We went on the Dolphin Encounter as I am not confident in deep water. The whole experience was amazing with lots of time spent with your dolphin and many photo opportunities. Photos are expensive to buy but are a lovely reminder of the day

Great apart from Photo's. Fantastic experience for me and my 11 yr old son to interact with the dolphins,clean and very well ran but the fact my wife had to pay for the pleasure of watching even though we had a suite in the hotel was a bit over the top, as were the photographs which were very overpriced for the quality, got some better shots of another guests wife...

Good but short. Organised acitivity, very nice trainers and fun activity. Dolphins are beautiful anyway and this was a once in a lifetime experience.However, the time with the dolphin was not too much although I don't want to complain about it because I'm guessing it is not good for the dolphins if it's longer. I do feel however that it should be cheaper. Was too expensive!Finally what really put me off was that the photos taken by the resort's "professional photographer" were awful. Extremely bad quality and lighting and only about 7 photos each to choose from. And the cost was extreme. 100€ for a usb with the photos (even if it's just the 7!) was the cheapest package. We only ordered 2 photo printouts at 16€ each which is till too much but you must have something to remember it... We did have an underwater camera which my husband could hold while i was the dolphin and vice versa but they didn't allow us to take it in for the dolphin's security, which is just another money machine for them.

great expeirence. my daughter had the deep water experience and she absolutely loved it, mind she did say that the water was really cold :)we spectated which was nice as we was allowed too take as many photos as we liked.

I will do it again!. I bought the Royal Swim experience as a Christmas gift to my wife and it was a great experience. The staff was great and fun :) The dolphins had a good time and played with us. I can only recommend others to also do this experience, it is definitely worth the money.

Lots of of fun but restricted for spectators. A birthday gift for our daughter was delivered as much fun as expected . There are several programs that you can choose from, with the beginner one you get a short brief on dolphins followed by half an hour group play with animals. Several occasions to be one-2-one with the dolphin, get pictured and have a real fun.Please be aware that the whole process takes c.a. 1,5 hour and if you want to more than one person to accompany a kid ( that will pay for attendance as well ) you will have to pay an extra fee. If you are unlucky and the play takes place not in the central pool you will have no opportunity to see your the show.

We Had a Blast!. My husband surprised me with the Dolphin Experience at Dolphin Bay while we were on our Honeymoon in Dubai. It was such a great experience from beginning to end!When you arrive to Dolphin Bay, a representative checks you in an tells you what time to congregate in a designated location to begin the tour. They take you inside where they size you and suit you up in a wetsuit and vest for the time you will be swimming. Once you are done there, you go into a small theater where you watch a short film about dolphins and your upcoming interaction.After the video, you are introduced to the dolphin trainers that will be assisting you for the experience. The ones we had were all extremely enthusiastic and loved what they did! Then, after that, you will introduce yourself and family and tell them where you are from. the trainers then will explain the signs you will use in the pool to indicate the positions you need to be in to effectively communicate with the dolphins.Once finished, you all go out to the pool and spend about an hour with the dolphins. You will get to hug them, kiss them, hold them and get towed by them. This activity seems to be very generic. Many people do this on vacation to exotic/tropical destinations. I cannot speak for other facilities, but this one is top notch. Kudos to Dolphin Bay!

So worth the money. I booked the Royal Swim with the dolphins. The staff were helpful and polite. When you arrive you are offered soft drinks and given towels. There is a talk about safety before you meet the dolphins which is understandable and informative. The swim was excellent, only 6-8 people per group. The dolphins are well trained and seem happy, which is important. There is a professional photographer which takes photos available to purchase, they are also very expensive but definitely worth it as they are good quality. Overall the swim was amazing, however I wouldn't recommend it to nervous swimmers as you are in deep water. Once in a life time experience, a must if staying at atlantis!

Worth every penny. This review is for the "Photo fun' courseI love dolphins and really wanted to do the "dolphin encounter" while on our trip to Dubai. Since we were traveling with 2 kids aged 5 years and 7 months, we decided to try the "photo fun" instead since it was cheaper and shorter course. I stayed back with the baby while my 5 year old went for the photo fun with my husband. My daughter was so excited after the course and excitedly shared every details with me. She liked it so much to rank it the "best part of the vacation". I had never seen her happier, that made it worth every penny.I was hoping to take pictures while on the beach but the course is conducted a bit too far to able to get good shots, so we had to rely on the pictures taken by the official photographer. The pictures were nice and you could buy the whole bunch on a usb device. Again expensive but souvenir to cherish.the fee for the dolphin bay gives you access to he water park, so you could spare the whole day for the park.We look forward to do the "dolphin encounter" course for the family when the little one grows up, on our next trip.

Amazing Experience. This one is brilliant. My kid of 7 years had a blast. However the cost is on the higher side and I would suggest them to allow kids above 6 years alone also as I had to pay for myself though I was not really interested.

Royal swim review. Me and my boyfriend love animals and are intrigued by water-mammals. We booked the royal swim through the website and got a small discount.I was doubtful and scared that we are entering a facility where the dolphins are used only for earning money without any care and that I would regret this purchase.I'm glad I was wrong!Lets start from the beginning.We arrived at the Atlantis about two hours prior to our scheduled swim and we got help from this lovely lady who told us how we get to dolphin bay and gave us information about the waterpark and a map over the huge area.We took a walk and looked around and found the buggy station were we got a ride to dolphin bay.At arrival to the dolphin bay we went up to the man infront of the reception entrance and he looked at our reservation and gave us a beeper and told us to come to him when it beeps.We waited and finally the beeper started buzzing.We went in to the reception area were we got tickets to wetsuits and signed a release form.The lovely guides showed us to the orientation area were we got our wetsuits and information on how to use the lockers.When ready we went inside the orientation room were one of the Dolphin trainers gave us information on the dolphins and how they are trained. I was so happy to learn that dolphins are trained in a similar way as dogs when they are clicker trained. This means...Only positive reinforcement and the only punishment is that the trainers only ignore them if they do wrong.We were advised not to touch the dolphins until the trainer approved. For the dolphins safety we were not allowed to wear jewellery or hairbands. I was so happy that they really care for the dolphins and that the enviroment is safe and relaxed for the dolphins.After the information we got divided into three groups.We had a large family who wanted to go together so our group included me my boyfriend and one other girl. We were three people total. All groups went to the water and we met the dolphins.It was amazing. It felt like time stopped and I could have stared att these beautiful creatures forever. It was a memorable day and even if it was expensive to buy the photos it was worth it for me. And I will remember this day forever.We bought the usb with all the photos and it was about 75 pictures total of me and my boyfriend and some of dolphin bay and a few group pictures for 500dirhamI truly recommend the royal swim for the ones who knows how to swim and want to feel the power of the dolphins.We were at aquaventure and dolphin bay on a monday so I guess it was a good day since it was not so crowded as I had expected.
must have this .. very nice place and the feel with dolphin . one day will not sufficient to cove the place . also need to book it in advance to avoid the Q and dissapointment .

Great Experience. Make sure you have reasonable expectations, this is not a private experience in a natural enviroment. However I think that they are doing a good job and the interaction with the dolphins although rather "touristy" is a experience you will not forget... I agree it is good fun and something you should try do once. I have been fortunate to swim with dolphins in there natural enviroment both in Zanzibar and Mauritius which was AMAZING but there is no contact ... so two very different experiences. Our 3 boys aged 15, 12 and 10 just loved it!!!!!!
Good. A place to enjoy with Dolphins. With trained staff and a lot of activities, one can spend a good time with freinds & family.

Royal Swim. Brilliant way to spend Christmas day .We booked an afternoon Royal Swim with the dolphins and it was super organised from start to finish.staff were great and although in a group of 6 we did feel we had space and enjoyed a few moments alone with the dolphin.We enjoyed the water park and this was included in the price of swim.

Well worth it!. My family and I experienced this in the summer and all agreed it was an amazing experience. We took part in the "royal swim" in which you get to stroke and hug the dolphins, get a cheeky kiss, be towed by two dolphins while holding their fins and have a foot push from one of the dolphins. Also you get to see a few tricks while they show off! While the price may put people off, I personally felt it was worth the money we spent. A genuinely fantastic day out and I can't recommend it enough!

Nicely done, special memories. Some odd balls think that these dolphins are subject to cruelty but the truth is far from that. Look into it a little bit and they'll understand that these dolphins have been saved from a terrible environment, treated and care for then introduced into a rewarding social environment. We had a wonderful time after being told their stories. The facilities were second to non and all within the hotel grounds....they even have a Starbucks there too. The briefing is thorough, interesting and informative then the swim in interactive and personal. The 'guides' are genuine and care that you have a good time. Remember though, this is as much about the dolphins as it is you though...enjoy the moments shared.

Superb Money Well Spent -except the photos at the end. Brilliant - we did the fun photo and our 2 year old was apoplectic with awe ;) The 'organised photos at the end though were a disaster - we waited over an hour only to find the photographer had put them in the wrong folder - no one paid any attention to our complaints - the managers need to take a trip to Dolphin Bay in Florida to learn ow its done
Fabulous !. Definitely worth the money. A once in a lifetime experience. A must do when visiting Dubai. Book in advance online though, it can get quite busy.

Excellent for all ages. I visited here with my girlfriend and came across people of all ages. We done the dolphin encounter which was good value for money and well presented by all the staff. The only slightly negative thing is that no photos are allowed inside the dolphin encounter (supposedly to protect the animals) and maybe nothing to do with the business profits!? ;) Anyway, this was something we've always wanted to do, and is ALOT cheaper in Dubai than in Florida for example. Once in a lifetime experience, go for it!

Amazing.... Great family fun! Good education on the dolphins prior to the encounter and trainers are very helpful and remain close by. The actual individual interaction time with the dolphins can however be extended to give more value for money.

great to watch. The boba here is good for a very low cost. They have a 2 for $3 deal on boba milk tea and I have yet to hear of anything cheaper. It's been a very long time since I've gotten food here, but I remember liking the food very much, especially the variety of vegetables and tofu on top of the rice and meat you were expecting.

Mixed feelings about the 'experience'. We recently took our 6 year old daughter to the Dolphin Encounter. I have previously swam with Dolphins so know what to expect and we agreed that my husband would accompany her and I would be an 'observer' on the beach.Everything is organised in a very professional way - as is expected in Dubai and also to reflect the cost involved. We arrived around 30 mins early for our encounter and were given a bleeper so that we could return at the allocated time.At that time, we were ushered with many other people to the 'wetsuit' chat, this was fine, the changing facilities were not, way too small, it was worse than being at school swimming lessons!. OK, so its busy around the new year period, but somewhere such as Atlantis should make provision for this. Consequently my daughter put on her wetsuit in the foyer area as it was impossible to find a space in the small changing area.Following this we moved to another room for the 'orientation', this was very informative and very well presented. It was somewhat marred by other nationalities talking over the presentation, (on several occasions both ourselves and others had to 'shush' people so that we could hear the information and presentation. I'm not sure how you overcome such issues, very difficult with certain nationalities!)....Then on to what everyone was waiting for, the dolphins were great, lots of interaction and a full 30 minutes in the water, (temperature of the water is 21 degs centigrade, it's a little cold in December and even with a shortie wetsuit our daughter was shivering!).Then back to the changing rooms mayhem and a complimentary soft drink.If you purchase the 'observer' package then be warned that its quite difficult to take photos as the official photographer is in the way ALL the time!, therefore not that good for your photo opportunities - clearly a ploy so that you have to buy the official photos which are not very good and are expensive!....AED80 (£16) for 1 photo, size 9X6" in a presentation folder is the entry price level, there are various option including saved to memory stick which is a good and convenient way to take your photos home.maybe in hindsight we should have mentioned to the official guy to ensure that we got good photos, but have read other reviews where this has also been highlighted as an issue...Our package included access to the water park, this was great but on a cloudy day in December a little cold, would love to return on a warmer and less crowded day in future.Overall, if you want to take your family to see and interact with Dolphins then I would recommend this, but please realise that its not a natural environment for Dolphins and is clearly a big money making machine - our allocated time was in a group of 10 people (each group gets their own dolphin) and there were 6 groups, so 60 people in the water at one time....
Swimming with Dolphins. Loved it all but it was expensive. Don't buy anything in the shop... take your cameras with you and go in pairs.

Awesome experience but overpriced and unqualified staff. Great experience Conveyor belt of people!Overpriced but funStaff are life guards and 'tourist' folk not marine specialists Did royal swimGot to kiss, hug and touch dolphin plus the diesel swim and body board push. Good fun as a 1 off experience

excellentttt!!!. i booked this online, there was some discount for early reservation.i went on the 29th, i took the 9.30am dolphin encounter experience and there werent so many ppl yet. i was late for 15mins but they helped me to quickly prepare for the orientation and meeting the dolphin. everything went smoothly.our dolphin was a female named Pephaly. she was really cute and friendly. the staff were great, they knew their stuff and helped us with everything.we get to play, hug and kiss with the dolphins and it was so much fun.this experience was spectacular and amazing.im satisfied with the overall experience.but mind you, the souvenir pictures afterward were really expensive.

Nice but touristic. For kids it is great to see and touch the dolphins but is is a tourist machine: 7-10 people per dolphin, everything controlled from your beeper to inform you, you can go and change to moving in and out of the water. It's all to protect the dolphins from stupid people, I can understand but it makes everything so fake. Maybe I am spoiled since I swam with dolphins in more open water where you could play with the dolphins yourself.It already started with some chap doing the intro and making us yell 'goodmorning'.......TWICE because it needed to be louder.You are not allowed to take pictures, only if you are a bystander of you remove yourself from the water. So be aware, if you want to take pictures of your kids, have one go in the water and the other one be an observer and take pictures from the beach. Otherwise you will have to buy copies of your pictures or a USB stick costing 80AED per print or 500AED for a USB on top of the not to cheap entrance fee.....Our son loved it and thought it was great thoughAnd be aware the changing rooms are shared so put your swimming gear on at home or somewhere else unless you do not mind showing everything to your fellow dolphin swimmers. (There is a seperate room for males and females.)If you like waterparks, you can access the waterpark all day with your dolphin ticket and you get to use the dolphin bay big towels for the day. So book the early morning session and enjoy the beach or slides the rest of the day)

A good experience. It's something I've been wanting to do for ages and seemed convenient on a weekend to Dubai. Make sure you plan the whole day becuase the waterpark is really very good and part of your dolphin swim price. The actual experience itself was great the 5mins or so I spent with "blackie". We chose the most expensive package but I wish there was higher packages that could give a more personalised free form experience and longer contact time with the animal. It's a well oiled money machine and during the experience if felt quite rushed. They certainly churn through the groups. I thought the trainers excellent and very friendly and had us in shocked giggles when asked by a younger person "What happens when they get old, do they get released" - "No, they will work here here until they die" ahhh welcome to the Gulf ;-) The facilities excellent. If you are a couple like us, split your tours so the other one can take pictures from the beach. When combined with the waterpark an awesome day out, one of the best in Dubai. It didn't exactly live up to my dreams but don't let that stop you giving it a go, it's not every day you swim with a dolphin!
To take photos with dolphins. I was a little disappointed that they only let one dolphin out, and the whole routine was quite timid.
Awesome kids just love it...... We had a wonderful time here. Spent the day here the slides and water was really fun we were however late to meet with the dolphins.....we surely would come back.....

More time please!. Exellent organized! Fantastic experience for all the family. The only reason I give the 4 star mark instead of the 5 is that the net time of interaction (about 30 min) was not enough. I understand that this is related to the demanded turnover frequency of the interaction, but the amount for the ticket is quiet high as well!

Forever Memory!. One of the most amazing experiences of my life. The trainers were fantastic, the setting perfect and the dolphins simply breathtaking. Tears of joy we're shed by all involved. A dream come true and we would go back, no, we will go back for sure!

A truly amazing experience. This is something I have wanted to do since childhood. Both myself and my 9 year old son went deep water swimming with the dolphins. The whole experience was very professional with both safety and enjoyment taken into consideration.The tutorial and talk at the beginning was really interesting and gave us a good idea of what to expect in the water.You do have to be a good swimmer and be confident in deep water as only wetsuits are allowed and are provided.Although very expensive, It was worth every penny. We had individual time with a bottle nose dolphin and were guided through a range of activities with the dolphin called 'Central' who was beautiful. We danced, hugged, kissed, got spun round in the water and swam holding onto the dolphins fins. A very memorable day and one we will never forget. The dolphin complex was huge and spectacular. We were all in a very small group and the trainer and guide were friendly, helpful and informative. The experience didn't feel rushed.We have two amazing photographs that we will treasure forever. I am so glad we did this in Dubai in the best dolphin complex in the world.Not suitable for small children and weak swimmers as you need to tread water for 30 minutes. They have the option of a cheaper shallow water experience for non swimmers and young children too.

The best experience ever!!. As everyone is saying expensive but more than worth it!! The best experience i've ever had! We chose Atlantis Dolphin Adventure program but my mom was a bit afraid of staying for so long in the deep water so especially for her from time to time the trainer was bringing the dolphin in the shallow water so she wouldn't feel left out. We really appreciated the effort of the trainers we swam with! It is well organized and the staff is very knowledgeable and professional. All in all it was amazing!!

Dolphins great, dolphin trainers not so good. Liked: the dolphins, what wonderful creatures.Disliked: dolphin trainers attitude. We know they do this for money and subjecting these creatures to a silly show off to mass tourism affects them. Clearly the trainer of our dolphin wasn't enjoying it to the point of making unpleasant jokes and making clear of her frustration of doing this type of activity.

Swimming with Dolphins. Dubai is quickly becoming the Las Vegas of the Middle East. We begin by taking a shower, getting suited up and then participating in an orientation. We swim with them, hugged them, touched and holded the dolphins and they pull us around the pool.

This is something that will totally thrill them.. The Dolphin Bay in Dubai is said to be one of the largest and most complex dolphin homes in the world. It is always great watching the magnificent dolphins from across range. Last week on a business week in Dubai with colleagues, we had a day to spare so we decided to go for a Dolphin photo adventure, and it was really awesome. We spent some time at the dolphin lagoon taking photos and I can’t lie that I have seen dolphins this close. They say that if you got to Atlantis you can swim with the dolphins and sure that is not a lie. I dint have the courage to get that close, but some of my colleagues did have a day with the dolphin. I am thinking of bring my two boys next year.
Dolphin Experience. Had an absolutely spectacular experience at Dolphin Bay, because I got to feed and swim with Atlantis' bottle-nose dolphins, and I enjoyed every moment.
good swimming lesson!. We swam with the dolphins and the coaches we had were very friendly.We also like it being in a small group.it was a great experience!
Swimming wwith Dolphins. Loved it loved it what more can I say we booked the Dolphin adventure swim xx We had a fantastic time, free towels, shower facilities, complimentary drink after good day x
nothing special. few dolphins doing same tricks as every other country just very expensive Not many guests seemed interested and staff was even less interested

The first time with Dolphins. We went for the Dolphin Photo adventure at the Atlantis and it was well worth it. It was great watching these magnificent creatures from so close. The hotel itself is a wonder, at the edge of the palm. We spent about an hour or so at the Dolphin lagoon and got our photos. The photos are ok, they could have been better.Take a day out, visit the water park, do the dolphin photo adventure and then the lost chambers. We were lucky to see fighter jets in the sky trailing the Emirates flag and draw a heart in the sky while we were with the Dolphins!

"A memorable time of your life". I went to Atlantis not knowing that you could swim with dolphins there! As soon as i Saw them i had to go! I choose 30 mins in deep seawater and it was amazing! You could DANCE with them, SWIM WITH THEM, KISS THEM! I had a picture done with a dolphin kissing my cheek and me smiling like crazy! You have to go!

Amazing experience.. I did the Royal Swim and enjoyed the double dorsal fin & boogie board ride. Liked having one-to-one dolphin time between interactions. Friendly & knowledgable trainers. Small & welcomed dolphin show at the end. Felt slightly rushed in places, but recommended if you've never done it before. High price prevented a 5 star rating.

An indelible impression! Stunning place!. Despite the fact that I am no longer a child, visiting the Dolphin Bay left an indelible impression on me! Yes, a little expensive but it's worth it! When you have the opportunity to swim with dolphins in such close proximity?
