Instructors are very friendly, explain you everything you need to know how to behave with the dolphins as you can touch and that can not be touched :)Trying to learn more about you! Many jokes! Even try to talk to you in your native language :) Create a very pleasant atmosphere :) Ask you to be a good swimmer, but I think it's not so important, because the water is so salty, can support you well enough :) I am very poor swimmer, but I was so simple to tread water :) We chose the Atlantis Royal Swim! Was pretty cool!!! Dolphins are so tender creature, so friendly that you do not want to leave the bay, after communicating with them, and the time spent there will seem too short!!! Want to give advice about shooting! If you go there is not one, if you have a partner, if you have a good camera and someone will be able to take pictures of the beach, better do yourself. And take a swim at different times, such as one at 14-00 and another at 15-00 ... to be able to take pictures of each other! You will not be allowed in the water with the camera, just off the beach, which is a few meters from swimming and shallow water very close! Photos are not of very high quality but very expensive! At such prices photographer could do much better pictures! I say this because very often use the services of photographers and know it! Stunning place! Very touching communication :) Unforgettable memories for a lifetime! I highly recommend!!! Thanks for every one from this place!!! Specialy to Dolphin Cathy :)

Captive but Happy. A variety of experiences are offered to interact with the dolphins, from watching on the beach through shallow water experiences and on to diving experiences, so all competencies of swimming are accounted for.Opting for the shallow water encounter we spent a fun half an hour interacting with "Central" a female dolphin with a small group of other visitors and controlled by a very informative and competent attendant.Wet suits or vests are provided as the waters were quite cool in the November air, especially as it decided that the day we attended would be one of the only rainy days in this desert environment.Overall a great experience which we would recommend to anyone visiting the Atlantis Hotel waterpark.

A very interesting experience.. Very well organized, both the people and the dolphins are handled by respective proffessionals.Unique see-touch-play experience with these incrdible creatures in exceptional surroundings. The souvenirs, including pictures are reasonably priced and not exaggerately pushed on you. All details are well taken care of, including clean towels, refreshments and a quality coffee shop at the entrance while waiting for one's turn. The family members and friends who do not participate have "prime seating" to watch, take pictures and enjoy from a comfortable distance.The only slightly unpleasant surprise is the water temperature. As the dolphins enjoy a rather colder water than most people and in Dubai is generally hot, the water temperature might surprise you a little. Come prepared, at least psychologically for this aspect. Excellent experience overall!
Swimming with the dolphins!. Fantastic to come so near to the dolphins. A dream came true! Expencive yes, but what the hell :) Would have done it again!Great for kids as well.
great. its awesum to be there .kids enjoy the most .just the entry fees a bit too high but its wonderful.must visit the place atleast once while in dubai

Wonderful. There were many options for you to choose from and packages. As I cannot swim I chose the experience and my husband swam with them. It really was a wonderful experience getting so close to these amazing creatures is just fantastic. You get a good amount of time alone with them and the groups are small so you get a lot of interaction. You can also tell that the dolphins are well looked after and all the employees are knowledgable.

LOVED IT...MUST SEE. I had such a gerat time doing this excursion and what a thrill to be so close to such a powerful and intelligent animal. iT was such a thrill. I think its important to enjoy experiences like this when travelling as they have a profound effect on us all.

Amazing Experience. Me and my husband have never swam with Dolphins before so this was a must whilst on our honeymoon. It was a fantastic day, approx 2 hours in total at the bay. Cost of a photograph is 120 dirhams. Worth while trip and you get free entry to the aqua park. We did the deep sea programme and just booked online the day before, best go for the earliest time slot if you can then you have the full day for the aqua park. It cost about £300 for the both of us, well worth it. There are usually 6 people to each dolphin. Highly recommend the trip.

Had a fun time with the Dolphins. My wife went for the dolphin encounter and I opted for the royal swim.Both of us came out with a big smile after our respective encounters with the dolphins.Definitely a must go, if you were in Dubai.

Well Organised. Stopped at Atlantis the Palm so got discounted rates for this attraction, but even with the discount it was a very expensive experience. Swimming with dolphins was on my 'bucket list' so I decided to go for it, my partner however was discouraged by the website which advised you needed to be able to tread water for up to 15 mins and a strong swimmer so opted for the observer pass instead. The whole attraction was well organised with ample staff and we were escorted from one section to another. The briefing was comprehensive and the tutor was enthusiastic and polite - even when other guests we being rude chatting amongst themselves.For the Royal Swim we were provided with wetsuits and a neoprene vest which assisted our buoyancy. As a group we stroked the dolphin then individually had a kiss and a cuddle, dorsal tow and were pushed on a boogie board. The group of six was the perfect size and the experience still felt personal. In between the activities there were ledges in the water to stand on so you only really needed to swim very short distances. I was disappointed as had we known this previously my partner would have booked to do the Royal Swim with me and it would have been lovely to have that as a shared experience. Even the staff said they were baffled re the '15 minute' clause which tainted the afternoon somewhat as anyone who can swim would manage easily.As was to be expected the photos came with a hefty price tag (£13 each) I felt compelled to buy one as it was a once in a lifetime experience. All in all expensive but worth it.
Meet in the Middle Family Holiday. Excellent attraction well organised teaches the younger children about the dolphins and not just a meet and great experience. Book well in advance before you go
One off the bucket list. We did the dolphin adventure. Up close and personal with a lovely dolphin called Hilma and 2 very helpful guides Yvette and Allesandro who made the experience for us.

Fun Day. It's a pretty commercial experience, but the fact that it's very well organized and simply a fun thing to do makes it excellent. Once you've decided you want to swim with dolphins, there probably aren't many options in the region to do so.That said, the fact that this place is so organized and the staff seemed to really enjoy what they do and very knowledgeable too makes it good fun.

Great expiriance. It is a little more for children than adults, but if you never done something similar or just love dolphins it is great. We took dolphin adventure, everything is like it sad on their website. 30 min 'till you get ready and hear a short story about dolphins and then 30 min in the water. You don't have any 'free' time or swim with dolphin, you just listen to the trainer and dolphin does some tricks with you and 5 other from the group, and that's basically it, but still it was wonderful to interact on any way with those smart and magnificent creatures. You can take photos as you wish, just filming is forbidden, but bottom line is, nobody is checking if you are filming or taking photographs.. Water park, and beach and whole area is great! Just beach was very crowdy, no available sunbeds from 11-2.

Very nice. We booked the shallow water encounter with 3 childeren(age 9,6 and 4).Very nice, professional staff, the kids and we loved it.Is it expensive, yes it is. It Is what commercial, yes but it is great. Let me give some practical info if you want to do this, i recommend you do.First book in advance(you get a discount when booking 15 days in advance of 50 UAD per person, see the site of Atlantis the palm), it is rather long waiting to buy tickets once inside.Print your ticket before you go.Dolphin bay is located in the park Aquaventure, so if you book the Dolphins you get automatically acces to the park.The entrance of the Dolphin bay is at the hotel Atlantis the palm, but take the entrance marked "Avenues" it is not the main hotel entrance but it is the next one, if you see the parking for Aquaventure park you are too far.If you come by car there is valet parking wich is charged 150 UAD, but that if you buy food and drinks(only food no other stuff ) for that amount you don't pay the ticket.You have to ask a stamp(on the receipt) each time you buy food so they can verify, ask for it , it is not done automatically.If you come by taxi remember that when leaving in the afternoon it gets busy and there are not enough taxis, so you will have to wait for quite some time(when i was leaving the park at at 5 pm, there where about 50 people waiting). A car or the monorail(metro) is a better option(the monorail stops ath the entrance to the Avenues and the aquaventure park.Ok make your way to the avenues (shops and shops) and take the first "street" on your left(look up and you see Doplhins as decoration in the lamps).At the entrance (wich is the same entrance as for the Aquaventura waterpark) go to the right desk and show your ticket.You get a wristband wich says"collect your photo's with this wristband" in red.this is for the entrance only!You will have to buy an adittional wristband for the lockers same thing but yellow letters at the price of 40 UAD for a small locker.Bigger lockers are available but more expensive.The small locker is small ok if you are two but for family take the bigger on. The work with the barcode on the wristband fully automated.You scan them in the changing room it is easy.Locker rooms are just as you go inside the park entrance at your left.There are toilets and showers available in the locker room but towels you take inside the park when you leave.I advice to take a locker put on the bading suits and leaving your stuff there. You don't need towels, you will get them at Doplhin bay as well as water or soda drinks, you will need money for buying food and photo's later on!There is a locker available at the Dolphin bay but once you leave there you have to free your locker, and it is quite along walk from the entrance up to the Dolphins.Ok, go to Doplhin bay located at the end of the park. Just past the entrance of the aquaventure park take right you will find "Golf buggy's" they will carry you all the way to Dolphin bay.At the entrance of Dolphin bay present yourself to the person behind the "desk", you get a sort of buzzer that will go of when it is time to go in.Inside first some explanation about the animals and what to do and what not.Ok time to put on the swimsuits as the water of Dolphin bay is 25° C you have the option between a vest only and a suit with( short legged).Take the suit the water is rather chilly since the outside temp is high it feels so.Taking photo's is not allowed inside Dolphin bay in the water nor filming but if you can buy seperate tickets for some to go on the beach and take photo's(see the website for prices).There are photographers in the water and they take your photo's.I have to say this all very professional (camera's are Canon 7D) and the photo's are great!You can buy the photo's in the shop next door, you will see different options and prices.I took the simple USB(this is not the Dophin shaped one) stick priced at 500 UAD(is the least expensive option), expensive yes! But perfect pictures and plenty of them(for my familyof 5 around 90 photo's). so i advice to take this option. Note that it takes 15 minutes to get your photo's.As i said taking photo's with your own camera is allowed but not in the water only from the beach, so that means that someone of your party can not go in the watre with the Dolphines.Once done you take towels and you can take a shower as well, free water and soda are offered.If you leave Doplhin bay you are in the aquaventure waterpark so enjoy the rides!Hope this will help.

PUBLIC RELATIONS ISSUES. I booked for my 2 children the shallow water encounter which included entry to the water park. For myself and my wife i booked 2 tickets to the water park.We were not allowed to go with our children to the encounter and had to pay an additional fee of £60 to go with them.They search your bags to see if you have any food or drinks as they want you to buy theirs,which is very expensive! I felt this was degrading. Also it was £10 for a locker and then our bag wouldn't fit as the locker was approx 15 inch so we had to pay £20.The Dolphin trainers were nice people,polite and friendly but most of the other staff which included the cashier at the front desk, the stewards were rude and arrogant when questioned on specific matters regarding the trip.The photographs being offered for sale are extremely expensive which range from £100 to £550.I would also like to add another major issue which we encountered.Although we booked and paid in full for the Dolphin encounter online and confirmed the date And followed the instructions given, to email 48hrs before whith a copy of our voucher,nobody replied and i had to make several phone calls to Atlantis the palm before this was resolved and had to send the email many times as the email address that they kept supplying was void!! The one they supply is DBX-dolphinbay@atlantisthepalm.com The correct one is dolphinbay@atlantisthepalm.com incase you encounter the same issue. Because of this error my uk phone which was all i had cost over £50 on the many calls i had to make to them to resolve the issue.They didn't offer any apology for this.I would advise you get a local sim card if you are going to Dubai and are planning on visiting Dolphin Bay.I have been as detailed as i can in my review which i believe i am entitled to submit and want to do so for the benefit of anyone who is planning on visiting Dolphin Bay at Atlantis the palm!I have been to do this encounter in Florida Disenyland and found that much more friendly and organised and better value all round.
Unforgettable experience. My three kids have a lovely time with the dolphins. The bay is beautiful, great once in a lifetime experience for everyone.

great attraction. one of its kind. they allow you to play with the dolphins after the show and they are awesome to watch. when they play with there trainer its quite a great view and one would love to watch them and kids will definitely love it. A must watch when u visiting dubai...............

Awesome!. Our son, 5, still talks about his "swim" with dolphins. We were nervous when booking as our son is scared of water, and having dolphins around... we just did not know how exactly it would work. But once you get to the Bay, the staff is super professional and gives you more info then you ever need, in a very entertaining way tailored to all ages. Super experience, and we hope to repeat it again when our daughter turns 5.
Not value for money. Atlantis is a typical Americanized resort and Dolphin bay is part of it.....short time with the Dolphins, a few money making photo opportunities and in/out on 30 mins !!!

Spectacular - really fun!. Our family loved this experience and felt like the dolphins were well-cared for by the Atlantis team. We chose the dolphin encounter for me and my daughter so we could interact with the dolphins in shallow water, and my son and husband chose the deeper water experience so they could be pulled by a dolphin and actually swim with them. Amazing facility and kind staff. Would love to do it again.

Magical!. The interaction with the Dolphins is truly magical an experience not to be forgotten.
The staff are super, informative and helpful.
it is expensive but well worth it!

amazing experience. In the water with an instructor and three other people. The instructor gets the dolphin to do a few tricks and you get to touch and swim with the dolphin. Although not cheap it is an amazing experience.

Wonderful experience. This was the only reason we came to Atlantis Waterpark. It was fantastic and worth the money we paid including the pictures as one gets a memory stick with all the photos and a folder. Free drinks at the end! Our younger son was a bit worried at first in the much colder and deep water but soon got used to the protective vest. The dolphins are gorgeous animals and staff very protective and caring towards them. Can only recommend to anyone who wants to hug and kiss a dolphin :)
Once in a lifetime experience. Wonderful. We got to play with the dolphins, dance, stroke and kiss them. So sweet. Expensive but well worth it.

Lots of fun. The Dolphin Experience was lots of fun, with a short lecture prior to meeting the dolphins and a few minutes with them. They are lovely animals. The experience is very commercialized and pricey but worth it if you've ever wanted to touch a dolphin.
great dolphin encounter. Can highly recommend this - the kids love it. you have plenty of time with the dolphins and the staff are extremly friendlygo for it....best regardsClaus HansenDenmark

Lovely setting. We stayed at the atlantis hotel and decided we wanted to do the swimming with dolphins before we travelled so booked this wit the hotel before we travelled, it is well worth doing this as you get a discount for being a hotel guest and also it does get booked up.We did the royal swim which was just over an hour, it was worth the money as you get to swim round with and get pushed by the dolphins. There is a photographer taking photos throughout, and you can then view and buy the photos, there not cheap but we decided to get all the photos on a USB rather than have them print them which saved money and meant that the photos didn't get squashed in our cases.If you do have someone with you who is not swimming they can pay a fee and go into the location and take photos of you.would definitely recommend this.
What a treat. What an amazing experience. Once in a lifetime chance to learn and touch a Dolphin. Staff very polite, explaining everything..

Brilliant!. Attended Dolphin Bay and did the Shallow water encounter. Trainers are so friendly and make you feel at ease, getting everybody involved in the activity. Only slight disappointment was the cost of the photo's as you can't have your camera with you by the pool you are tied to buy them if you want some memories. We wished we had actually taken part in the deep water encounter afterwards - think you get a lot more for your money so consider which package you would like to do - may be worth paying the extra if you can.

Best Family Experience!. I am an avid reader of Tripadvisor and after reading some of the Dolphin Bay reviews was slightly wary. I always read the "terrible" reviews and these usually give me some insight into the issues I may face.Well my wife pressured me into going and with some trepidation we booked an Adventure at Dolphin Bay. Boy oh boy! Am I glad she convinced me into going. We were staying with friends on The Palm and they decided to come with us. All in all it was my wife, 13YO daughter, myself as well as our really good friends and their 2 teenagers (7 in total). Upon reading up about the interaction I noticed that the adventure group was limited to 6. The reception was friendly and well managed even though Dolphin Bay was super busy. A very nice Arabic lady received us and settled us in (Bushra). A few minutes later we were escorted by one of the friendliest people I have ever met (Gooli) and taken to the change rooms to get ready. As we walked in things got even better as we were enthusiastically greeted by the dolphin team. After getting changed and listening to a wonderfully informative talk we were ready to meet our dolphin. Our friends (french) were kindly placed with a french speaking trainer (Yoen) who they raved about after the interaction. He was friendly and showed a real passion for the dolphins. We were put in a group with our trainer (Brendan) who ensured we had the best family experience we have ever had. Dolphin Bay can be commended on a team of trainers who are passionate and love their jobs. From Shaun who welcomed us to the trainers Brendan and Yvette it was perfect!In the water we met our dolphin Tulagi (the trainers were very patient with me as I asked them how to spell her name). She was gentle and appeared happy and enthusiastic. We loved touching her as she swam past. Her skin was silky smooth. In addition to swimming alongside her and getting many opportunities to interact with her we also got to dance, kiss, hug and get pushed by our hands. The coup de grace was her belly ride which was super exciting and FAST. Although I really loved swimming with her while we were allowed to touch her. So many things impressed me about this interaction but what impressed me most was the care these animals receive from their trainers.What else can I say?Is it expensive? Yes and totally worth it! I imagine it takes a lot of money to maintain the high standards Atlantis has set for housing their dolphins.What about the Photos? We bought the USB for AED600 and have numerous high quality photos. It is expensive and once again worth it. Is anything included? Yes! The Atlantis Water Park is free for those who bought an interaction. They have two huge towers with some of the best rides I have been on.What a day! What an experience! My daughter has insisted we come every year to Dubai so she can visit Tulagi over and over again. It is a pity we live so far away.Thank you dolphin team.

One my daughter will always remember.... Just back from dolphin bay, where my daughter (and us) took part in the Dolphin Adventure. She is 11 and a decent swimmer, but didn't want to do the full swim, this is a brilliant option.A really warm welcome, the hosts show you around and give you the intro. There are lockers and towels in the changing rooms, so you don't need to take your own. You have to take off all jewellery, hair bands etc. if you want your own photos, someone can wait on the beach next to the bay and take pictures - either that or the professional takes plenty that you can then buy.Just a brilliant experience... We all loved it. Really brilliant. Not cheap by any standards, but a once in a lifetime experience awaits.
Fantastic Experience. Do it do it do it! You won't regret it. The trainers are professional. the dolphins are treated with respect. overall I highly recommend the experience
What fun!!. We had a great time at Dolphin Bay the Dolphins were treated so well and the trainers were so friendly and informative about the Dolphins! Will always remember this experience!

Awesome place. This was truly awesome.The entire experience had outstanding customer service and allowed for spectators and personal photography. I can not recommend this place enough. My mum did the Atlantis Dolphin Encounter & was on the beach area, as she is not a confident swimmer. We watched and took great photos from the beach area. She said the experience was second only to her own children's birth; she was grinning for days!

Exceeded my expectations but be prepared to spend some money. I did the Dolphin Encounter today with my wife and we loved every minute with Lennox the Dolphin. It is very well run and they ensure the safety and stress free environment for the dolphins as well as giving us humans a wonderful time with lots of interaction with the Dolphins, Prices are very high including the photos but we would do it again.
unforgettable experience. swimming with the dolphins is a life time experience . if you are in dubai , go for it . staff are great , different choices of activities .

Unforgettable. Trainers, dolphins were great. We had Hilma for our experience - such clever and gentle creatures. We received a discount as guests at the Atlantis but quite expensive, definitely worth every penny. Make sure to take money for pictures, gorgeous momentos!

Swimming with dolphins. Well organised and training session first. Support given when I couldn't lift my arms high enough to catch the fins as the dolphin swam past. Wonderful experience swimming with the dolphin, highly recommended.

It was amazing !. I have been to the Dolphin Bay in Palm Atlantis Dubai.I have booked the Dolphin Encounter as I am not a swimmer ... :)It was an amazing experience !It's quite expensive as you have the experience and you will always want to buy the photos, but worth every penny.The Dolphin Encounter price includes the Atlantis Water Park, so it's better to book the first session with the Dolphins.

Absolutely Amazing! - I kissed a Dolphin, and I liked it!. I was in Dubai for a short trip and had the opportunity to do this, and it was, as I have prviously said...ABSOLUTLEY AMAZING! I have not laughed that much in ages. The photos of me were terrible...that's how much I laughed!It is such an incredible feeling to have a dolphin swim up to you and give you a kiss on the cheek, then to get to swim with her as well. It is something I would recommend to absolutely everybody! I did the Deep Water Exprience, but there is a shallow water experience for those that don't want to venture too deep in the water.I would do it over and ovr again. Somethings are just worth it!

Dolphin experience expensive. My family (wife and 2 kids) paid to do the dolphin experience. It was all well, but the experience is way overpriced and as a spectator me the dad had to pay an extra 100 AED's just to sit on the beach and watch. The photos taken were not good quality and quite blurry and should have been include dint he package or price but it was not.Furthermore, the rest of the Waterpark is expensive with food and drinks, but the rides are excellent. The locker rooms are near the entrance and it is a far walk from the rets of the park to fetch stuff in your locker. Only one person gets a barcode tag around their arm, making it difficult for others to fetch stuff from the locker.

Great Day Out Very Educational. We choose to do the Dolphin Experience in Shallow Waters it was very educational and a great way to interact with the dolphins! Got some great photos and keepsakes! Better still having paid for the experience we got free entry into the park so my advise get an early encounter giving you time to enjoy the beach or water park or wander round the Mall at Atlantis!

A must do experience. We stayed at the Atlantis so my sister and I thought do book the Dolphin encounter. It costed AED 1100 for both of us because we got a little discount. They have a different price list for hotel guests. The overall experience was amazing. We got a chance to hug, kiss and play with the dolphin. The programme went for around 30 minutes and we were part of 9 people group. Dolphins are very loving and cute so in my opinion this is an experience for any age. Also before you go in the water they give you brief information about the dolphins, their anatomy and habits. I just want to add that and the end of the programme you can purchase photos. One photo cost 30 Australian dollars, so if you want to save money and have more photos of yourself with the dolphins the best thing you can do is to ask a family member or a friend to get an OBSERVER PASS (AED 100). In this case the observer pass holder gets a chance to stay on the beach and they can take as many photos as they please.

Great experience. I was mainly surprised of how professional they were. I am a zoo keeper myself and value animal rights HIGH. I was amused. They could expand the time with the dolphins from 30 min to maybe 45 min. Otherwise, great time.AND; the acces to the water park was worth the money too!

Must Swim Dolphins. Fabulous experience-a must do experience, trainers are brilliant full of information as well, ask lots of questions, never knew dolphins were so soft to touch, gives you free entrance to Atlantis water park as well. Amazing awesome place to visits along will fab shopping mall to go with it....

amazing experience. We have 30 minutes fun with the dolphins *with female dolphin Tina:)" and great instructors, this worth every penny.Than all day in Atlantis water park, the water park was amazing also, huge so it isn't too crowded, clean with friendly staff.

Wonderful Experience. Our experience at the Dolphin Bay was great. My five-year-old son loved kissing, touching and playing with the Venita - the dolphin that we met. It is pricey but it is worth it. How many times do you get a chance to be so close to a dolphin to dance with her? Go for it!

Lovely Experience. Have always wanted to swim with dolphins, and although nothing quite compares to seeing them in the wild this was a truly amazing experience. The trainers are very experienced and clearly care a lot about the dolphins and were very in tune with the dolphins behaviour ensuring they were happy through the process.Think its something most people want to do and I would certainly recommend it.

up close and personal with a dolphin is truly royal. Reception at the dolphin bay was very organised. Polite staff and knowledgable, trainers were brilliant. You get a locker for free for your session's time and a free drink after. The royal swim was an amazing experience. It is pricey but you can see how the fee is used, the dolphins are well kept and seem happy in their environment. You get to touch, swim, kiss and hug the dolphin. I highly recommend this and wish the session was a bit longer.

Loved it. My daughter and I loved the experience and found it value for money as you also get free entry to the water park.I did think AED40.00 was a bit too much to hire a locker in the waterpark though

Royal swim breath taking. Brilliant would highly recommend .
Swimming with the dolphins was amazing.
But £85 for pictures on a USB stick was heavy considering it was over £300 to swim with the dolphins.

Amazing experience. We did the Royal Dolphin sim where you get to swim with 2 dolphins. It was an amazing experience that I recommend to everyone. It was a lot of fun, I only wish it was a bit longer.

Beautiful dolphin bay. I was nervous at first but the dolphins were so calming, really enjoyed every minute. Photos can be bought after but you can not video the experience, spectators also have to purchase a viewing ticket.
Great !!!. The dolphin bay in Dubai offers guests a unique opportunity to see dolphins swimming and even to get in with them!

Spellbinding. There is nothing to dislike about this attraction - friendly, knowledgeable staff give a brief presentation about the dolphins (do's, don'ts etc) before you enter the water and spend some spellbinding time interacting with your new friend - we'll be back to see you next year Cathy!
Great day!. We swam with the dolphins at the Atlantis and had a great day! The water park was awesome too - and huge so it isn't too crowded. Very clean, great staff.

Fantastic Experience. The whole experience was wonderful. It is a must do. The trainers and the staff are all very polite and the whole thing was very well organised. The dolphins are lovely and very well cared for.
amazing experience. The trainers are fantastic and the center is beautiful! all the staff are well trained. My children have a new found love for Dolphines.

Flip about with “Flipper".. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff at Dolphin Bay. There was a very informative video first and a talk from a staff member who was very knowledgable on all things connected with dolphins and obviously old her job. For me this was a dream come true and I loved every second of it and would recommend it to anyone.
Great experience. Amazing experience swimming with dolphins. Also, you get the opportunity to buy pictures taken during the session afterwards. Wish the session lasted a little longer though.

Great experience. We did the Dolphin adventure experience. We are a couple with four more people to interact with one dolphin. The reception was great because we was luck to be received by a portuguese speaker. She did a great welcome and arranged a portuguese speaker dolphin trainer. We did not asked for this, so was a great and good surprise. The briefing and the introduction was very good too. On the water was a great experience interact with the dolphin. The dolphin did very nice tricks with us and we kissed, swim, dance, hug, and had a very good time. The only point I did not liked was the picture service. I have a gopro camera and I intended to use, but I am not allowed. Conclusion: They have a photo service. The pictures was not good and the price is very expensive. But the experience with the dolphins worth the price. I would recommend.
WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE. This was a great day out and one will never forget. I would recommend it. it is a wonderful pace to visit and I would go back.

Brilliant experience but a little expensive. Worth doing if you can.. Fantastic lifetime experience to be able to swim with dolphins and do all the deep water activities. The royal swim is well worth it and you also get to be pushed and get a dorsal tow

Amazing Experience. i had a wonderful time at the park, other than the price to see the dolphin. we only spent 30mins with the dolphin and half of the time they were educating us about the dolphin which was just time consuming.the water was cold, as i expected the water luke warm but that wasn't the case. i will love to go again but this time around it will only be for the adventure park and not to see the dolphin. i got to kiss the dolphin and also hug it which was very nice and warm.

Awesome !!!. Nothing to be disliked here other than the pricing. Tip : catch someone at the ticket counters (outside the counters on your side, normally a promotion guy) slip him some 100 dirhams and he will be able to give you a relief of almost 1000 aed.We went as 4 adults and 2 kids. It should be on your first priority if you are visiting dubai with family and kids. The prep before show is very educative and informative. Everything is taken care of here in terms of special suits, toilets, drinking water, waiting lines, sitting area, lounges etc. Once you are done with the show, do not forget to take all your photos in a usb drive. Ask for their complete packages info and there you will find it (close to 500 AED). People who do not wish to go in water with dolphins need not buy tickets for dolphin show, they can simply enjoy the show few steps away on the private beach on lounges.

Informative and fun. The Dolphin Bay experience was informative with the briefing done before the experience about dolphins, and the encounter with the dolphins was nice and fun. The water was very cold and you really get to be close to the dolphin but all was quick and the parents waiting for their kids got burned by the sun so be careful.

Brill. Took my daughter to swim with Dolphins it was well on her top things to do ,and she certainly love it. Expensive or not it was well worth it to see and hear her reactions. However no need to pay silly money for the photo's that they take. If your child is 12 and over then you just get a observers pass and take as many as you want when you want and you stand about 5 metres away. I got some crackers and took some for others.

A must for the kids. My daughters got in with the dolphins ( not swam but there is that option) and loved it. They petted them, did tricks and fed them. Great photos to keep of a very memorable moment.
Wonderful Experience. A brilliant morning out! Would highly recommend a visit and the girls enjoyed themselves interacting with the Dolphins.
Awesome. it was like a dream came true. good instructors and stunning dolphins, you can touch hug and kiss the dolphin.you also get a chance to either play or dance with the dolphin.

Brilliant. Great experience. We did the deep water adventure and it was amazing. Well worth the money. You get to kiss, hug and dance with the dolphins. Finally they pull you back to shore. Trainers were very friendly and knowledgeable.

Well Worth!. This was our first time swimming with dolphins and it did not disappoint. We had the Dolphin experience and will never forget this experience. Not everyday we are able to be so close and play with the dolphins.
Must do!

Wow, just WOW!. I got myself an "Dolphin Adventure" ticket as a self-pampering gift for my solo trip in Dubai, and totally love it. I'm so glad that I made right decision to spend my time here. The experience is very special as you not only play with the dolphin, but actually learn and understand them.The check in was smooth, as you would be kindly asked to wait outside before they can put you into groups. After that you will be given a wet suit, and a float jacket (this helped a lot since you will be able to tread water easier) - the changing room is really nice, with a lovely aroma floating around in the air, so refreshing. You will then be escorted to meet Dolphin trainer where they will provide you a very detail section about dolphin. I totally love it!Then here come the highlight of the section - meeting with the dolphin. Each group will have 6 people to play with 1 dolphin (ours is Abbi - she is so cute!!!!) and 2 trainers. For my section of Dolphin Adventure, we got a chance to 1) Touch the dolphin 2) Swim with it 3) Enjoy Dolphin Kiss & Dance 4) Giving Dolphin Hug & Sway with them. I think this experience is AMAZING, no wonder why some of the scientist confirm that playing with dolphin can help children enhance their ability to interact and prevent autism. Even as an adult, when playing with these playful creature, I felt such an enormous joy as if my inner child was yelling to get out and play. Totally unique experience.Although some people may say that the whole activity is really "generic for tourists", but I partly disagree. If you can see the joy and passion of the staffs during the section, you will see how much they care for the dolphin and their well-being. I am so glad that I after the trip, I'm not only happy to see the dolphin, but also be inspired by the trainers' passion as well.The only downside that hinder me to give a 5 stars in this review is the quality of the professional photoshoot. Although the price is highly expensive (80 AED for 1 standard photo, 500 AED for USB with all of your photos, and variety of photo package - including print out and usb starting from 800 to 1200 AED), I'm really willing to spend them as I want to have something to keep for this precious moment, but well, the whole shoot was really bad. Most of the photos of me is like in bad lightning condition, blur in the face, shoot from far away - not any close-up shoot to capture any great moment. What a shame!But overall, I think the experience was worthwhile with top-noted service, and you get the free pass to the water park, the Atlantis pool, & the beach as well - it's worth for 800 AED - I highly recommend this activity. Well, maybe next visit, I will try the scuba dive with the dolphin then.

Dolphin Show at Dubai Creek. Its a very good live show of Dolphins and Sea Lions. The show keeps everyone with awes for 45 minutes with amazing performance one after another by 5 / 6 dolphins and 3-4 Sea Lions. The dolphins performed to the perfection and it is proved that dolphins are the best friend and substitute for surprising stunts under water. Hats off to the trainers and organizers. They wont allow the audiences to remain idle for a single moment with one or the other continuous lively performance.

What an experience!. We had an amazing day at Dolphin Bay, it wasn't rushed or cramped (which Discovery Cove can be) and the staff did everything to help two toddlers get the most out of their experience. The only negative that I would say is that the photography wasn't as good as it could have been, which was a common complaint at the end of the day. Our package had more than 2/3 of the pictures where you couldn't see us - the three or four pictures that we did get were good, but not brilliant.
Meet the dolphins. We had great time during dolphin royal swim and dolphin adventure. If you are in Dubai is must to do activity, forget about borring shopping meet the dolphins.....

Very Special. The Dolphin experience is so well organised and the whole vibe is amazing... spend a few moments in the water with these beautiful mammals and understand why this is so incredible... my wife had a smile on her face for the rest of the holiday because of this...
Black is amazing. A kiss, a spin, & a ride with BLACK was unforgettable. Richard you do an amazing job with Black & are extremely professional, enjoyed the day immensely...

Well organised chaos!. During our summer holiday in Dubai, we thoroughly enjoyed our dolphin adventure at Dolphin Bay. We were lucky as a family of 5 to get our own trainer and dolphin for the full 30 minutes.The initial process from signing waivers, getting your wetsuit and changing was relatively well organised but could be better managed with more staff. The locker rooms and showers were also in desperate need of a clean.We would strongly recommend the Dolphin Adventure over the Encounter purely by the amount of contact you get with the dolphin in comparison - it is worth it!

A must see. Where else can you do this? What an experience - my daughter (5) thoroughly enjoyed this as did her dad! - very professional and informative staff who clearly care sooooo much about the dolphins.
Kids loved it!. It was a great experience to visit Dolphin Bay and swim with the dolphins. I would only say just remember that you don't have to stay at the Atlantis to share this opportunity!

A dream come true. I opted for the deep water experience which was amazing. We were very lucky that it wasn't full so we had lots of time with the dolphin, actually there were two dolphins which made it extra special. The staff were excellent and helpful, nothing was too much trouble. Yes it was expensive but it was worth every penny, I will never forget it! The water park was amazing, the food was good and reasonably priced but it was very hot! I would definitely do it again, it was the main reason we visited Dubai!

Good Kids Experience. Nothing like swimming with dolphins .We swim in a large pool landscaped beach with Atlantis prepared the park accompanied by trainers and contact with the dolphin is almost constant. It is super endearing.For my children, I think they remember the moment for life.The only downside is that it is not allowed to take video or pictures.The entire establishment sit on its own section, with all convenience of showers, changing room, towel, wetsuit of choice, lecture theater and lectures before the activity.High price but well worth it.Come to think of the cost of operating such a facility and the small group per Dolphin, you may have second thought about it being expensive ?

Good fun. Kids enjoyed holding and kissing the dolphins. The time spent with the Dolphins is only about 30 minutes but it takes too much time to reach that point with changing and demonstration etc. The photos are expensive

Loved it!. Loved the way that the team at Dolphin Bay give you a short educational piece about the dolphins. The interaction is handled very well. We did the shallow water encounter due to our daughter's age (4). She still talks about Blackie the dolphin, about how he felt silky and warm and that he breathes through his blow hole and eats fish. Educational and fun, I love it!

A must see!. My husband and I were dubious after reading some of the reviews but it was truely amazing and excellent value for money we had our dolphin encounter with cathy the Dolphin and Anita! Everything about it was excellent and gave us memories to treasure for a lifetime. If we had time we would of done it all over again
Aquaventure swimming with dolphins. Excellent fun. Well organised. Great friendly staff. And you get the use f the waterpark for the rest of the day.
My children loved it, me too. We love dolphins. It was amazing to watch them able to follow instruction and performed . The dolphins were well trained.
Once in a life time experience. Great value for money x a good couple of hours for the family to spend together ! Free transfer from the hotel and a jump to the aqua park afterwards.

What an experience!. Unforgettable day! In a small group we were taken down to the waters edge and we were entertained by some tricks, then we could pet the dolphin. The keepers were brilliant as we danced with the dolphin and kissed it! The entrance to the water park made the day unforgettable. A must for anyone visiting Dubai!

Fantastic experience!. This was our first time swimming with dolphins and it did not disappoint. We were given a brief presentation which give us an insight into the dolphins and how to behave around them. The staff were extremely knowledgeable and friendly definitely made the experience that bit more memorable. There are photographers on hand to take plenty of photos, which are slightly pricey around £120 for eight print outs and the rest on a USB. Definitely an unforgettable experience and one that I would 100% recommend to anyone! Included in the price is a day pass for the Adventure Waterpark at the Atlantis which is fun for the whole family, a fantastic day out.
Great, well worth the visit. We did this as part of our holiday with a group of 4-adults. Well worth the visit, a tad expensive however utterly magical. You must book!!

Flipper and I. What an amazing experience for the entire family. We did this twice and both times it is always great. You can choose several packages in the water, swimming with the dolphins, the ideal is to go there in a group of at least 8 so that you are all on the same picture otherwise you end up with a frame at home with some guys you never met before...

Would do it all again !. Stayed at Atlantis recently and did the Dolphin adventure which was at a reduced guest rate (I think 10 or 15% cheaper) and had a superb time doing the 'Dolphin Adventure'.Great staff and an amazing location make the visit a thoroughly enjoyable experience and as for the Dolphins they seem to be loved and well cared for and enjoying the day as much as you do.We had Deneeta a young dolphin and she was gorgeous.The obligatory photos are expensive (over £100 for two mounted pics and the rest on DVD) but they are everywhere not just here.We have done the Dolphin swim in Orlando which was superb but Dubai has the edge as we spent more time actually interacting with the Dolphins in the water and everyone had a short display by all the Dolphins to finish.Loved it and would happily go again.

A bit pricey, but absolutely enjoyable.. staff were very polite, it was an enjoyable experience the only fault is that , i went to swim with the dolphins in disneyworld ( usa) and as i wasn't a comfortable swimmer they offered me a lift jacket and we went in the deep waters, ATlantis Dubai do not offer this option and if you cannot swim confidently then we could only do the knee high waters where we had to share the experience with other in the group and because of that there was not a lot of one to one time.but overall it was lovely

Great experience.. My 6 year old son loved this and even me. We had the Dolphin experience and will never forget this experience. Not everyday we are able to be so close and play with the dolphins.Only thing is that it was a bit expensive.

A nice, but pricy, overall experience. The kids loved the interaction with the dolphins. I think we should have had more time for the high price we paid. The photographer did not do a good job in clearly capturing my children happy faces in most of the activities with the dolphins.

omg lovely. these creatures never fail to amaze me...i loved this ..something i have experienced before but husband hadn't..he loved it. although i really do hate to see animals in captivity,these lovely creatures do seem to be happy and as far as i could see are kept very well

Dophin Fun !. My daughter did the Dolphin Encounter and we got beach passes (100 dhs each). As a guest the price for the encounter was cheaper than for non-guests.The instructors were ace and had them interacting with the dolphin for ages. As a beach guest you can take pictures but no filming is allowed but we had an Ipad mini so who knew !Refreshments are provided after the encounter.Fantastic experience - its a must !

Great fun. Good experience for young and old alike. With the Dolphin Encounter, you get to go in the shallow water and touch the dolphin, kiss and cuddle it, throw a ring or ball which is brought back to you or dance with the dolphin. Informative talk at the beginning. Complimentary soft drinks at the end. You can have a friend or family member take photos from the shore. The cost is 550 Dhs if staying at the Atlantis, but for the experience is probably worth it. It is quite hot in the summer so choose an early morning or late evening slot if going in summer.

It's an Experience. My 2 girls went on the shallow water experience. We had skywards membership, but Atlantis wouldnt accept this they said the cost was already low!!!!! what Atlantis had done was reduce the cost of the price for August but slghtly more than what we would have got as a discount as a skyward member. 550 they charged but we would have only paid 500 with Skywards!! Typical Atlantis squeezing every penny out of the guests. We paid for visitor passes which allows you access to the beach and lets you take photo's but the photographer kept getting in the way. In the end I told him to move as we had paid to take photo's not just watch, he did move, so we got some very good photo's ourselves. Don;t be scared to do this, after all it's not free, so you have a right, especally when they do the one to one part, it's not like you are spoiling the group photo's. We did buy 2 photo's at 80 dirham each, very expensive for what you get but comes in a nice wallet type frame, the girls wanted a souvenir. I wasnt sure about them doing this experience as I find it difficult to understand why creatures so beautiful are taken from the wild and transferred to these type of places all over the world, but on the other hand I know their chance of survival in the wild is remote as well as they would be probably killed for food. The talk they do before you go to meet the dolphins is informative and interesting and it is clear the staff at dolphin bay really love their dolphins and care about their welfare. When you are in the water with the dolphins they flip rings, balls and also dance for you, one on one, they kiss and cuddle you, all for plenty of fish treats, the staff also do a talk and show you how to tell if they are boy/girl dolphins which lots of informative information, touching and stroking. My girls loved meeting the dolphins and say they learnt a lot.

Emotional Experience.. This is really an emotional experience to be in such close contact with the dolphins. It is expensive but worth every penny, when ever will one be able to do so again and in such safe surroundings. The staff were really good and caring and took great pictures. I had a wonderful time here . These animals are so beautiful, caring and truely amazing, it was fab to be in their magical presence!

definitely recommend. If you have enough money to aford it i definitely recommend. DOlphins are kid of magical animals. I had a good moment even it does not look like the tv spots. But anyway it's very nice !

Amazing. Always dreamed of swimming with dolphins this was amazing my 18month old was amazed n had wicked time seen loads of other places never fort it was worth the ,only in other countries but here is top of the range the dolphins are cared for perfectly n treated with as much respect as a human the best part you are in water with dolphin for at least half a hour you dance play touch dolphins awwwwsome

How often do you get to do this ?. What a great experience. I went in with the kids and it was fabulous. Like everything else at this resort, it's incredicbly expensive as were the photos taken by Dolphin Bay ( you are not allowed to take your own pictures) but when in Rome....!

Dolphin Bay ... Expensive but worth it.... High price but well worth it, IMO. The entire establishment sit on its own section, with all convenience of showers, changing room, towel, wetsuit of choice, lecture theatre and lectures before the activity. You are actually in the water and can touch the Dolphin! Is not much excitement for me but it was for my children. I think they remember the moment for life.The professional photographers were courteous enough to allow you to take pictures now and then which I appreciate. Come to think of the cost of operating such a facility and the small group per Dolphin, you may have second thought about it being expensive ?

Lovely experience. My husband & 2 children met the dolphins, while I took some very memorable photographs. They didn't swim with them as my son wasn't old enough, they just touched them, do a trick with them & generally be in the water with them.

Brilliant Experience. My 7yr old daughter & I did the shallow water experience with Booker the Dolphin, we all danced played kiss and hugged Booker was an amazing day and the dolphins are so well looked after and cared for. The excitement and happiness on the kids faces is well worth it.

Swimming with dolphins. You must go to Dolphin Bay and swim with dolphins! It's amazing! You will remember it forever. Being pushed by a dolphin at 35 miles an hour is something you probably will never experience in your life! Definitely one of the most memorable experiences of my life.

A memeory for a life time. We did the Dolphin Adventure program & got to spend so much time in the water interacting with the Dolphins.The instructors were very enthusiastic, and gave you a chance to kiss, hug, dance and belly swim with the dolphins.Don't worry about the cost of the pictures at the end this is probably something you will only do once in your life so enjoy it! I bought only one picture then took a picture of it with my I phone to use for digital use.
Just out of the world. We played with the Dolphins here for the first time in our life. It was a wonderful experience to touch, feel, dance and spend more than 40 minutes with dolphins.
Memorable Experience!. We had a good time there, nice and enjoyable experience, but the costs of the photos are a bit too high. Very helpful staff.

Lovely Memories. Booked the Dolphin encounter on our arrival at the hotel for me and my daughter. We both had a really great time with Central our dolphin. The trainers were very knowledgeable and made my small daughter feel very comfortable. Really glad we completed this activity and we will have special memories forever.
Unforgtable. Amazing experience! Very well organized and great chance to experience swimming with dolphins. Great for kids and adults

Always leaves you smiling. We have visited Dolphin Bay 3 times, doing the shallow water experience twice and the deep water once. The organization is great and the trip is eductaional. The animals are treated with respect and care and the staff clearly love their jobs. We have always left with smiles and lasting memories. The shop/photos could offer better value for money.

Not as good as I'd hoped. While staying the atlantis we decided to take this up. Having had a dolphin encounter before we assumed we would really enjoy this but it wasn't that great or worth the money. I'd say its more suited to kids to give them a first experience but I didn't think much of it.

Kids will love this. Staff were excellent. dolphins beautiful and the guides very informative. Our kids really enjoyed it. It is expensive but the experience is exceptional. We still talk about the memorable day.

A must. Swim with the dolphins worth every dirham . Liked everything . Photos are too expensive .staff are very friendly and helpful. The dolphins are the cutest . Royal swim is pricy but once in a life time must do .

Incredible Experience. This was an amazing day for our adult family, however, it is quite an expensive day out. Between cost of swimming with the Dolphins and the Photographic packages it would not have been possible for our family to afford this had we not made it our treat. They will carry the memories with them forever and made their visit all the more special. Price includes day at Atlantis Water Park and discount to the Aquarium but still beyond a lot of visitors budgets. The staff were amazing and the Dolphins incredible and beautiful.

An Experience. My kids and husband had an experience of a lifetime while I took photos. The venue and staff was top notch. The dolphins and trainers were incredible. Each person had lots of individual time with the dolphins. Only downside was you were not allowed to video it.

Great experience!. Booked an encounter visit for myself and my two siblings, yes expensive but I thought it was worth it. The changing rooms and toilets were all clean and well kept. Nothing was rushed, everyone got their fair time with the dolphin. There is about 8-10 people per group and while one of the group was getting ready for their personal time (a dance, kiss, hug etc) the leader would bring the dolphin past the group for frequent chances to give the dolphin a rub/touch. They provide a choice of either full suit or a life vest & towels. Once the experience is over they provide soft drinks. My other half and mum bought an observer pass which was enough for them to get all the pics we needed without having to spend extra. Enjoyed our experience, would recommend to others :)
Nice and fun. Super expensive!. Fun and clean. Kids loved it and had loads of fun. Be prepared to pay, pay and pay! The facility was top notch, staff was fluent in English and was friendly.
Good for one time experience. It is little expensive but good for one time experience 1 hour is more than for the tour unless you want to enjoy water park
memorable. We booked a session whilst staying at the Atlantis for our family of 4. Expensive to do but kids and adults really enjoyed the once in a lifetime experience

Absolutely Amazing Experience!. We booked our tix via Atlantis trip for "Dolphin Encounter" and was well worth it! Very clean facilities! Staff was excellent, very informative and fun! They were running about 20 minutes behind, but no big deal. Life jackets/wetsuits were provided along with complimentary lockers and changing rooms. We were split into groups of 8ish and everyone had equal time with the dolphin. Professional photographers took excellent pictures of all individuals and groups with dolphins. We purchased 8 printed photos + USB with as many photos as we wanted for 600AED or $164US, but well worth it and I hate spending money haha! If you want to take pictures of friends/family, you can pay and stay on the beach or take them with a high powered camera from the waiting area. Was the highlite of my 13 yr. old son's trip! There was a 4/5 year old in our group who really enjoyed it as well. Actual encounter time was about 40 minutes, but the whole event took about 2 hrs. Planning to do the "Swimming w/Dolphins trip. Something you/kids will always remember:)

Wonderful Experience. Visited here with my sister for her birthday. The whole experience was excellent. Very well prepared and worth the money. The dolphins are well looked after and lovely. Our pass also allowed us access to the waterpark which was good with a variety of different rides.
we loved the Dolphins. A place that every family dream to see and visit , i know every activity in the Dolphin bay is expensive ,its an experience you must try especially if you love the Dolphins

Spend an Afternoon with the Dolphins @ Atlantis, The Palm. I booked my ticket online prior to my arrival. It is worth it. I did not have to stand in a long ticket line and instead, went straight to "Will Call" for my ticket. There is a shuttle that will take you to "Dolphin Bay, or you can walk over to the area, which is about 1/4 mile away. Upon arrival, you will be required to attend the 15 minute orientation and then directed to the locker room to suit up in the wet-suit. Wet-suits are provided, free of charge, by Dolphin Bay.You will be assigned to one of the dolphin trainers, into a group of 6-7 people (when I went, I was in a group of 6), You will have an opportunity to have your photo taken with the dolphin in various poses. The pictures can be purchased and you can select one to be made into a key chain. I still carry mine and often receive compliments and questions. My dolphin's name was Lennox,Dolphin Bay would be a wonderful experience for the whole family.

Good but...... Visited recently with my daughter. Booked both tickets online before we came. My husband bought an observer pass on the day. 300 dirhams which included access to water park too as not staying at the hotel. Just be aware you are asked to remove all jewellery including wedding rings and hair baubles and sun glasses etc.Just a bit too bright for me without sunglasses. All the trainers have theirs on though!Good interaction with dolphins but spoiled a bit by the commercialism of selling photographs. My husband was able to take photographs from the beach but you usually have your back to the beach. Felt very Disney.

The only part of Atlantis worth a visit!. We really dislike the Atlantis resort. It is way overpriced, always overly busy and the staff are extremely rude! This is the only part that's worth a visit though. Pricey again but well worth the experience. The dolphin's are well looked after, great trainers and some great photographs to last a lifetime! :)
Great swim. Had a great afternoon with the dolphins. They put you in quite large groups though so you only get 2 swims each and a photo opportunity.
Great. Dolphin Bay is amazing we really enjoyed it however did find that it was very over priced for what you actually got to do and see with the dolphins.
Best Day. Such an amazing experience! I did the Royal Dolphin Swim... this was excellent!! We had lots of time with the dolphin, in small groups of 4. Best experience!

excellent show. Best for children. The dolphins, walhrus...the kids will just love them
The stadium is indoors......and the show is very professionally managed
swimming with dolphins. we swam with the dolphins, was a wonderful experience was rather expensive, did'nt get the opportunity to take many photos, so we had to buy them which where very expensive
Dolphins. It was lovely to be able to be so close to the dolphins and they do it in small groups which is nice too.

Amazing. We had a wonderful time swimming with the dolphins! It was great! I definitely recommended it!
Very well organized and very kids oriented! Great!
Good day for old and young. An excellent fun and educational day, the cold water was a god send after the warm water of the sea and water park.

A touching experience. This was great for adults and kids alike, although quite expensive. A professional photographer takes photos of everyone's interactions with the dolphins, and it is very hard to resist buying some afterwards. The trainers were friendly and very informative; we learnt a lot about looking after and training dolphins, as well as having the magical experience of getting up close and personal with a dolphin.Highly recommended.

AWESOME EXPERIENCE!. My 10 year old son was forunate enough to have experienced swimming with 5 different dolphins that are at Dolphin Bay (different experiences)- and it was all very memorable for him. His favourite however, was a part of the royal swim where he was pulled around by 2 dolphins while holding on to their fins. This is best for more able swimmers as they (dolphins) go quite fast and it is a possiblity that the child might not be able to catch them as they zip past. However, a wet suit and vest is provided :)

Great amount of contact with Dolphins.. I was concerned we had to book before we arrived but there were ample time slots available to choose from when there. Well organised and explained. Good amount of contact with dolphins.

Best birthday present ever. This was my birthday present which we managed to book on the actually day its self, well worth the money, the dolphin's are fab and really looked after, the trainer's really make sure you all have one to one time and do not rush you . Well recommended this is something that I have always wanted to do and glad that I did it.

Very Nice!. Just that the photo fun experience should have more time span with the dolphins as the age group (young children) that opt for it would love to enjoy this new experience with more time in hand.

Encounter with Lexi. My husband and I did the Dolphin Encounter and our dolphin's name was Lexi. It was a wonderful experience and we have pictures which we will treasure forever! A must do activity for anyone who loves dolphins!
Dolphin Bay. Daughter fulfilled an ambition. Lived up to all her expectations. Great to see Starbucks there as missed grabbing an iced coffee.

DIVING DOLPHINS. The display was magnificent and we enjoyed it from beginning to end. It was really exciting for our granddaughter to get up close to these amazing animals. Mankind surely used to play with them long ago, before we started living on the shore.
Quite good!. My wife and two daughters loved each and every minute we spent there! Totally worth the visit although very hot and jam packed

Great.... but Expensive!. My wife has always wanted to spend time with a dolphin, and so we duly booked the Dolphin encounter at Atlantis.First word of warning is that they are NOT cheap - AED 620 each, with no discount for kids (mine are 6 & 4). If you are able to plan ahead of time you can get a 50 dirham discount if you book more than 14 days ahead. Second warning is that you are not allowed to take any camera into the water with you. I fully understand considering the environment you are entering and safety to the dolphins. The drawback is that you are reliant on the in-house photographers to capture these special moments. Once again the photo's do not come cheap. Although, there are various packages available, they all come at a price.So, now that the negative is out of the way, the experience really is great. The groups are relatively small (could be smaller), and you get a few different interactions with the dolphin. They are truly amazing creatures and it is great to see them so close up. The team handling the interaction were also great, and they try and ensure a good experience for everyone (including the dolphin).Due to the nature of the activity, the experience with the dolphin does not last much longer than 30 - 40 minutes, so if you are happy to pay the price, especially considering the time in the water, then it is well worth it!
Dolphin Bay. It was an emotional experience which I suggest everyone tries.The Staff are extremely informative and encouraging.Its quieter at this time of year.

Young kids. We have swam with dolphins before, in Mauritius and it was a very special experience. So when we've taken our 3 and 5 year old kids to experience swimming with the dolphins in shallow water, was a treat.Our kids absolutely loved every minute of it and so did we!After you are given wet suits, there is a short presentation and movie before you go in the water, for your 30 minutes session. You cant have any hair clips, jewellery or anything that can hurt them and please pay attention to the instructions given as these are very important to keep the dolphins safe and the experience a pleasurable one to everyone since you might be with other families if you are not in a big group. The staff is friendly, professional and knowledgeable. This is certainly an experience of a lifetime - to be able to interact, dance, play, kiss, touch the dolphins and especially to learn about these lovely and intelligent creatures!It is not cheap and worth every penny. If you can swim and are not with kids, recommend the more advanced experience.If you can't swim, go for the shallow water experience and allow yourself this experience.After your session is over, enjoy the cold drinks and make the most of you ticket by spending the rest of your day at the water park. Try booking the first session in the morning to really make the most of your money.

Shallow water experience. I bought the shallow water experience for my partner as a birthday present and we both had a fantastic time. The experience involves first checking in at the entrance of the Atlantis, then walking/buggying your way across the water park to Dolphin Bay. You then go through a series of check-ins, are given a locker and a choice of vest or wetsuit to change into and finally have to sit through a 15 minute educational presentation about dolphins. You are then split into groups of a maximum of 10 people per dolphin. The actual experience in the water lasts 30 minutes and is well organised and very fun. Each member of the group gets to have their photo taken whilst kissing and hugging the dolphin and then are given the opportunity to choose an activity (dancing or throwing a toy for the dolphin to fetch). The trainers are friendly and despite my initial reservations about paying to see dolphins in captivity, the trainers do make you feel that the dolphin's well-being is a priority and they are very well cared for. The only bad point is the ridiculous cost of the professional photos, it's worth noting that it costs less to buy a beach pass and have a friend take your own photos about 15 ft away from the action. Overall, an excellent experience and the free entry into Aquaventure is an added bonus.(tip - valet your car at the Avenues entrance and you can get your valet ticket validated at the ticket window)

A day to remember. Went to Dolphin bay and it was the time of my self it not right to come all this way and miss this great attaction. the picture and memory of it will be one the greatest of all in dubai
Whats to say. The royal swim a little disappointing when the dolphin pushes his nose into the sole of your foot ouch!
Fantastic. Great day out, my son loved it, helpful staff, excellent facilities, lovely beach to spectate and complementary drinks after session.

Super fun!. I must admit there is something about grabbing the fins of 2 dolphins as they pull you across the water. Its absolutely amazing. The staff was very helpful, and they were extremely energetic! They seem super pumped for what they do. There is no downfall to this experience. I suggest anyone that has a love for animals get a chance to scope it out!

Absolutely amazing!!!. I swam with dolphins a couple of years ago in mexico and absolutely loved it and have always wanted my girlfriend to experience it. So on our honeymoon as a treat we decided that we would both book a royal swim at dolphin bay. Although initially the price is quite steep (about £165 each, for 30 minutes) after we done it we both agreed it was totally worth every penny. The whole experience in the water last about 30 minutes and in that time you get to play and touch the dolphin in the shallow waters then you go into the deeper waters where the dolphins will push you along by your feet, and they will kiss you and you grab their fins as they drag you along in the water. Great fun. If your not a great swimmer then its not to bad as the lifejackets keep you afloat and not alot of the experience is in the deeper waters. It was absolutely amazing just went to quick, definately feel that you should have a little more time with them. And the only negative was the fact that the photos were very expensive to buy afterward, with the price of the experience you should get at least one photo free. But definately recommend it.

great dolphin experience. my wife and i took our two boys on the half hour experience. its relatively expensive but really worth it. the boys got to interact with the dolphin and they take lots of photos. they loved it and so did we.

Great Experience. My 5 year old absolutely loved the Dolphin interaction - we had much more exposure to the dolphins than I would have expected. The trainers were excellent and the whole experience left me with a big smile on my face! I would recommend this to anyone (unless you have a dolphin or water phobia)!

Great Fun. As part of my wifes birthday we booked to have a Dolphin Encounter at Dolphin Bay, Atlantis The Palm; with one exception it was one of the best 30mins ever!we were a little worried that it was going to be too staged or tha we wouldn't get to meet the dolphins properly but it was excellent; the trainers are friendly, knowledgable & they all have the same ethos.... the dolphins come first!Our dolphin (strangely named Central) was absolutely adorable and appeared to enjoy the attention & games; her two trainers were very friendly & funny.as part of the ticket you also get access to the Aquaventure park & the private beach; the grounds are amazing, the staff at friendly and conciencious.The only down side to the whole day was the queue! Despite booking online we still had to queue to get our wrist bands (needed to get in); normally this wouldn't be an issue but it was hot & humid, and there were only 3 staff on the counters.My advice would be to get there at least an hour before your time slot.
swim with dolphins. great experience and laugh, our female dolphin is in love with another male dolphin and kept swimming off to join him. Just as well I can tread water waiting for her to come back.

Great experience. Turned up for a morning with the dolphins and had a fantastic time meeting one and playing in the water, but sadly due to a thunderstorm & heavy rain the experience had to be called off half way through. Dolphin bay gave us a full refund and the staff were excellent, and I intend to visit again some time soon.
Amazing ..... Fantastic experience learning facts about these amazing creatures and then the added bonus of meeting one. We met and fell in love with Alice who will always be an amazing memory.

great experience. Birthday visit - booked the shallow water dolphin experience for 620AED and a beach observer pass for 300 AED. Both allow you access to aquaventure waterpark. No locker is included for Aquaventure but you do get use of one whilst at Dolphin bay during your experience. Kiss, coudle and touch the dolphins. There are groups of no more than 10, only downside is there are lots of kids, they could do with an adult group? since they split everyone up after the presentation. Beach observer pass is a good idea as the pictures are 80aed for 1 by the pofessional photographer. We booked the 10:30am on a saturday experience which worked well. Drive to the Avenues enterance and mention you are at dolphin bay and its free valet, no need to park a mile away and get a shuttle. You can go in early to the waterpart too! so you can get a nice sunbed for after the dolphin experience.All in all a good day out!

Magical. Expensive but hey how many times are you ever going to this. We opted for the Dolphin adventure. There were 5 people in our group to a dolphin. It is a well planned experience. The staff do their best to make you feel that you aren't part of a continual process. Although you are only really in the water for around 30 mins it does feel longer.Good luck getting out through the photo area without buying something. I think we paid well over £100 for the photos of our visit but for that you get every photo that they have taken of you on a USB plus you can select the best 8 which they will print out in A5(ish) size. Great time thank you.

Wonderful experience. When you stay at Atlantis the Palm hotel be sure too stay more then 3 days as they have a great Dolphin program @ the resort. It is a great experience which everyone can do, and the staff are fantastic @ getting you organised for the swim. I was amazed @ how much you actually do with the dolphins, you just don't swim with them you interact with them. People say it is a bit expensive but you have to remember all that money goes to only looking after all the dolphins @ the cove. Do the full encounter with them, will be doing it again if I am ever in Dubai again. You don't have to stay @ Atlantis to do this.
Dolphins. Can't find the words absolutely amazing for all the family even though its expensive if don't go you don't know what your missing out on

WOW. the experience for my 5yr old son and i is great. though we went on a very windy and chilly day but we really had fun interacting with the dolphin named S2 and the instructors r very helpful. its a very good experience but very pricey

Dolphin Bay, Atlantis. If you have dreamed of swimming with the dolphins, it doesn't get much easier. You can book a dolphin swim or encounter depending on the action level you would like to have. The dolphin encounter was a fun and fabulous experience for the family.
Average, but visit this if you have time. A well managed, well planned show, but avoid this if you are on a short visit to dubai. there are better things to see.

Beautiful experience.. This was a surprise treat from my daughter for myself and other daughter, we were visiting her in Dubai. It was a wonderful experience, we were given some general knowledge on dolphins which was informative but not too much to get bored, they are very careful to ensure that no foreign objects can get into the water with the dolphins and even hair bobbles are not allowed. The staff are extremely caring and their affection for the dolphins is very obvious which is very encouraging. We were introduced to Lennox a 12 year old male dolphin, to stand and touch this warm blooded mammel was a humbling experience. I would highly recommend Dolphin Bay.

Excellent but overpriced!. We tried the Dolphin Encounter. Recommend you book this in advance of your stay as they sell out fast.On arrival you are asked to change into wet suits, these are better then vests as it covers most of your body as the pool is slightly colder temperature. No loose items can be worn, e.g. Watches, hair bands etc. however sun hats are allowed.You are then given a tutorial explaining dolphins, what not do and what you will be doing. You are then split into groups of 10. Everyone takes it in turns to kiss or dance with the dolphin. It was great fun and organised well despite it lasting only 30 mins. We had a 3 year old, she was a bit apprehensive but she got in the water and was fine, she touched it but did not want to get closer than that. The staff were more patient with allowing for us having a small child and did lots of encouragement. The pool floor was sandy and soft.The photos are expensive we paid 600aed for 8 photos with a USB stick of all the photos. I did not mind paying knowing this is a one off experience. I compared prices to that of Discovery Cove in Sea World, Florida and that is just as expensive.

if you can swallow the price, you must do this. I went here for Valentines day with my girlfriend and we had an amazing, very memorable time.The price is what it is - bordering on insanity, however you do get what you pay for.We choose to do the scuba diving and wow was it great.
