There are a number of other dolphin experiences, however if you are scuba certified I think this is a great option as you really get a better view of the dolphins, and a different interaction with them.The handlers were all amazing, very friendly, and definitely concerned with making sure we had fun.We had a chance to hold the dolphin, feed them a fish, and a few other things. Just incredible.While (of course!) it costs extra, I would recommend buying the pictures as they take tons of photos of you which are of great quality and really capture each moment.

Really emotional. I have always wanted to swim with dolphins so really could not wait to get to Dolphin Bay. It was quite expensive but not something that you would do everyday. The dolphins were lovely and is was surprisingly emotional to interact with one. I was a bit taken back to find out that the lagoon is a man made concrete lagoon, not the beachfront, natural lagoon I had envisioned, but that was maybe down to my lack of research. The staff are great, there's an opportunity to purchase pictures if you don't have anyone who isn't participating and can take them. The pictures are displayed on screens but are very small, so choosing is difficult. The dolphins are so beautiful, it was a wonderful experience.

The best experience!. I know it's a bit pricy... but I found it to be worth it. I can't remember the different packages that are available but we were in a small group and got a chance to swim with the dolphin, kiss him and watch him do tricks. We bought the photos from the Bay but I believe you have the option of having someone there to take photos for you but they need to pay to be there. The dolphin was so cute! This would be a fun experience for couple and families. I definitely recommend it.

Great organisation and dolphin attraction is real. Went there with my girlfriend, fon of Dolphin. I have to say that I was impressed by the professionalism of the staff are the coordination of the event is 100% efficient. You can swin, get a kiss and pushed with the Dolphin and not like in Turkey where you wait 30 minutes to get with the dolphin for 30 second. Here you really have full interaction with them.If you love dolphin, you must go there.

Fantastic experience. We went for the shallow water meet 6 adults 5 kids u get about 30 mins in the water. My sister paid for the Spectors pass so she got some amazing photos we didn't need to buy theirs I had heard that they face u away from people on purpose but they didn't. U get to kiss and hug the dolphin individually. It was totally amazing I loved it. U then get to spend day in water park well worth a day out and take the monorail to it it's 15 Dirham and Well worth it!

A Dolphin Encounter. The sun was piping hot overhead and the water in the lagoon was freezing cold around my waist and feet but all of this is soon forgotten when you are finally given the opportunity to interact with your dolphin. Our group was made up of 10 persons (a mix of 6 adults and 4 kids) and each family had there turn to hug, kiss, dance and play with the dolphins all of which is set against the backdrop of the Atlantis. All are photo opportunities in themselves if only just to look back at yourselfe in a wet suit!The 'Dolphin Encounter' lasts 30 minutes and is suitable for all ages and swimming abilities as no swimming required. Do give yourself about 2 hours for this experience, there is the check in and changing into your black, blue and yellow labelled Atlantis wet suits which takes about half an hour. This is then followed by an informative/interactive chat on dolphins and marine life before they set you free amongst the dolphins.Do take a change of clothing with you to wear under the wet suit as the water is very cold! The changing facilities are communal and they provide you with towels and a locker. Alongside Dolphin Bay's own boutique store is another souvenir shop and a Starbucks! Travelled with my 7 year old.
wow. this was just great swimming with dolphins its everything you expect and more, but you do get ripped off for the photo prices, take your own pics or only buy the basic pacage its all you need

Great fun with dolphin. I booked this trip as this was something I wanted to do, swim with the dolphins! And at Atlantis Bay at the Palm in Dubai, which place could be more suitable? I did the deep water swim,where you get a kiss and hugs from the dolphin, spin in a water and at the end a belly ride, which was the coolest experience! The instructors are good fun and really know their dolphins well. You get a small group of people and one dolphin assigned. It is really cool and would go for it again!

An amazing, memorable experience and a must for kids. We did the "Dolphin Encounter" with our two kids, aged 5 and12. This is the shallow water version that allows young kids to participate. We were somewhat concerned that it may be limited by that, but it was actually a very fulfilling experience for all of us, with a lot of interaction with our dolphin. The way the dolphins obey all the instructions is both impressive and somewhat disconcerting - how is it possible that an animal can be so obedient and predictable in its behaviour. But the staff go our of their way to explain that dolphins are treated well, they participate in only 2-3 events each per day, and in fact live much longer than animals in the ocean, so at least their health is good. In our group, there were ten of us in total and we all individually got a chance to touch the dolphin many times, dance with it or play fetch with it, and to kiss it. We had two of our parents join us as observers, which cost a lot - 60 euros each - for the right to sit close to where we were, see us and take photos (plus access to the watermark and beach). The official photographer's photos were great, however, so we ended up buying these too (the whole set on a USB). The photo of our daughter kissing the dolphin is probably one of the best photos we have of her and represents well this truly memorable experience. A touristy affair, yes, and an expensive one, but very worthwhile, well organised and truly unique - at least in Europe and the Middle East.

A truly memorable experience. We booked the "Dolphin Encounter Experience" which was in the shallow water with the dolphins - this was perfect as we have young children. You get the chance to watch them show off and perform their tricks!!!, you also get the opportunity to cuddle, play and kiss the dolphins. Our dolphin was called Booker and she was incredible. The trainers were very friendly and made us all feel very welcome. We will definitely be back to do it all again!
A hands on experience. What a lovely hands on experience. Our 12 year old son loved it. Expensive but we all enjoyed it. We did the shallow experience so you can stand up.

Once in a lifetime Experience. What a sensational experience. A once in a lifetime experience. .Super surreal. Yet informational and educational at the same timeMarine biologists, animal lovers will thoroughly enjoy the experience. Highly recommended for the whole family.

Beautiful. Did the royal swim but think the adventure swim was just as good as we watched this while we waited for our swim. The dolphins were amazing and dolphin bay was beautiful and clean. The photos were highly priced so if you have a good camera and lens take your own as you are allowed to take pics but not allowed to video
Dolphins. I have been to dolphin experiences in the Bahamas. This out did those by far. Loved the dolphins and having access to the entire park for the day.
Dolphin Bay. A littel disappointing, very nice set up but unless you pay to meet the dolphins you don't see much at all.

A WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE. The dolphins were wonderful and the handlers and experts were very good at helping, instructing and informing us about the dolphins.Expensive, but great fun and well worth a visit

Well worth the money. My wife and i went for the Royal Swim package and this was amazing and a once in a lifetime experience. The dolphins are well looked after and actually seem to enjoy what they do and are well rewarded with lots of fish.
Amazing Breathtaking Must Do !. A beautiful beautiful experience. We got lovely pictures and a great feel. Do try this, even though it is over priced. It is still a lovely thing to do !

Dolphin encounter was once in a life time. We did the dolphin encounter with my 3 year old. It was honestly an amazing feeling to be close to these creatures. We had an amazing experience, touching, kissing and hugging these lovely dolphins. I just feel that overall it is an expensive activity but then it is once in a life time option. Only request to Atlantis please reduce the price for photos as they are way too expensiveNot to forget the staff is awesome and you get free refreshments after the show

Dolphins are amazing, but.... We were really looking to go to see dolphins, everything was great, only you have feeling it is more show, than to try to find out what are dolphins really. There was no time to make connection. Anyway the photos are incredibly expensive - 500 dirhams for flash disk...

Photo fun was fun!. The dolphin bay at the Atlantis was a great experience, little bit overpriced considering its all of 2 minutes person at best but we did get a free entry to the watermark which was good. The staff were pleasant and watching the dolphins were amazing.

Meet and Greet. We only did the Meet and Greet with the Dolphins where you recieve a picture and certificate too as we had both swam with Dolphins before. It was quick but for the price, you can't complain, and by paying this we got a free entry into the water park too.

Went to swim with the dolphins. Swimming with the dolphins at dolphin bay was an amazing experience. Staff were very helpful and got lots of time with the dolphins, which included a hug, kiss and play. Down side of it was we booked it through the cruise we were on and it was a fortune at $199 per person. The site was massive and it is a lovely hotel which i would stay at if i went back to Dubai most definatley
Superb show a welcome break from the heat. LIked all of it - no complaints - its not all doplhins but as in true Dubai style it has that extra dazzle and surprise

Good family day out.. We did the Dolphin adventure yesterday. The event overall was simply fabulous and my kids loved every minute of it. The staff were very comptent and the dolphins a delight.One thing to mention is that if you imagine that shelling out £450 for an hours entertainment provides any level of service you may have to learn to live with disappointment!! There is absolutely no sense of direction in relation to what the day involves or even how you get to the dolphin arena. The sad thing is that what should have been a once in a life time experience was another day of frustration and disappointment in terms of actually participating.Also don't pay the extra $90 dollars to enter the watching area if you are not a participant. It gets you 10 feet closer to the action than the general public; although you do get a free can of coke!

absolutely expensive, absolutely worth it. This was a personal dream fulfilled.Absolutely amazing to be kissed and hugged by a dolphin. Swimming with them was amazing. The Trainers were great fun. highly entertaining and very warm and enthusiastic with every guest. definately the highlight of my trip.

Swimming with dolphins at The Atlantis in Dubai. On The Atlantis website it states that you're allowed to take photos but it doesn't mention you can't video the experience. I felt the whole thing was just a commercial rip off. My husband and I had to pay 600 Dirhams just to watch our daughter with the dolphins. Admittedly that included entrance to the water park but we didn't want to go into the water park! I had to try and take photos on my iPhone because I couldn't video but this was hard because my daughter's group were 100m away in deep water. You really need a camera with a good zoom lens. Every time a spectator even stepped into the water to get a better shot, an attendant would usher them back. It was very controlled and all about The Atlantis making money and ensuring you buy their expensive official photos, not really about a great family experience. With 6 in a group, the individual interaction with the dolphin is limited. My husband and I thought it was very disappointing and not good value for money. However my daughter enjoyed the experience with the dolphin. Each group interact with one dolphin. I feel strongly that The Atlantis should state on their website "no video cameras allowed". As for relaxing on a sun lounger with drinks as stated on their website, soft drinks are provided in the participants' changing area afterwards.

Well worth the visit!. Visited in March for a weekend break in Dubai with my kids and we absolutely enjoyed every second of our stay there. The dolphin experience is a definite must do for kids and grown-ups alike! Wealth of positive emotions taken away.We have booked ahead which made things a lot easier and quicker for us.Swimming with dolphins is a great experience, but not for everyone. There were quite a few in our group who could not "manage the excitement" or overcome their fears I should say, so, maybe, try starting with a small photo session to see if you can handle it.
Fabulous. A must do if you can. Very professional. You get plenty of time with the dolphins and it is a once in a lifetime experience.

A once in a lifetime experience. My teenage children had a dolphin experence whilst in Dubai, we then went into the water park. Staff very experienced and willing to engage with customers whilst with the dolphins.
Again book in the UK and on line to get best value.

Amazing interaction with Dolphins. Our daughters did the interaction activity while we watched and took pics from the beach.There was about 5 groups of 6 people each with one trainer and dolphin to a group. The dolphin first introduced itself with a leap and dive just in front of the group, it then did the following with each one of the group - stood vertical with flippers to hands and did a dance while the group sang/ spun the person around by the hand, took each person for a quick 20 m ride, gave each one a kiss and finally gave each one a hug.In one word an amazing experience for the people in the water and those watching from the beach. Certainly worth paying the money for beach access to watch and take pics of your group in the water.

A great day and experience. We visited Dolphin Bay following a recommendation from a friend and opted for the Photo fun option, which was interaction with a Dolphin on the edge of the water.The Atlantis hotel where the attraction is based is huge and following my experience, I would recommend you try and book one of the morning slots before lunch time, as the place gets really busy. After checking in, you are taken by golf buggy to Dolphin Bay where you can watch other groups before you interact with the Dolphins. You are not allowed to wear any jewelry at all including small earnings, so I suggest you leave any jewelry back at your hotel.The actual interaction with the Dolphin is short, I would guess around 15 minutes and you are in a small group of 4 people, each taking it in turns to touch the Dolphin. It is a great ‘taster’ if you are unsure if you would like the ‘in water’ experience. A lady in my group was booked in to the ‘in water’ experience later that day, but felt she didn’t want to go in the water having had the edge of the water experience with her small daughter, so worth considering, as all of the interactions are reasonably expensiveThe facility is spotless and the staff are kind, patient and very keen for all to have a great experience. They obviously care a great deal about the welfare of the Dolphins and this shows in the way the staff/Dolphins interactions.As part of the package, we also purchased the lost chambers pass and this was enjoyable and again, the staff were friendly and keen for you to get the best from the visit.The Atlantis itself was nice to wander around after both experiences and all in all, I thought the package worth the money. Just beware when you are leaving the hotel that you specify a taxi rather than private limo. We were put in a car which transpired after to be a private limo (it looked like an ordinary car) and whilst the fare was on a meter, it was double the fare in a normal taxi on the journey there.

So much fun!!. Dolphin Bay was so much fun :) We had really friendly staff and the whole show was run very smoothly. wet suits weren't my fave, but still, it was fun to be all together. we did the 2nd level of experience and it was the perfect amount of interaction. you can't take video which was disappointing since we'd specifically brought a water proof video camera and not plain pictures, so if someone doesn't want to go in the water they could take pix! The photographers there take a ton of you though, so it's all good in the end. We had amazing and really friendly trainers with our dolphin, andrew and javier, they were great, and the whole introduction was fun too! awesome time, def recommend!

WOW!!!. I have always wanted to swim with dolphins and my partner surprised me with this in Dubai, there was a big group of people when we went but they supplied the wetsuits etc lockers it is very well run. There was 4 people per dolphin which is a great number, we got to pick them up out the water which was superb. They give you hugs and kisses which its great. We did the royal swim so we got to swim out hold onto a board and 2 dolphins pushed your feet and you fly through the water it really is an amazing experience and not only that you also get to hold onto their dorsal fins and be pulled through the water it really is thrilling!! I can't recommend this enough. The royal swin does include treading water in deep water and swimming so would recommend you are comfortable in water and a good swimmer but there are loads of different versions available to suit everyone. We bought pictures from the day which really captured what an amazing time we had.
Magical Experience!. Fantastic up close encounter with a Dolphin. Very special indeed! Great value for money, but be warned you have to buy professional photos at a premium.

Fun family time. Dolphin Bay is well worth the price. Splurge on the Royal Swim - the ride with the dolphin and the ability to have hands on experience is worth the investment. The other encounter options are already pricey, so it is worth paying a little bit more to have more time and interaction with the animals. The place is very well run and the staff provides very clear instructions so that the animals are safe from any harm.

Much better than Discovery Cove FL!. We took our 4 year old daughter to Atlantis DB for the dolphin Interaction. The staff are brilliant, and the facilties are spotless. The good thing about this experience is that those taking part get to spend alot of time with the animals. We definately recommend the interation package, it's great value, perfect for young children and far better than similiar packages offered in Florida.

Awesome experience. Interacting with the Dolphins was an amazing experience. A bit expensive though and if you not into water slides, to occupy the rest of the day, it coudl be quite an expensive experience.

Dolphin fun. Great staff, beautiful dolphins. We don't swim so did the photo shoot with the dolphins.My kids were a bit reluctant to touch or kiss the dolphins but the staff were really patient and encouraging. Great photos too. Pricey though. About $92 per person and then to get all the prints and the CD was another $300 or so. We could have gone with just the 8 prints that were included in the fee but........My daughter (who's five and a half) has said that the next time we visit Dubai, SHE is going to swim with the dolphins and so I had better know how to swim by then, lol!!We hung out at the resort till late - a bit of a mistake since the queues at the taxi rank were long! My advice? Book a pick up car for when you are done. There is a train station there so find out if the metro gets there or not. Our car driver said it didn't but I can't take his word for it.

Fantastic experience. We did the Deep Water Swim. After you get your wetsuit and attend a briefing on the facility and the dolphins, you are split into groups of 6 for your encounter. We had a great time, got to spend loads of time with the dolphin, Sol, had loads of time to interact with the dolphin. You do not have to be a great swimmer, as the water is very salty and having the wetsuit on makes you quite buoyant, so as long as you are confident you will get through it safely. Please remember that you have to remove all jewellery, watches, earrings, clips, leather straps etc. for the encounter so rather leave them at your hotel before you go. We were disappointed with the quality of photographs the official photographer took, honestly, poor quality and not good enough for the price you pay.....sort this out please Dolphin Bay.Otherwise, a wonderful experience.
Definitely recommend. Wonderful experience, a little pricey but worth it. The trainers are great, the Dolphins are better.

Great but way too expensive. The experience, for the little that lasted, was really great, and the dolphin guys are amazing (and really good at remembering all our names straight away). however way too expensive!!!

Swimming with Dolphins Atlantis Resort The Palm. Excellent activity to actually swim with the Dolphins is £190 pounds per adult (2013 price) a wet suit is provided and a body vest but you must be able to tread water as this activity takes place in the deep water lagoon (you do not have to be Olympic standard though). 2 other dolphin activities are offered one is a scuba dive, the other for children and non swimmers if called encounter where you stand in shallow water and play games with the Dolphin. Book this in advance as bookings are timed and if the resort is busy you could miss out. Our hotel contacted the resort for us therefore no phone costs for us and the booking confirmation was emailed to the hotel PERFECT!!

Loved it. We usually avoid large tourist venues but this was worth it! We took the monorail out on to the Palm and spent some some time prior to our dolphin adventure at the Atlantis indoor aquarium and waterpark. You could avoid both and head directly to Dolphin Bay . Booking was simple and efficient online in advance. Staff at check in were friendly and efficient. The on site Starbucks is great for a snack. Staff is outgoing and friendly. The experience exceeded our family's expectations. Spent 30 minutes in the water with our dolphin doing all sorts of tricks. At the end the obligatory photo booth visit will cost abut $100 for all your pics on a USB but I wouldn't miss the chance to have those memories. Well done.

Kids and adults for dolphin experience. Our group of 4 with two kids, 5 and 10 was lots of fun. Would have preferred a bit more time with the dolphins or even watching them perform, but overall it was nice. Enjoyed the water park access after the dolphin experience, very fun.
Fantastic, and Too Cute!. The Royal Swim was worth every penny! Such a great experience. It was the perfect Christmas Day!Not to be missed!

My new best friend ia a dolphin !. Well organised dolphin experience.Two off spring had a great time.Visit is in a group of 6 and lasts about a Half hour in the water.With a small group you get lots if one on one dolphin time - kisses , pets and a ride.Good photo pack available afterwards to remind you of the experience.A bonus - the cost also includes entry to Aquaventure so you can make a whole day of it.For residents if Atkantis there is a discount.Tip - book ahead, easy to do online as queues can build up.

AMAZING EXPERIENCE........A MUST. I Visited Dolphin Bay in October 2012, My sister and myself opted for The royal Swim experience although expensive it was worth every penny and included all day access to the waterpark, At the beginning of the experience you went into a room and had a quick introduction to dolphins, then you had 30 minutes in the water with the dolphins, which was brilliant, All the dolphins seemed well cared for and loved, There space was vast and they seemed to enoy being around their handlers, I liked the fact that there was a photographer who captured every moment and you were able to purchase these in the shop afterwards although quite costly for the price of the experience i think a picture should have been included.

Photoshoot. Did the photo shoot with my 4 year old and it was managed very well. The staff seem experience and professional. I'm not sure it was worth the price you pay though. It was over in like 15 minutes.

Good experience especially for young peope. Dolphin encounter is really wonderful experience.However,no doubt as compared to other places all over the world it is comparatively higher for some dolphin encounter after revised amount in 2013 We booked the tickets in advance via online.March is good time for this attractionThe first confusion which one go through that which experience one go for:Answer: It all depends on how much bucks you have to spendIf going out with family and want to spend moderate amount, go for dolphin photo funIn dolpin photo fun- costing around (375 dirham)Features: unlimited refreshment:dolphin hug, kiss,holdingdolphin playing from a very close view.Individual Interaction near to 10 minutesBenefit would be you are so close to dolphin and will get one complimentary photo taken by one of the representative.Now , if you go for "dolphin encounter" this will cost 795 dirham and guess what,You will get TOTALLY SAME STUFF what you got in Dolphin photo fun and without complimentary photo.So to get the pictures, you need to get any of your colleague to buy an observer pass ( almost 275 dirham) who will take pictures of yours.But disadvanatage is 1) Almost 6 guys bothering one dolphin (lols)2) encounter duration 30 minutes3) your colleague (observer pass) will not be able to take good pictures as you will be far away.So it's all on you, how you decide and how much bucks you are ready to spendThere are other expensive packages also like royal swim.You will get free access to aquaventure park, so try to reach as earliest as possilbe as there water park is like a dream landAdvise: try to book for morning time.However,atlantis will simply cancel your booking of atlantis if you don't get into dolphin bay on time.We managed to get in luckily by paying almost 300 dirham.So be on time.

you have to try this!. yes its touristy but the dolphins are amazing creatures. loved it!!!! we tried shallow and deep water experience. the children loved deep water but do ensure your children are water confident
Swimming with The Dolphins. even if you don't swim with the dolphin, being in the water next to these beautiful creatures is a worthwhile experience!

Dolphin encounter. Went to the dolphin experience at Atlantis bit disappointed really felt like a time filler to begin with a talk on dolphins in general which isn't what I wanted. You where then ushered into water to do various tricks photo opportunities etc it just seemed a rush and there was a big SELL when u finished for photos videos etc as you had to walk through shop to get outGlad we did it but wouldn't do it again Ian G

A dream come true. I booked the Royal Swim with Dolphins at the Atlantis and it was well worth every penny, especially that you also get access for the full day to theprivate hotel beach and the Waterpark! It was a wonderful experience. The trainers are very professional and the dolphions are great players. The facility is clean and the water is free flowing definately a plus.

Just a quality experience. Yes it costs a lot of money.....but if you want a lifetime memory just do it. A complete quality experience from start to finish hosted by a quality team. From previous experience this was Disney+ absolutely world class. My 3 daughters and I will treasury for many years to come.

Fantastic experience, professionally managed. We booked the Royal Swim with Dolphins at the Atlantis and it was well worth every penny, especially when you factor in that it costs you £40 just to enter the Waterpark anyway! It was a wonderful experience, all well managed by obviously highly trained staff. The whole facility and lagoon area was very clean and importantly the activity takes place in free following water - not in some dirty old swimming pool! Note that anyone entering just to take pics is charged 100AED.

Amazing. I came to dolphin bay with my family and it was one of the best days out I have ever had, you really do interact with the dolphins and the staff are very pleasant and get to know you well, you also learn a lot about the dolphins. An amazing day out whether with family or friends, I highly recommend dolphin bay.

Very good although very expensive... Very good day and staff are excellent.Kelsey was a a great asset.Very educational - good to know our wee dolphin was rescued as it was blind as I am not really keen on wild animals kept captive.Photos very good but very expensive..Got access to water park - very good rides, not too wild.Sun beds very close together and people reserved them all day with towels.We ended up moving to Barracuda area more sun beds but not too many people...

Alls well that ends well - poor or disabled visitors PLEASE READ. First of all this place is expensive, in fact let me say again it is very expensive, we paid over 400GBP for 2 adults and a child and the expense only starts there given the ludicrously overpriced pictures.Secondly it is very commercial and slick with continuous groups of up to 10 people doing different experiences and cameramen will take a snap of everything.It is unique in that you get to touch and kiss and cuddle the dolphins and you should have learnt something about them after the experience.Note that you have to be a very good swimmer for the adventure and be confident in shallow and waist height water especially with small ones, it isn't as easy as they make it appear.Being disabled I was slower than most and had to shout very loudly to get the trainers attention and eventually had to complain as they took no account of the fact that I was disabled in charge of a three year old so please make sure in advance they are aware of any special needs otherwise they may just plough on and leave you to it as they did with me.To be fair to them we got a full apology and some goodies to make up for the initial disappointment.The initial briefing was pretty lacklustre but overall a worthwhile if expensive treat but do your homework first.
Interacting with Dolphins. It was the most amazing thing I ever did...I kissed a dolphin and I liked it....smile....I think I'm in love...with Lenox, the Dolphin

What a blast. I did the "Royal Swim" and would consider doing it again even though it's not cheap. Be ready to spend more money buying photos if you don't have a freind on the beach taking pictures. I spent $60 for 4 pics...but worth it. A MUST for dolphin lovers!

Pretty setting, but not enough time. As with everything in the Atlantis, this is a very expensive experience! I don't feel like they offer enough time with the dolphin for the price they charge, and even though they do have private experiences available they will cost you a lot! For little kids who are not confident swimmers yet and can't participate in the swim with the dolphin program, a reasonable alternative is doing the photo fun which includes a picture with the dolphin and even though it's not cheap it won't cost an arm and a leg.Attentive staff and nice setting, dolphins look well cared for.
Fun memory to keep. It was great place to enjoy somthing new and exciting. Ask for more time to the trainers, they are very understanding and helpful.

Expensive But a good treat. I've been to Bangkok safari world as well thats why Dolphin bay was not as exciting as it was during my first visit but it is a really nice place to visit if you are in Dubai.

Dolphin Experience. Been upfront with a dolphin was an amazing experience. You kiss, touch, dance, swim with the dolphin.The only down side is, not enough time with dolphin. All the things you do is done quickly.

Fantastic place & could be even better if...!!!!. My desire to go Dolphin Bay was to have a sweet kiss with a so cute dolphin here and touch their extremely smooth skin... I got all what I expected from the trip...It was worth with your money and great experience. However, it was not a comfortable experience when you had your own "paparazzi". We had to pay around 300Drh (~85usd) to be allowed taking photos on our own from the far distance. However it was so challenging to have good photos because the staffs would move on purpose to prevent you from well-shots. This was understandable that they wanted to up-sell. They offer you the service of buying so professional and beautiful photos of you at surprising price - 1000Drh (~278usd). I love the place expect the photo service
Had alot of fun with the Dolphins. Really enjoyed the afternoon at Dolphin Bay. Very similar to other properties around the world, but still very enjoyable.

Dream come true. I was there last Saturday and had one of the best days in my life. I booked the Royal Swim online so I did not spend any time queuing. I spent the morning in the water park and the beach and after lunch went to Dolphin bay. They are well prepared for this, each group of maximum 6 persons has two instructors and one photograph at all time. There is a general introduction session and than you go to the bay. There was 3 groups at my bay (there are 3 bays) but there is plenty of space for everybody.You get to touch, hug, kiss and swim with the dolphin (in my case it was the sweat lady Abby) and learn a lot about them. For the royal swim you do have to swim. It was one of the best experiences in my life, it is a bit expensive but once you are there and if you make a full day visit it is worthy. Photos are expensive with different packages available. I was alone with no observer to take pictures of me and so I had to buy from the shop. But again is one in a lifetime experience and it compensates.

Fantastic - Brilliant for all the family. Booking on line is a must. Saves money as well as queuingDon't be tempted to rent locker when you get inBe aware that you should do your dolphin experience firstGo at allocated time to Dolphin Bay where you get a locker provided for the duration of the activity - leave your camera here until later when you can take your own pictures . Cost of professional pictures very expensiveYou can then stay as long as you like after your activity watching the dolphinsThe water park is included in the cost and it is really worth trying all the rides

DOLPHIN BAY IS A MUST!!!. This was the most amazing experiences I have ever had in my life! Everyone who visits must swim with these lovely creatures or at least visit the hotel. The staff are so pleasant and you get treated like royalty.

Great Experience. It was really wonderful. We enjoyed it a lot swimming with dolphins. That’s such a great feeling touching them. Crew helped much. They are very gentle and informative. The price is quite high but it worth fair for satisfaction. It’s a unique lifetime experience. Photos are overpriced better you take your own.

Great encounter. The staff are brilliant , informative and helpful , and the dolphins are brilliant. Would love to go back and do it again as l injured my foot on one of slides in water park so was in pain and not able to stand up in water with the dolphins
So aweseome!. This was possibly the highlight of my 6-year-old's life! So wonderful to be able to spend time up close to these amazing animals.

Terrific plus proposal idea.. Dolphin bay offers 3 packages with the Royal Swim being the best out of the three offering max 6 people to 1 dolphin plus more activities to do with the Dolphin. Overall better to go with this option, however it is the most expensive, but lets face it, your at Atlantis The Palm Dubai.The experience is one that you will never forget, and the orientation should be listened to and taken in not only for the safety of you and the Dolphins but it also makes you appreciate the experience greater. The time spent with the Dolphins is sufficient.The only reason this does not earn 5 stars is the blunders that I experienced with reception. I chose to propose to my partner at this activity, the plan went off without a hitch. However, despite paying in advance for a package including photos and floral arrangements etc etc they had no idea what I was talking about. Clearly some behind the scenes issues that they need to sort out. But overall 5 stars for the Dolphin aspect.

Once in a lifetime !. Booked with reduction as staying at Atlantis, wonderful experience from start to finish, dolphins are well looked after and loved. Totally worth it, did the royal swim which I think is worth the extra as pushed along by dolphins and cuddled, kissed etc...trainers knowledgeable and informative. I have wanted to do this for years and was everything I dreamt about!

Fantastic. How the dophins perform their tricks is amazing, they are such strong animals but yet so calm. The place is well organised and has everything you need to have a perfect visit, no need to take your own towel, drink etc, its all in the entrance price. The staff are dedicated to the welfare of the dolphins and are highly trained and give you ample opportunities to get really close up to the dolphins and have your photo taken with them.

A very memorable visit !. We thoroughly enjoyed our encounter with the dolphins .We got some lovely photos .It was expensive but well worth it . The dolphins appear very happy,well looked after and much loved by their trainers.
An Experience and a half!. Pricey but you should not regret you money, we didn't!Pick a week day though if you can as the main entrance to the Park was litteraly packed with toutists

Memories for a lifetime at Dolphin Bay!. We were a bit worried that our kids were too young - 4 & 6, but they had a great time. The staff was great with the kids, very informative and fun. It was a bit costly but loved it. Then, more money for the pictures, but now that we are back home, the money for the pictures was money well spent!

Swim with Dolphins. Great facilities & wet suits supplied, We had a instructer on a one to one basis who told us all about the Dolphins, and managed the experiance,which was most informative and interesting.They are lovely animals and well worth the chance to get up close with them.

Royal swim with dolphins. I always thought that the chance to swim and play with the dolphins underwater would be an amazing experience. But there are no words to describe this experience after having it! It is something that is for sure worth its price (1.000 dhs) and a very new and unforgetable feeling while having the dolpnis pusing you in the water and swimming with you ! Try it!

Very Slick Operation. Really professional set up, clean and well run tho a bit of a glut waiting to get wetsuitsDolphins appear healthy and lovedSomehow it felt wrong and unnatural, and we were part of a circus showGlad we did it- though will stick with more natural set ups in future
Great experience. Don't miss it! the best experience you could ever have in Dubai is swim with the dolphins. There are many programs, no need to catch its fin, just swim and kiss it.
Amazing!. When I mean amazing, I actually DO mean amazing. Breathtaking, dream come true - you name it, you will experience it when you do this experience.Highly, highly recommended!

Amazing and up close. was absolutely amazing like everyone else has said. Cost £150 for 2 people. We booked online and the price included the entry to the water park, the dolphin experience, and entry to the lost chambers aqauriam. Bought a book of 5 photos for another £50. Expensive but well worth it.

One of the best days of my life. Last weekend I went to Dolphin Bay to do the Dolphin Scuba Dive. Needless to say I was very excited before the experience. I have already been to Dolphin Bay once and have done the Royal Swim which was absolutely wonderful, but this one takes the cake!I got there early, at about just after 9 o'clock. I went to go check in even though the time of the dive was 9:30. There are little golf carts that drive you straight to Dolphin Bay which save you walking the whole way there. Once there, your given wetsuits to wear. There are change rooms with lockers inside as well as warm showers which are great for afterwards. Once your are done changing you attend a little prior orientation. The orientation is great because it not only shows you how to properly interact with the animals and what not to do (eg. touch eyes, cover blow hole, etc. ) but also its really educational. I'm pretty much a know-it-all when it comes to dolphins but even then I still learned a few more interesting facts about dolphins.After the orientation I, along with the other members in my group, all got geared up with the help of the other trainers. They were all friendly and introduced themselves to us. Asked us if we had any questions and went over the underwater signals. We then headed for the water where Tina (the dolphin) was already waiting for us with her trainer. Being underwater with these animals was truly amazing and by far the best experience of my life. It was so great being in their world and just watching how they moved underwater. Even watching the trainer interact with the dolphin was a sight to see. We all got to hug the dolphin, get a kiss, feel what they feel like, have a dorsal tow, feed a fish and watch them do behaviours (jumps, tail walk) from below. There was one trainer underwater to assist us if we required it, another to show us what to do, one trainer directing the dolphin and a photographer. After the dive once we had surfaced we all got to touch Tina again as well as view some of her behaviours from above the surface. She was brilliant and we all gave her a final cheer as we left the water. After that we bid farewell and thanks to the trainers, had warm showers and received a free cool drink or water of our choice there after. Then I headed towards the exit where they display all the photographs from you experience. In summary: I had a great experience!!! Tina was amazing and it was just brilliant to watch her, even when it wasn't your turn to interact wither her. I think this is what makes this program so much more unique than the others. The best part, apart from being with the dolphins of course!, was how great the trainers were. They were all friendly, happy to help and I felt more than confident with them under water. Not once did I worry. Not that I think I would of been worried but someone did ask me the question if I was scared or not. I was also lucky in the fact that there are meant to be 6 people in a group, but this time there was only 3 including myself. If you ever do plan on coming to dolphin bay, I sincerely recommend the dolphin scuba dive, you wont be sorry! If you don't have a scuba certification, then the Royal Swim by all means. Whenever you purchase a ticket for Dolphin Bay, it will automatically include a day pass for Aquaventure, the waterpark. I would recommend that you get to Dolphin Bay early, so that you can spend the rest of the day in the waterpark and make the most of your money. Towels are included when you go to Dolphin Bay, so that is also a plus because it saves you bringing you your own. The only negative thing I have to say is that the photos that the photographers take of you are a little pricey. Overall, 5 stars from me and I would love to do this again!

Best experience of my life. I had always wanted to swim with the dolphins and while staying at Atlantis decided to do the Royal Swim (about £143). It was the best expereince of my life. My husband wasn't bothered about doing it so he paid to go on the beach (about £17) He took some fantastic photos, and I bought one professional one (£15 for 1 photo or £85 if purchasing all of them on a memory stick)

go cathy go cathy. most amazing part of our holiday, we swam with cathy the dolphin, had an amazing time, we had the deep water experience, at a reduced rate as we wher e already in the park, the two men who we where with where lovely and very informative of the dolphins, we where in a groups of 6 which is ideal as you get a decent amount of time with the dolphins. the dolphins are so healthy and happy, xx

Ideal choice for full family fun .... It was one of the first itinerary items for my trip and was one of the highlights. It would have been 5* if we the opportunity to spend more time :) Well organized, ample photo-ops for individual and with family. Folks (trainer and guides) were friendly. Weather aspects: Water was around 20 deg C. They provide the wetsuits etc. So, no preparation reqd.Highly recommend for family with kids. You would need a few hours to make your way in and out.

Brilliant experience. This is a must when in Dubai. We did the Royal swim and although it is pricey it is so worth it plus you get the use of the water park included. The experience with the dolphins is one il always remember. Go early and make a full day of it!
Will do this again. A great programme and the dolphins are well looked after, a great thing for children to see and learn from, our 2year old still talks about Abbey the dolphin.
The best!. Had such a great time never thought the children and I would enjoy this experience as much as we did, it was just fantastic!

worth every cent. I had not wanted to do this, but for the sake of the kids, who were not allowed to go alone, I went. It was truly wonderful, a real priveledge to share time with the dolphins and their dedicated trainers and the definate highlight of our trip

Not worth the money. If you are staying at Palm Atlantis, you may get a marginal discount still not worth paying so much to touch the dolphins, if you are a die-hard dolphin fan this place is for you just take a walk around it.

adventure. Great hosts. Well organised.Very good facilities
Photos/photography bit steep.Would love to do it again
Amazing!!. An unbelievable experience - would highly recommend the Royal Swim which was fabulous. The dolphins are amazing!!!

Great Experience. We did the Dolphin Encounter which was the cheapest at 550AED pp for guest of hotel.You get a briefing of the experience and safety methods for the encounter and interesting information about dolphins and how the trainers teach the dolphins. The encounter in the water lasted about 30-35mins which involves the dolphins showing off and interacting with you and the group. The group was split into groups of 8, keeping families and couples together.The interaction involves kisses, hugs playing with the dolphins individually and plenty of other interaction. The dolphins are relaxed and in complete comfort of human interaction. This is an experience I would highly recommend especially one for children. Photos are taken which can be purchased at the end in the souvenir shop.

Magical. With the opportunity to fulfil a life ambition, you won't be dissappointed with this experience, although I would recommend the encounter with only 6 people per group to get maximum interaction with the Dolphins

Dolphins for children and adults. We did the "Dolphin Encounter" at Atlantis because our daugther is eight and we felt that the swimming with Dolphins would be too much.It was a magical experience and I was very pleased to do this.I would suggest that earlier is better before the chaos of the Atlantis hotel, aquirium and aquatic park erupt.

Amazing and a MUST. We did the swimming with dolphins and the lady who did the intro was great and knew so much. We swam with Central and it was a group of 6 and "wow" they are amazing animals so clever and gental and really are somewhat spiritual. You HAVE TO DO IT. Worth every penny.

Extreme Fun - Dolphins. Dolphinarium - the smiling, dancing and kissing Dolphins - whoc can forget after seeing their show. It is really nice to see they place with balls and the way they dive. They will come to stage and will dance nicely. For children it is a must place to timeout. Selected children can ride in water with Dolphin and they will gift gifts too. This is inside creek part and wonderful place to chill out..! Dont miss it !

Fun for children. If you are travelling with children, Dolphin Bay is a MUST visit in your itinerary! Children will enjoy and so will the adults! Amazing to see how the lovely Dolphins are trained to perform!

great time. I had a great time swimming with dolphins this year. Do not miss it although it is a bit pricey you will have so much fun. It sounds a little but in those 30min you really get a chance to meet the dolphin and to learn something about them. Really great memories! and really cute coaches :) oh and the water park is really good too, it was the great day.

Once in a life time. Great fun. You want taking the smile off your face. It's quite pricey, especially the pictures, but it's something you don't do every day. Together with water park was a very good and funny day.

Wow !. Did this on our last day. Booked from UK before we went and so glad we did as it was all booked up when we got there. My husband wanted to snorkel with the sharks but could not get in, so make sure you book before you go. We went for the Dolphin Adventure- 6 people to 1 dolphin in deep water. It was an fantastic experience and would recommend doing it here. The dolphins all seemed really happy and well cared for and the trainers were very good and did everything to make sure it was a amazing experience. Our dolphin was Alice. Cost was about £150 each which included entry into Atlantis waterpark. Photos were very expensive but you need to get them. We went for a package that included 4 printed photos and a dvd of all our images - cost approx £90.

Fabulous. Really enjoyed it much better than expected ! Great for adults and kids ! Lots of different levels of experience ie can swim with them or just paddle. Really informative also. Was quite exp but if never done the dolphin thing on a previous holiday then definitely worth the visit. Got a great tab too !!!

Great one time experience. I did enjoy seeing and touching dolphins but unfortunately even if they are well kept and have wonderful facilities thaey are still captive animals who would in my opinion be happier in the wild. It is a very organised and informative fun experience especially for kids and although you have a short interaction with the Dolphins it is enough as if it was longer the animal may get stressed.The added bonus is you can get the day pass in the Aqua Venture park so its best to book the Dolphin interaction in the morning and then make a day of it by spending the rest of the day in the aquaventure water park!
Well organize. Nice experience for the kids, but for a high price...... Need to book in advance. The water park overall is clean, but not to exiting.

Dolphin heaven. We would really recommend going to dolphin bay it was an unforgettable experience and worth the money I booked it for my husband and 2children it was there most favourite thing in dubai .it was well organised you get a 30 min talk about dolphins beautiful surroundings changing rooms towels if you just want to be an observer you can buy a ticket at resort and you will be on the beach which is in front of the dolphins to take photographs the ones they try to sell you are expensive about one hundred and ten pounds for 8 photographs and a disc with all the rest they recommend you book the dolphin encounter on line as it can be popular and it avoids having to queue after the dolphins you can spend the rest of the day in the atlantis water park and beautiful beach so book an early slot and make the most of your day

a treat. booked swimming with a dolphin for daughter's 18th. she loved it. staff helpful, pleasant and knowledgable. it is costly, but worth it as spectators have to pay to watch from the beach area, but you can take your own photo's, videos etc: professional ones expensive.

wonderful experience. My husband and I did the Royal Swim during the day on Christmas Eve and had a great experience. The trainers were super, and the surroundings were lovely. And for those who are nervous (I admit that I was!) they do start off pretty slowly with the dolphin encounter so you have time to become more comfortable. I would have given this 5 stars instead of 4, except for the cost of the photos afterwards, which were painfully expensive. One tip would be to make sure you look at ALL the photo options, not just the three or so that are advertised more prominently (and are not the best value). We paid about £90 for 4 or 5 printed photos in the cardboard "frames" plus all of our photos on a CD/DVD. For the same price you could also get your photos on the dolphin-shaped USB key but no print-outs, so we thought this was a better option. Better yet, if you're at Atlantis with other friends/family, for about £10 you can have someone join you inside Dolphin Bay (but onshore) and they can take pictures for you. Just a couple of ideas to help out a family on a budget.
a must do!. It does cost a bit, but it worth it. The staff are knowledgeable and professional. It is something you should try to do

Exceeded Expectation. My family booked the Dolphin Adventure and we loved it. The facility and dolphins were second to none and the trainers were professional, yet personable. It will be a lasting memory with great pictures.

you must do it. a Chritmas day suprise present for my family, well whilst expensive I can really say it was excellent value for money and a once in a lifetime experience. very well organised indeed, the dolphins were very special and clearly very happy, the instructors were brilliant, just go.
with the dolphins. we took our 9 years old daughter to swin with the Dolphins one of the memories for us all with these wonderfull animals so inteligent
Great experience. Excellent experience - different packages to suit all ages and abilities - great professional photographs to purchase at the end
The highlight of our visit to Dubai. The "dolphin encounter" was the highlight of our visit to Dubai in our kids' view (7 and 11 years). Rather expensive but worth the money on our view.

Very regimented. My son and I did have a good time and being up close and personal to a dolphin is awesome, but this experience was like being at an aquarium show being a helper.It was very regimented the groups too big to have time with the dolphin as I thought we would have.the dolphin swam in front of us and jumped over us and we had a photo taken. There was another option but this is a very expensive attraction for the time spent with the dolphin.More time is spent on the briefing,getting into wetsuits, and waiting around,

Dolphin Dive - Dolphin Bay, Atlantis the Palm. During my last trip I had swam with Dolphins this time I got to Dive with the Dolphin called Tina at Dolphin Bay. It was one of the highlights of my life to Dive with an incredibly beautiful mammal like the Dolphin. I cannot rate the experience of the staff or the dive high enough. I cannot wait to go back :)

Surreal Experience. The dolphins are soo cute and it is most definitely worth every penny. My sister had the shallow water swim as well and every time she looks at the pictures, she smiles. It is truly a happy place. The staff are very nice as well.
Great time and experience!. Wonderful experience, just too bad it is in the tacky and overpriced Atlantis resort. You will feel like you have had your pockets picked.

Dolphins Treat.. Just superb, fantastic, worth a visit. I dont want to tell you more detail here as the fun would be gone, just go there and spend a day with dolphins, although its very pricey but it is worth a visit for once atleast in a lifetime.

Expensive. Expensive and overpriced for a 30min session. I felt a bit deflated having payed £550 for 3 of us and 3 observers :(
Had to pay extra for pics aswell - they should have one complientary included for that price..

Highly recommend. Fantastic, very informative. Talk and quiz before then into the huge lagoon to spend time with dolphin, not rushed or overcrowded at all. Lovely experience, never to be forgotten. Booked online very easy

Life time experience!. It's great feeling to interact with the Dolphins. Swimming with them is the most fun part! just make sure you follow the instructions so that the Dolphins will enjoy your company the same way you do!

Wonderful show by dolphins. We found this show very very imaginative and artistic. The dolphins were well-trained and a variety of acts were presented. Great thing about it was that it had indoor pond and airconditioned arena, along with good combination of screens, 3-D projectors and music. However, the sound system was very bad, and we could not make out what the MC was announcing. Still the show was really a treat and a must see for any visitor. It is far better than what we saw in Singapore.
A must do while in Dubai. We did the Dolphin Encounter and I am so glad I did. The interaction with the dolphins is great. Set up is very professional. So much fun. Wetsuits provided.

Dolphin photo fun is just great for small kids. I got my. 5 year old for photo fun in dolphin bay. Photo fun charges were 325 Dhirams for stay in adults of atlantis. Its around 350 or 360 for others, i am not sure. Also children should be always accompanied by one paying adult. 3 kids can be accompanied by one adult. You have to previously book for the dolphin photo fun and decide on what's the timing of your convenience, since its not there all the time. All groups will be of maximum 10 people. You can touch and kiss the dolphin and then dance with him. Even today after on week, she can talk only about the dolphins..... I know the price was high, but it was worth seeing the happiness on my child's face.also they will provide you with a photo of your interaction with the dolphin, at the counter immediately. There will be many shots, you have to select the one you like. It's free with the dolphin fun. All interactions are for 15 minute duration.
very good. very well maintained, appreciate conservation efforts of UAE govt. good place to visit in your trip to United arab emirates
Wawwww. Great experience all the family enjoyed the dolphin encounter ,but the only problem they charge for 1year 7 month baby same price as adults . Otherwise all is excellent

Oh what a joy!. The pre - information was very interesting - the trainers were all lovely people.Organisation works like clockwork.My daughter thoroughly enjoyed her encounter with the dolphin - a life time memory
My 8 year old was bowled over. Great experience. Enjoyed the visit. Pricey but worth it. The setting is lovely and the whole experience well done.

Absolute Rip Off. We visited Dolphin Bay whilst staying at the Atlantis The Palm. Never, ever again. The dolphins live in a sterile, unnatural environment and are trained like circus animals to perform tricks and stunts to entertain the visitors.At every stage of your 'experience' a camera is pointed at you and your dolphin. Subsequently, the most outrageous prices are charged for prints of these photographs. I know that nothing in Dubai is cheap, but this was just taking the mickey.And so I was left feeling ripped off and desperately sorry for the poor mammals that are forced to participate in this money-grabbing venture.

Amazing Experience. I have always wanted to go swimming with dolphins, this was the best experience ever! I was a little reluctant as the dolphins are HUGE! But my fears were groundless as they were so friendly, cute and really playful! I really enjoyed this experience and would defo do it again!

Amazing day. Our children loved it. The staff was very friendly and worth the money you pay for the experience. we stay at least 1 hour and 30 minutes and then we have time drinking our refresment to see the dolphin play
Xmas Present. A brilliant experience and one that will be repeated next year.The staff and dolphins were excellent.

One-off experience. We did the Dolphin Adventure and it was very good - very professional and ran very smoothly. It's quite expensive for the length of time it lasts but you also get entrance to the waterpark and I actually expected it to cost more as it's done at the Atlantis. The dolphin trainers were very friendly and informative and the photos were good. I bought two at the end - also didn't cost as much as I expected. It's a one-off experience and I would recommend it if you've got the cash
excellent experiance. Bought this for my better halfs birthday and he loved it,, it was fantastic experience , very well organised and just magical one to treasure

A lifetime experience. What a fantastic,unique experience - swimming and interacting with a dolphin? Yes,it is expensive, but they do it so well here that you really do get the full experience. We "swam" with dolphins in America a while back and all I can remember is being in a production line. This is the real deal.

Expensive!. Expensive but worth a visit, 30 mins interaction time, photos are a rip off so try to get someone to take them for you!
Dolphins amazing though

Dance with a Dolphin!. We took my mother and let her dance with a dolphin in the shallow water experience ( she could not tread water for the deeper water ones)They give you a briefing on dolphins, provide wet suits, lockers ( as you cannot take jewelry, hair ties... anything really , and then walk you out and let you meet your dolphin and trainer. Its about 6-10 people per dolphin. and they have several groups going at a time. Each dolphin swims around for your to pet several times, and then if you are in a group, or alone, you get to hug your dolphin for a photo, and dance, or play a game with the dolphin as well. The water is cool, so i would recommended at least the light jacket they give out, if you don't take the whole shorty wet suit, especial if you go in the afternoon as the sun is going down. I highly recceomend this, as it is so much fun to interact with these highly social animals!

Why would you not do this while you're at the Atlantis?. A tad expensive, but probably cheaper than most other places in the world where you could do this sort of thing, and you get to interact with the dolphins much more than you would , for example, in Australia. The optional photos are a complete rip-off, so just enjoy the experience, drink it all in, and skip the photos.

Wonderful experience!. Dolphins are adorable creatures!! And extremely intelligent...perhaps second to the human race. My family and I had a great time interacting with them. We were allowed to dance, hug & kiss them!! For people who don't want to enter the water, they have an 'observer' pass!!! Was a fantastic experience!!!

Splashomania. Great water park with some interesting slides.. The Ziggurat slides are neat, as you go through a shark tank! My kids love the lazy river ride too.. On the expensive side unless you do a package through Atlantis. A must do for tourists!

An Amazing Experience.. If you visit Atlantis Palm you definitely need to do this. This is a once in a life time experience. It cost around 130 pounds each. You get 30mins in the water with the dolphin, and this is in groups of ten. You get to take part in dolphin hugs and kisses, dolphin dancing as well as other things. This was the best part of my holiday and is for all ages! For an extra 20 pounds you get access to the water park and the private beach!
Funny:):):). Make ıt I'n atlantıs the Palm Hotel it wad so funnynote that its not cheap but we have just 1 chance to LİVE:)
ALLURING BAY. a la mode, beautiful, chic, dressed to kill, dressed to the teeth, in vogue,modernistic bay. i loved it.

When the dream come true. We did with our 4 and 6 years old daughters. The staff was really nice and gave some explainations about dolphins in general before you get to meet one. My daughters were in heaven after they've kissed and hugg a dolphin.
dolphin experience. it was a lovely experience wen we went down to aquaventure waterpark with my fsamily. the whole dolhin experience was very warm and the staff was very courteous

Amazing experience. It was my 11yr old's dream to interact with dolphins, as for me as an adult it was an amazing experience. Prior booking is essential to guarantee a booking. Don't forget to buy the USB storage of your photos with the dolphins a memory for life.
Great experience. Great experience for those wanting a chance to swim with dolphins. A peaceful,little haven. Book early on arrival as it is a popular attraction. Great photo opportunity.

Lovely for the family. We had the pleasure of doing this with the kids. If you have little kids, feed them properly first as the orientation is a bit boring and long for them. All in all a great experience

Swim with the Dolphins. One of the most memorable things I have ever done! I highly recommend swimming with the Dolphins at Dolphin Bay (Atlantis on the Palm) the instructors are very friendly and the Dolphins are just such amazing creatures. I could not take the smile of my face the whole time.

Fantastic experience. We booked Dolphin Bay direct through the Atlantis hotel before we left and it was well worth it.We paid just under £300 for two adults and 1 child (6 years old). You select a day and time slot when you book.On the day we ended up getting there about an hour eary but they fitted us in to the next session so we only had to wait 5 or 10 mins.Once inside there is a 'talk' and some facts about the dolphins. You are then split into groups and given an instructor. You have wet suits provided and have to remove all jewellry and hair bands but you can wear caps.The groups are no more than 10 people and there are two instructors. There is also someone in the water taking photos but you forget that they are there. You get lots of chances to touch and stroke the dolphins. You get a choice of dancing or playing with the dolphins, then you get to kiss the dolphin and then to cuddle the dolphin with your family. They make the dolphin 'talk' and splash you. It is great fun.At the end of the experience, you get a free soft drink or water.The photos really are great. They are expensive but not what I would have expected them to be - they are not wildly expensive. We got every photo that we appeared in, which was about 40 odd, on a stick (shaped as a dolphin!) plus 8 photos. You can get just one but this works out more expensive. They do lots of different deals so you can chose as many or as few as you want. They are excellent quality.They are very good with young children. My little boy said that he did not want to kiss the dolphin but they were so good with him that he did do it and he enjoyed it so much, he got to have a tiny bit longer than everyone else!!The whole experience only lasts 30 mins so make the most of it.This was very well organised and a very worthwhile experience.
Close encounter with the dolphins. We took the deep water dolphin option and it was great. Excellent feeling being pulled around the pool by a dolphin.

Wonderful encounter. One of the highlights of our stay in Dubai! We had booked the Royal Swim with the Dolphins, and we really got to spend a lot of time with the Dolphins, carrying, touching, hugging, getting a kiss, being pushed and being towed by a dolphin (Lisa). A beautiful experience! Of course, artificial, but still an opportunity to spending some time with an fascinating animal.

Wonderful!!. I had a wonderful time at the Dolphin Bay at Atlantis the Palm! It is a wonderful experience! They treat the dolphins really well and in my case, my mother didn't want to get into the water so she went as an observer! No problem! I would definitely go again!

Amazing. I have been here twice now, it is the most amazing thing to swim with Dolphins and hold them, it is not cheap but it is very good value. The official photographs are very expensive and not worth buying.
very hot wheather. the wheather is disasterous. th the dolphines are amazing..you reach it from atlantis city.. you have to pay around 120$each to visit the popular swimming city there.

Dolphin Bay. It was great to see how they work with the dolphins. They've many trainees for each dolphins and the animals are really doing well and fine at the resort. If you can, do the belly dance with the dolphin, it'was a great and sensitive experience.

Fab day out. Good family fun day out. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful. Lots of life guards all around the water park, playful and ready to assist where possible. Interacting with children and adults alike.

An experience of a life time. Swimming with dolphins can sound so blase... until you do it. We did the one on one experience and got to touch, hug, kiss and get dragged by two through the water as well as a nose push on a bodyboard. What a fine set up where the dolphins come first.

Dolphin Play. It gives you the experience of swimming with dolphins and I loved all of my experience there. The dolphins have a huge pool to play in and the experienced trainers keep you safe although it can be slightly expensive but I think it is worth the money

Loved it !. Expensive but worth it !
Included in price was water park and private beach.
If you get a choice, choose Jasmin the 3 year old baby dolphin........so cute

Worth every penny.... We went for the the Dolphin Encounter and my wife and seven year old loved every minute of it. The instructors are very friendly and they know dolphin's inside out. They're also very passionate about what they do. The dolphin's seem happy and as far as I know - we took the back of the house tour- they have their own chef! If you are in a party of 3 or more, one of you should stay out of the water and get an observer pass. This will allow you to take photographs as cameras are not allowed in the water. Filming isn't allowed either.Choose a quieter time during the day, usually after 2:30pm and make sure that you are not wearing headbands, earrings, bracelets, necklaces, rings, etc. All jewellery will have to be removed before you get into the water to avoid harming the dolphins - including studs and piercings. There will be an induction session before you get into the water and after you have changed into the swimsuits they provide. They will also provide you with a locker and towels. On your return complimentary - and much needed- drinks are offered. All in all a wonderful experience. You will not be disappointed.

Dolphin Bay, Atlantis. Awesome! Kids loved it. Very well organised. A bit pricey...but worth it i think. The dolphins are healthy and happy and well trained. We (including our 2 and 6 yr old)went into the water with the dolphins. U can't take your own camera in. A photographer hired by the dolphin bay guys will take your photo. Quite expensive...but excellent photos.

Unforgettable experience. Visited Dolphin Bay at the end of September with my family. We spent the first part of the day at the water park and the beach at Atlantis before our booking time at Dolphin Bay. My younger daughter (11) and I did the Dolphin Adventure and my husband and elder daughter (15) did the Royal Swim.It was very well organised - get changed into wet suits, bit of a fun info session about dolphins before heading out for 30 mins in the water with them. In the Dolphin Adventure we got a kiss, dance, and hug from the dolphin and got a spin around by the hand and then a belly swim. There were 6 of us to 1 dolphin. In the Royal Swim, they got a push along by the feet and a pull along by 2 dolphins as well as the kiss, hug and dance. My only suggestion (if you are going as a family, but are doing 2 seperate swims) would be to space the swims apart by an hour. That way you can watch each other doing it, and also take your own photo's from the beach. We spaced ours out by 30 mins, but as the first hour is inside getting changed, having safety talks and and the info session, by the time we were out to do the swim, my husband and daughter were inside for their talk! The photographers did a great job and got some great snaps - but they are very expensive to buy. All up, an excellent and unforgettable experience and I would highly recommend it !
Beautiful creatures. Even if you choose not to do a dolphin experience you can walk up to dolphin bay once you are in aquaventure and you can go and watch these beautiful animals.

Best experience. The experience is awesome. Staff explains everything well, they take their time. It is pricy but very worth it. It feels safe and calm. The dolphins are nice and friendly. you get to touch them and the trainer explains about dolphins. You get to play with them and a photographer takes pictures as a beatiful memory to take home! I loved it!!!!

Definitely worth doing if you visit Dubai. Visited Dolphin Bay on the 3rd October.Excellent set up and fantastic experience for everyone of all ages and swimming abilities. The Dolphins are well looked after and the trainers are very professional and knowledgeable on the behaviours and habitat of the Indo-pacific dolphin and how to handle them when you are in the water. The experience starts of with some common sense do's and don'ts when interacting with the dolphins and there is a short question and answer session about the dolphins before you get to meet them. I certainly came away from it learning something new about the dolphins We had the opportunity at the time to have fun with Danetta? The youngest of the dolphins at the experience, and spent a good 30 minutes having fun in the water. Great value for money, had loads of fun and didn't feel rushed at all. Photos were a little bit expensive but that depends on the package you choose after the experience. The photographers take some fantastic pictures of the experience you have and its worth the money in my opinion. Try and do the dolphin bay experience in the morning or early afternoon so that you can spend the rest of the day you in the park. Also make sure you take some cash with you to get photos and don't do what we did and leave everything in the main lockers

Good experience, not too rushed as some of these trips can be. Great set up, efficient guest experience. For the amount of time we had in the water we felt we had good value for money. We really enjoyed our swim with the dolphins, the staff take pride in what they do and they seem to take good care of the large number of dolphins residing here.

Unique experience. Though the Dolphin Experience is an amazing personal event, it looked very commercialised to me. For the wellfare of the animal you first get an introduction about the do's and don't do's and than you go with your group to the basin. There are a few handlings you do with the animal and that is it. Whether it is too much money or not depends o what you think it is worth. It is not cheap, but to me it was worth the money. That the pictures are more expensive than the Experience was quite odd to me. Of course they know anyone wants proof of their Dolphin Experience for at home...

Lucy is the best.... Our dolphin experience was beyond belief! So much fun and the trainers were very professional, however, it seemed they'd forgotten how to have fun! Their manners need some polishing! :o) but that doesn't take away from the incredible experience of touching and playing with the dolphins!!
Cool experince. We were staying in the Atlantis and my son swamp with the dolphin. He enjoyed it so much. although the weather were rather cold to me.
A Dream Come True. I always wanted to swim with dolphins, and finally we did. This was a VERY beautiful experience, although I expected more time & interaction.

Even for Non Swimmers. This is great even if your a non swimmer, you stand or kneel in waist high water. This is a must for anyone who wants to get up close to some amazing creatures. You can dance with them, throw a ball or a ring and its 30 minutes of pure enjoyment. At the end pick your photo.As a resident at The Atlantis enrty to the water park is included but there is a charge for the dolphin experience.

We love Alice!. Alice. That's her name! She's an Indian Ocean Dolphin. She loves kids, likes people and likes to jump. Oh, and she likes giving kisses. But, smells a bit like fish. LOL! Dolphin Bay is a great educational experience. The trainers are very knowledgeable, and really have a good time teaching about the Dolphins. Great experience!

Dolphin Encounter. I was really disappointed with the Dolphin Encounter. It is definitely not worth the money I paid. First you have to listen to a 30 minute chat, whilst sat on very uncomfortable chairs all of which could have been explained in the water whilst with the dolphin as the information relates to the dolphin. When you are in the water with the dolphin you spend most of the time doing nothing and looking at other people having their photos taken. (10 people in a group). I think that I touched the dolphin 6 times (three of which were when I was having my photo taken). The photographers are supposed to be professional but from the quality of the photos I wouldn't say they were. The photos are also very expensive to buy and if you want to buy all of them or more than 4, it's cheaper to buy them on a CD or USB but then you have the photos of the other people in your group who you don't even know. At the start you get a photo taken with the dolphin jumping behind you. It would have been a nice photo if the photo was not taken from such a distance and if I didn't have to buy it with 6 people I don't know as it's taken as a group!!! The trainer we had also had problems understanding English - he kept asking if we had any questions which we did and when we asked him he had no idea what we were saying and answered something completely different and sometimes he didn't even know the answer. Don't waste your money doing this. We have swam with dolphins before in Orlando and for the same price you have a 30 minute swim where you actually swim with the dolphin and touch it more than 6 times. You also get a lot of personal photographs (no photos with people you don't know) and a full day of food and drinks included in the price.
Swimming with the Dolphins. This is something both children and adults can enjoy.Pricey but well worth every penny plus you walk away with a memory that will last a lifetime! :)

got to be done. paid about £150 each booked in england, I'd never done before was really good!! Includes access to water park at atlantis.
Photos were 200 dirhams for 4 which you could take your pick which ones you wanted
very nice. i love dolphins and i like swimming with them, this was an amazing trip. and quiet affordable too. When I decided to go i wasnt sure how much fun ill have.. but at the end it was so FUN

Fun with dolphins. The experience is very organized from the moment you arrive. Kids enjoyed themselves and their interaction with the dolphins. Parents can choose to pay a fee, and enter the beach area where the training takes place. If you want to get good pictures, that is a must. We waited outside and just watched from there. This is very similar to any other dolphin encounter in Florida or the Caribbean.

Amazing experiance. I am a non swimmer,i am scared of water,but i was desperate to interact with dolphins. It was a risk booking this as i was really scared about going in the water,but im so glad i did.
