We chose the dolphin interaction,the water comes up to your thigh,however you are expected to kneel in the water,so it does come up higher. I explained to the trainer i was scared of water and he helped me whenever i needed to move about. Being able to play,touch and learn about the dolphins made all the anxiety worth while,and i loved every minuite of it. Yes,the photos are a little expensive,but they are worth it to remember this fantastic day. Book it,you wont regret it.

What an experience!. I have booked Dolphin Enounter for my husband's birthday. It was very well organised. We were greeted by our coach. Before you start interaction, they will explain to you the do's and don'ts at the pool. Once it's done, they will then take you to the pool with the bunch of other people. There are several choices of program you can go for - shallow water, deep water experience, diving with dolphins and many more. We've gone for shallow water. You get plenty of time to interract with a dolphin.Amazingly, while our interraction, there was a couple and the guy actually proposed to his girl friend in front of us. What happened is a guess he has given the ring to the trainers prior to the session. They have hidden it in toy with which the dolphin usually plays. Once the girl has thrown the toy, the dolphin brought it back and there was an engagement ring attached to it! We were all so shocked and plesantly surprised. I think it's an awesome idea, however i am not too sure if they take any extra fee for this to be organised.They have camera men taking pictures, so you can either buy a few printed ones, or get all the pics on USB or selec from any other choices.I have thoroughly enjoyed the experience & i highly recommend doing this if you are in Dubai!

A wonderful entertainment in the Palm. Dolphin Bay in Dubai is one of the world’s most sophisticated dolphin habitats in the world. Here you can select from a range of dolphin interactions suitable for all ages and swimming abilities. Experiences range from standing in shallow water to swimming or scuba diving alongside these charismatic creatures. the Dolphin Bay in Dubai offers an unforgettable experience to visitors.
Fishes above you. Aquapark at Atlantis is amazing. Jelly fish and Sharks are main attractions. They have variety of fishes and it is in a very big area and at the end of palm beach resort.
great place. lovely place to visit one of the heart of dubai atlantis the palm theres no doubt that none other beach can be superior then this a must visit for everyone

Lifetime experience!. One on one with a dolpin after a very informative lecture on dolphins. So much time and interaction you will be overwhelmed. Hands on with the dolpin and even tricks. Fantastic photographers to document and capture the whole experience.

Just like other Dolphin Shows. A one day trip to this place is surely going to keep you occupied. There is water theme park, marine adventures, spa, restaurants, helicopter ride and so on. Dolphin Bay as the name suggests is the showcase of these wonderful ‘always smiling’ creatures. Read my travel experience in rashmisreedharan.blogspot.in/2012/08/arabian-adventures-atlantis-palm-island.html

Worth it even if it's expensive. One would think that It's expensive to pay 600AED (shallow water interaction) for almost 20-30 minutes of interaction with the dolphin and share the time with 9 other people but it was completely WORTH it. WOW. I am speechless. I even bought the pictures, they were so beautiful (200AED for 4 pictures). The supervisors, staff, trainers and dolphins were all great. The whole thing went very smoothly and marvelously. It was great great great....must be done by anyone who visits Dubai

Eery Architecture. At the far side of the first palm this looks like a theme park from a distance but close up it is a huge 5 star hotel. Inside everything is as 5 star as you ever dreamed, typical flash Dubai.
First time encounter. My husband, son and myself enjoyed a shallow experience in dolphin bay. We all enjoyed the encounter and would recommend it to others

Time with Central.. This was a really special experience and I did not think I'd enjoy it. Very expensive and the time with the Dolphins is actually very short but I have to admit, memorable. The photos are a must have even though the price is extortionate.

Great Experience. I'm not normally a fan of these kind of attractions but decided to give it a go and I was glad I did. It was one of the best experiences I have ever had and really enjoyed it. We went for the deep water adventure which I would highly recommend. You get a good amount of time with the dolphins and within your small group (about 6) you get to have lots of interactions with the dolphins. I would definitely recommend one of the encounters within the deeper water to get the best experience, it is worth the extra money. The setting within the Atlantis is great and having the water park to use after was nice. The professional photos taken during the experience are also not as expensive as you might expect for an attraction of this nature.
Dolphin Encounter. This is a great experience, but if you can, book a private experience for your group as you'll get a bit more time. Other than that, well worth it!
Dolphin Bay - Atlantis. First ever interactions with Dolphins and the package (royal swim) and the staff were spot on.Excellent environment and very informative.
birthday treat. always wanted to swim with dolphins, great friendly enviroment, we went in july top of summer to hot but didnt matter as we ahd a great time

Great hotel and experience, pool bar staff need training. The hotel itself is clean and modern. The pool bar service is not the best though and staff need to be much more aware of their surroundings. In our time at the bar there were 3 tables that complained about the food and service. Our food was ok but took a long time to arrive. Dolphin Bay is a great experience and the waterpark also.
great. lovely close contact and small groups too.especially the information section prior to getting in the water

up close and personal. 3 of my children & the Mrs.loved the swimming experience of "close encounters" with the dolphins-located in the grounds of Atlantis,the Palm hotel- a 2min buggy ride from the hotel lobby-easy to book-photography allowed but no video-members of the family can watch from the viewing gallery or on request enter the beach enclosure of Dolphin bay
Very good. Would prefer smaller group and would do a swim encounter next time rathervthan the shallow water meet

Lovely experience when dreams come true!. I always dreamt of swiming with the dolphins. In Atlantis my dream came true. The Dolphin Bay located open air and looks great. They have different programs to offer for all kind of age and swiming skills. The trainers were very nice and friendly. The instruction was made before we got in the water. There were 4 people in the group. Our dolphin was just great and smiling. It is definetely a very positive experience. I got some nice photos in the end. The total price for the swim was not cheap around US $120, but it surely worth it. Don't miss it if you there.

Very good but pricey. I booked a dolphin encounter for my daughter for her 5th birthday. She really loved the experience and the staff working there really made it fun for her. She met Danica the dolphin who she hugged and kissed. It's a thing that you have to do but i did find it was quite dear compared to other places

Dream Realised. Surpassed all expectations. Best to book prior to going. Only disappiontment....From the reviews on the site it was assumed that friends/family could not take photographs.....NOT TRUE!!!

Good experience. Not cheap at approximately £160.00 Although this does include entrance to the water park. Good interaction - extremely disappointed at the quality of photographs taken by the 'professional' photographer - none were worth buying :(
Brilliant. Very fun - the trainers are very knowledgeable and an experience you won't forget. The photos are very expensive though be warned!

Superb experience. We had pre-booked to visit the Atlantis Aquaventure water park (with additional Lost World aquarium package) & the Atlantis Dolphin Bay shallow water dolphin encounter. Apparently unbeknown to our travel operator (this is now an on-going dispute with them), the dolphin encounters (both shallow or deep water) *include* the price of the Aquaventure water park (+ towel + locker + soft drinks), so we could have combined the 2 visits into one day). One important note – for the dolphin encounter, there is no such thing as free watching! You have to pay AED300 (about £50!) per adult (AED 265 for a child) just for an observer’s ticket; be aware that all children under 12 going for a dolphin encounter must be accompanied by an adult (maximum 3 kids per adult!). Some of the prices are seasonal; rather than listing them all, you can check the details via their website - http://www.atlantisthepalm.com
Holiday Highlight. I booked before leaving the UK and glad I did as it is very popular. It is expensive, £300 Adult +2 Children, but it was the highlight of the holiday for my children.

Dolphin Bay at the Atlantis. We booked about a month before we went away as we wanted to make sure we got the trip we wanted! We booked the Royal Dolphin swim and it was fantastic from start to finish. The team were really friendly and helpful and it was fun and relaxed. There were 5 of us in the group and we got to hold,hug and kiss Lisa the dolphin, we each had a dorsal fin swim and a toe push swim, both were just amazing experiences that we will never forget. If we go back to Dubai I would do this again. Afterwards we got the buggy back to the water park and enjoyed the rides,however, when we went to get some towels we were told that we should have kept the towels we had at the dolphin swim ( we were not aware of this and I am not sure if the staff at Dolphin Bay are either) as if we wanted towels we would have to pay 30 dirhams, which we did not do as I think that's a bit cheeky to ask us to pay more when the swim cost in excess of £300!!!! Maybe the management at the Atlantis and Dolphin Bay can look into this. Luckily we were lent some spare towels by some helpful holidaymakers. So just double check before you go. Otherwise it was a great day and we would recommend it ....have fun!

Great Day Out. If you get a chance Swim with the dolphins. Its the most amazing experience you can have.The Dolphins are so well looked after and our Children fell in love with them. It was a lovely tropical location.

Share the photo package. I read this tip after we did our dolphin experience. The photos are amazing and you will defiantly want them but since everyone in the group will get a flash with all the pictures 600dirham you could load them on your laptop then pass on the flash. Easy if you are Atlantis hotel guests. These photos are also sold separate from any other photos you may want from the waterpark oranywhere around the hotel they cannot be included in another package.

WOW Experience. Excellent experience for the children (although some might not like the way the dolphins feel). But we had a great experience. Being so close to the dolphins, playing with them, and seeing them perform. My kids really loved it.

Expensive but worth it. We stayed at Atlantis so booked a dolphin experience for my 12 year old son at a (slightly) discounted rate. He had swam with dolphins previously so was not at all nervous to go on his own. My daughter and I chose to watch him from the beach viewing area with the idea that we would take photos but you simply cannot get close enough to get anything nearly good enough so you are left no option but to purchase the 'official' photos afterwards. The half hour or so experience was around £180 but they also charged us £25 to spectate and then we spent £50 on photos!!! Expensive yes but worth every penny. It is a beautiful area, simply stunning and the dolphins are clearly very well cared for. There is plenty of opportunity for the participants to interact with the dolphins and my Son loved every minute of it!
amazing experience!. Loved it, great for young kids! Don't forget to take extra pennies for the photos they take! Expensive but well worth it!!

Fantastic. Had the dolphin experience with my son and it was great. Loved the educational talk before hand and the staff were great. The dolphins were beautiful and friendly as long as you follow the rules

Too crowded. Nice dolphin experience. My nine year old daughter adored and she once to return. I have to admit, I liked it as well. This is close encounter with a dolphin. After our dolphin experience, we wanted to try out some of the slides. As this was Easter period, the whole park was extremely crowded and very long queues. We were not able to use any slides.
Nice one. The instructor was nice and will help you if you are with kid so that you can touch or they will cick a snap as you are not allowed to take camera for safety purposes as can scare dolpihn

Fantastic experience and worth spending the money. We were staying at the Royal Meridien hotel so paid a little more for the attraction than if we were staying at Atlantis but it was all booked efficiently through the Arabian Adventures rep in our hotel. Definitely book this in advance! First of all you are not guaranteed a time if you just turn up and the ticket booth is shared with Aquaventure so the crowds just become ridiculous if you don't get there early. For 3 of us we paid 1,785 UAE Dirhams which is just over £300; not cheap but you can easily spend this on a dinner and night club here!The Dolphin Bay tickets do allow you to use the Aquaventure Water Park so it is best to get an early time for the dolphins and then just walk or take the golf buggy back to the Water Park.(I will review Aquaventure separately)You have a choice of interacting with the dolphins either in shallow or deep water; with our 7 year old we had no choice really but to go for the shallow water but this did not lessen our enjoyment at all. The changing facilities are great and the related instruction and orientation are efficiently done; you are then split into groups of 10 and allocated one of the dolphins - the day we were there there were 3 groups of 10 for the one time slot we had reserved. The actual interaction with the dolphin probably lasts around 25 mins but it is fantastic and tough to put into words; there are plenty of photos are taken by one of the reps which you can buy later at the boutique (they are not cheap either but they are of very high professional quality and make a fantastic little souvenir).

Once in a lifetime Experience. I did the Royal Dolphin Swim in Dubai and it was FANTASTIC!! Sure the dolphin tow ride in was short and sweet but I was grinning all the way! To get kisses and cuddles was awesome and so was the boogie board ride. The photos are well worth the money very good quality. I was worried about how long I would have to swim in the deep water of the lagoon but there is a small rock wall edge to lean on while you wait your turn for two dolphins to grab onto to take you for a ride. It was one of my dreams come true and a massive tick off my bucket list ! LOVED IT !

Nice to see real dolphin for first time.. I met the dolphins and they were cool but it was annoying having to wait for along time to go to the dolphins for just 3O mins. Too expensive but for a good expirience
Great experience. Great for kids and adults. There was a lady in a wheelchair who also did the experience. They accommodated her really well.

Swim with the Dolphins - Experience of a lifetime. The dolphin show at the Dophnin Bay in Atlantis is lovely. How ever I recommend "The swim with the dolphins" experience. This is a out of body BUCKET LIST experience everybody must do it atleast once their life time. The half an hour interaction last 30 minutes and costs about $300. Typically 3 small groups of 4 to 5 each is assigned to a well trained dolphin.Each dolphin has atleast 12 to 15 years experience and is extremely gentle & safe to touch and play with.We are give a 10 minutes audio visual presentation. We are escorted to the bay area with an experienced trainer wearing our diving suit.The dolphin offers a peck on your cheeks; next as you make a circular gesture with your arms the dolphin dives down and resurfaces parallel to your body to give you a wonderful HUG. A stretched hand gets you to do a merry go round spin with the dolphin. However the ultimate experience is a back flip where the dolphin swims backwards and you hang on to the flippers for a 50m drag . Those 30 minutes are absolutely amazing, magical & divinely spiritual resonating at the deepest level as we touch & play with such an adorable & intelligent mammal.

Best thing to do in Dubai... fantastic for adults and children alike.. I have done all of the interactions at Atlantis and can honestly say they are all fantastic. This particular interaction involves wading into a crystal clear lagoon and experiencing the dolphins without having to worry about swimming. Look out for special prices and deals. I paid around AED 2200 for my family of four which may seem expensive and yet when you have the privilege of spending time with these special dolphins it almost seems too little.The dolphins are housed in a state or the art facility which is incredibly spacious and staffed by professionals who truly care for the environment and the dolphins they are looking after. Atlantis can be proud if this dedicated team.Pros: 1)Touching, kissing, hugging, playing and learning about dolphins and their environment.2) Educational and entertaining.3) Anybody can do it... young, old... and no need to know how to swim. I even saw staff assisting a man in a wheelchair get into the water and enjoy the interaction... INCREDIBLE!4) Friendly, professional staff who go out of their way for everyone and show incredible care for their dolphins.So many Pros!Cons: None.We did a 10:30 shallow water. We arrived at 10:20 and were directed to the entrance to the Aqua water park. From here we got our tickets and caught a golf cart to Dolphin Bay. We were warmly received by the team at Dolphin Bay (10:35) and after a few minutes were taken to a building where we were given information, wetsuits and a talk about dolphins. As we had to remove jewellery and watches I am not sure what time we started the interaction but when we had finished up and I had changed the time was close to midday.

Nice Holiday at Atlantis. This place is really nice for adults and kids. Enjoy and share your experience by swimming side by side with the Dolphins. Very attractive place for Holidays. Enjoyed a lot!!!!!!!!!

It's on everyone's bucket list.... and if you're going to do it, do it here at a hotel that can only be described as the "Liberace" of hotels. It's big, brash and full of tourists but the Dolphin experience is as close up and personal as you're likely to get. Dance, kiss and stroke the dolphins and smile for the camera for some great professional shots.

A WOW moment of our holiday at Atlantis.. This was not a cheap experience but in my opinion, a once in a lifetime chance and worth every penny. It cost us AED 1980 for a family of four. (£343 - £86 each). We chose the Encounter as one of children is not a confident swimmer and the encounter takes place in waist high water. Due to the age restriction, all children under 12 years old must be accompanied by a paying adult, so we decided to do it as a family, rather than one parent and it was the best decision we ever made. Upon checking into Dolphin Bay, you are given the choice of a wetsuit or a sleeveless jacket. We opted for the wetsuit. We were told this was the best option as the saltwater pools are cold at 25 degrees Celsius, which made us laugh, as we welcomed the cool water in the intense heat of 38 deg C that day! A brief orientation on how to behave in the pool was mostly missed by me as I was struggling to take off my wedding rings (as no jewellery, glasses or accessories are allowed in the dolphin pools). But it didn’t matter as the dolphin instructors guide you every second of the experience. 30 minutes in the pool includes touching and stroking the dolphin, playing or dancing individually, group photos and then individual kiss shots. Every part of the experience is photographed professionally. After a shower and a drink, you can make your way to the shop to buy souvenirs and photos of your encounter. Our group was 8 people and over 80 photos were taken. We chose to buy all our photos on a CD, with the option to print them at home. The CD cost about £60. Expensive, but much cheaper than buying individual photos, as there were too many to choose from. An amazing experience we will never forget.

Brilliant. Have never swum with dolphins before and I guess it's a one off thing but we are really glad we did this, came away feeling very happy and satisfied. They are truely beautiful creatures and loved every minute of it.
Swim with the dolphins. Brilliant. This is the best experience we had in Dubai. The Atlantis The Palm is a great place to stay and visit for this experience. Worth the money.

Absolutely amazing Experience.. Its a bit expensive, but you can buy both the passes together, Aquaventure and Dolphin Bay.. My kids loved it and didnt want to leave these amazing mammals, if you are travelling with the kids this should be your number 1 attraction, you get to touch and play with Dolphins in a controlled environment.

A dream come true. This was something I always wanted to do and I am happy I chose Dolphin Bay Dubai for it. I was worried at fist that maybe the dolphins will not be treated well or maybe over worked, but I didn't feel that was the case. Their handlers are amazing people, all young, all properly schooled and trained for the job and you can obviously see and feel the love they have for these amazing creatures. And our dolphin, Lenox, was the cutest, smartest thing ever! I loved every moment with him!
Spoilt. A dream come trueCan only be impressed by such wonderful creaturesAnd respect the chance that one has to have such an experience

LOT OF MONEY FOR NOT A LOT OF TIME WITH DOLPHINS. This was for our young son. We did the adult trip later that afternoon. The adult experience was worth the money the kids one was a lot of money for a short time just touching the dolphin a few times.
Dolphin Swim. Had an amazing time, we swam with dolphins twice. I tried to upgrade our first swim, but couldnt as we'd booked with our travel agents, so we swam again.

A Must Try!. An encounter with the Dolphin is a must. It is worth the try.Dancing, kissing and swimming with the dolphin and learning about dolphins before the actual experience is an additional knowledge.
Beautiful. Loved it all, fell in love with the dolphins, trainers were fab and really friendly.. To hot but water was lovely and cold

Dolphin Bay, Atlantis Review. The Dolphin Bay in Atlantis is huge. There people can interact and play with dolphins. There are 2 options- shallow, you dont need to be a swimmer or a good swimmer and deep- you need to know swimming very well ! It's quite awesome and you can get cheesy pictures clicked with the dolphins. The one I'd interacted with was called Manalu !

If your a frequent traveler..... Do the dolphin swim somewhere else... in dubai it just feels very blaaaah as an experience... ive talked to many people who have done it and said it was "nice" but they regret the money they spent ....

Wonderful well worth the money. well looked after. changing rooms. briefing then in the water to play with the Dolphin. Worth while doing this and got the photo album afterwards with your choice of photos from the session
TULAGIIIIIIIII!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!1. wonderful, excellent, so much thanks to TULAGI(DOLPHIN) and all staff, amazing experience
Swam with the Dolphins. Great fun, swam with the dolphins. A place to visit with family.
Dolphin Bay must do. We had a great time swam with and touched the dolphins this was an experience of a life time. The staff are experts and so helpful.we enjoyed it, thanks for a great experience.

lovely exp with the Dolphin Aibe. lovely exp with the Dolphin Aibe..the instructors are also very good & all the dolphins are well trained & so sweet...we even kissed the dolphins on thr nose & we danced as well to the dance numbers of our choice..overall greattt exp :)
Fun with Dolphins. This is seriously fun. Give it a go. The dolphins are seriously loved by the trainers which makes it a great experience.

Best part of the trip!. We took our family to this while staying at Atlantis. Our girls are 4 and 5 and they absolutely love it. I was apprehensive at first and was going to pass. Fortunetly, I decided to participate and it was an experience that we will remember for a lifetime!
Experience of a lifetime. Expensive at face value but well worth it. Lots of Time with the animals and such a brillante time.

Do not visit the Dolphin Bay. I would strongly advise against visiting the dolphin bay because these dolphins have been trapped and kept in captivity, please do not support this, you can google this topic and find dozens of links about the Atlantis Hotel and dolphin situation.
ride with dolphin. Lovely staff ensured that our day went without any problem. The swim with this wonderful creature our " FIRST" but was unbelievable thrill.
Amazing. Well worth doing, you can pay £20 if you want a family member to come in with you to take photos (maybe cheaper to do this than pay for proffessional)
What a day!. The service is great and the experience out of this world!

Shallow water experience. Had such a great time at the dolphin experience. This is a nice thing to do for any age. Also, when doing this, you get access to the water park. This is also a fun thing to do, with lots of things to do. Plenty of places to eat & drink within the water park.

Fun...Fun...Fun. it is a great place for both kids and adults. at the end of the day you do not get the chance to interact with a real dolphin often. Everything is good and well organized,the only disadvantage is that they do not let you take your own camera and do charge a lot for a couple of pictures. That is not fair, i should have the option of either taking my own pictures or buying the professional ones.
Fab for the kids. Great experience to get so close to the dolphins, amazing animals and well worth it..

A once in a lifetime experience. What a fantastic facility for the humans and the dolphins.People seem to be quick to condemn these sorts of things, but the dolphins fate would have been a very bad one if Atlantis didn't take them in, they're well cared for and seem very happy. (if you can tell how happy a dolphin can be that is)There's as much emphasis put on the knowledge side and understanding as the experience in the water.We loved every minute of the experience and will never forget it

What a privilege to swim with the Dolphins....and educational. Swimming with Dolphins has to be on everyones dreams, aspirations or bucket list. Atlantis has a great program for everyone. It doesn't matter if you cannot swim they do different programs depending on how proficient you are in the water! They do a great job in the beginning education you all about Dolphins with an interactive quiz - whilst teach you how to act and behave in the water it also provides you lots of information about these amazing creatures.This is a must do if you come to Dubai........dreams really do come true and you can see it in peoples eyes....humbling!!
Excellent. It was a wonderful experience and would highly recommend

worth it !. my brother and i went over there , and it is really worth the money! not only do you play with the dolphins , they actually prepare a little presentation about them ! like the number of teethes they have , the kinds and ... etc. there is a photographer taking pictures if you'd like to take them home , a fee is applicable of course. there are lockers bathrooms changing rooms available. the people working there are really sweet and friendly . after finishing from the dolphin bay you have free access to aquaventure (waterpark) , i would suggest not going to aquaventure on a friday , its really crowded .but overall it was worth it !

Kids Loved It. The experience was fantastic the children enjoyed it swimming with the dolphins taking photo's it was superb we have done this since Atlantis as been opened every year and it's on the list again this year. It's is slightly expensive but worth every penny, the clean surroundings and location is fantastic when we do this we always book into the atlantis for the night, you get a slight discount being residents.

Perfect New Years Day. What a way to spend New Years Day - the information given to us before meeting the dolphins was great and presented in a way to keep all of the childrens interest from 7-15. We did not feel rushed with the dolphnis at all. My husband was allowed on the beach with his own camera to take photos so we did not need to buy the official photographers ones which were pricey. It is something that will stay with us for a very long time
Lovely experience. We done the deepwater experience & it was amazing. Highly recommended
so fun. i went too the dolphin bay at the Atlantis palm it was so fun i got too swim and dance wit the dophin
Worth every penny!. A wonderful experience to swim with the dolphins you get a lot for your money and you will take away some precious memories.
great. fab location with simple instructions given by the staff who obviously love their job.once in a lifetime experience must do it
memorable experience. Interaction with the dolphins was good but felt the education abouth the dolphins took too long
fab. what a fabulous experience, no rush rush to get the next party in, just fab to play with toys with the dolphins and learn about them, would do it again in a minute
up close and personal. was definitely the highlight to swim and interact with the dolphins, and of course the staff was so very informative and helpful. absolutely loved it

Dolphins Up Close. Had a Royal Swim at Dolphin Bay. Facilities are excellent. I was concerned before going that it might be a bit circus-y and that I might feel bad for the animals, but you could tell there was a genuine affection between the dolphins and the trainers and I left having had a fantastic experience. Whatever level of experience you can afford, do it!
a one off experience. lots of variety in the programmes they offer means there is something to suit everyone
Awesome!. This was the best part of our trip! So glad I booked this it was an amazing experience, especially when out dolphin 'Lennox' sang happy birthday to my husband. Very special experience!

Great fun, difficult to book!. Had a blast with the shallow dolphin encounter - the trainers are well versed and the show itself is a lot of fun. Booking through Expedia was a terrifically awful experience and the telephone operators of the water park itself were not helpful either. Having said that once you're in the water all of that washes away. recommended.

Fantastic opportunity to experience swimming with dolphins. Did this with my mother-in-law while the men watched from the side. It is a fantastic experience. And I believe (from research and speaking with the trainers) that the dolphins are relatively happy (I'd heard stories of dolphins in captivity being on anti-depressants), so I could ease my conscience. The 'experience' is well thought through and enlightening for the visitors. Dolphins are wonderful creatures. You do, however, feel like you're on an 'experience conveyor belt'. There's nothing spontaneous about it. Next time, I will seek out some wild dolphins off the coast somewhere as I hear that swimming with wild dolphins is simply amazing.
Atlantis Dolphin Bay. A tad expensive but well worth the experience and my 5 year old boy loved it!!
Awasome!. Great time for a family of all ages. The staff was excellent as well as the facilities.

Amazing Experience. 120 euros/person to enjoy a unique experience with dolphins playing with you (kissing, hugging, dancing, playing with ball...). A true escape from real life and an amazing connection with dolphins. Moreover with the ticket you get also full entrance to the water park where you can play all day with water falls and games you will never forget (that is if you go to the top Leef of faith!).

Costs an arm and a leg, but unforgettable. We'd just sold our house, so decided we'd spend the proceeds on visiting the dolphins. We went for the top-end shared dolphin encounter, so spent a good 20 minutes in the water with them. Some of the activities were a bit tacky, but it's an amazing experience.They cunningly prevent you from bringing in cameras, but will sell you the digital photos taken by their own photographers. Unfortuntately we didn't have another house to sell, so decided not to avail ourselves of this option.

A good experience but bit expensive. There are about 5 type of Dolphin adventures available at the Dolphin Bay. One needs to be rich to afford these. We went for the cheapest one, which was a special in house offer for a Dolphin Photo shoot, merely a 5 minute encounter with the Dolphin , when one get to kiss and hold the fins in a dance mode. This costed us a more than £50 per person.Other packages include, Dolphin Encounter, which is ideal for families with young children and non-swimmers. costs in excess of £100 but I suppose the most thrilling adventure would have to be the Dolphin Adventure comprising of singing,dancing and belly riding with the dolphins. There is also a Dolphin Scuba Dive package, which allows an opportunity to dive into the depths of the Dolphin Bay lagoon, costing in excess of £200.00It's all fun and certainly an experience but at a cost.

AMAZING!!!!!!. We did the Dolphin Adventure package and really can't recommend it enough, it was amazing. The trainers were very good, have a very good rapport with the dolphins. The whole experience was very well organised.

An Amazing Experience. Whilst expensive, this experience is definitely worth spending the money on. We tried out 2 different dolphin experiences. I did the Dolphin Adventure with our 8 and 11 year olds (as participants in the Royal Swim need to be 12 or over). We had a wonderful time. We were able to touch and play with the dolphin, dance, hug and receive a kiss and then go for a belly ride, fantastic. My husband and our 14 year old did the 'Royal Swim' which included all of the above but replaced the belly ride with a dorsil fin tow and a foot push. We all agreed that either experience would be fantastic, so don't feel you are missing out if the children are not old enough to do the Royal Swim. Highly recommended.

Amazing dolphin show. Book your tickets online in advance. There is a discount for 11.00 am Friday shows. Select ur seats from 3rd row to avoid splash water when dolphins are jumbing. Buy balls for kids to throw to the pool for dolphins to select..
Dance with the dolphins. my daughter was very excited when she was swimming and dancing with the dolphins.
Very American. Lovely to see the dolphins but very American loud and commercial

Great fun for the kids and adults!. 1. Checkin - fast and curtious2. Education Session - informative and simple for all3. Body suits provided4. The dolphin experience - well organized, interactive and photos provided (for an arm, leg and another arm).We did the little kid, beach experience with my 7 year old twins and they loved it. Everyone gets a chance to have a ring or ball retrieved, or a dance with the dolphin. You also have multiple opportunities to pet, hug and yes...even kiss the dolphin. The hour long expereince seemed longer as everything was well organized.I highly recommend this as part of your Atlantis stay!
Dancing & kissing dolphins!. Great for the kids and I quite enjoyed it too! Actually very well managed and slightly surreal being so close but very memorable.
Good, but expensive. I had a great time there, but when I paid I didn't had a that good time. Over 100£.

Don't get me wrong!!. I loved it as I always wanted to have a close encounter with dolphins and this was really cute but I would never encourage this and deeply regret doing it after watching the award winning documentary 'The Cove' which reveals how these amazing creatures are captured, slaughtered and only the female bottle-nose dolphins sold for 6 digits to be in places just like the Dolphin Bay in Atlantis. Watch http://www.thecovemovie.com/

Lifetime experience - great for Kids. First of all, there are several "packages"- shallow waters (good for everyone (I'd say starting at 3/4years old) where you stand in up to 1 m waters and fondle, play, stroke the dolphin- deep waters where you "swim" with dolphins, this requires to be 10 or 12 I thinkWe went for the Shallow with my 4 and 6 year old KIDS and they LOVED ITAll in all, this will take you 2 hours.I saw the comments on ON PICTURES AND CAMERASSimple, you are in a muslim country (and aslo I guess for them to cash in on their photo business), one cannot film nor take pics in the water. Bring someone along to do it for you on the beach if you want, otherwise, dish out and additional USD 120 to get about 50 professional pics on a USB stick (it is quite EXPENSIVE yes... as the whole experience is)PLUSIn a nutshell, as a group (10 max) and individually, you interact, stroke, dance, play with the dolphin, it s great !The facilities are great and quite grand and organization is very professionalMINUSThe introductory sequence where you sit and look at powerpoint presentation is a tad too longExpensive

Amazing Experience. They are very professional at Dolphin Bay and they take a lot of precautions to make sure tourists don't do something idiotic to hurt themselves or the dolphins. I just wish the experience has lasted longer! The dolphins were super cool. They are also pushing you to spend the bucks on the photos, gift shop, etc. But who can blame them? They are supporting how many dolphins and trainers??
Great family fun. So much fun! My girls swam with the dolphins. It was a great experience. They learned so much about the dolphins and they loved every moment.
Delightful. Just lovely with the dolphins and the dolphins kiss you and dance with you, really nice experience.
expensive!!!!. the whole family loved the experience,but we felt like ripped off specially because we were late and had to pay the penalty.
Dolphins. WE got a discount from the hotel but was still quite expensive, the pool was clean and the experience good but they charged for family 100 diru (£20) each to watch and take photos!

this is based in bur dubai great for kids. had a great time just watching the dolphins the one we checked out was the one in bur dubai..
went to the atlantis one but there were closed, too late my advice go before 6pm lol
Touch the dolphin.. Playing and watching the dolphins have fun and i have little bit fear about it
Great seeing the dolphins. Educational as well as fun. Had to wear wet suits but a very serene experience as ive always regarded dolphines to be such friendly creatures.
we loved it. My kids were very excited and so were we : excellent facility very nice dolphins trainers and interacting with the dolphin is an unforgettable experience

Something a kid won't forget!. Go! Go! Go! It's an unforgettable experience, especially for kids, but also the grown ups will enjoy. Basically we are talking about staying in the water with a dolphin, touching, dancing, kissing with him for 25 minutes. Even it's pretty expensive, almost 200 dollars per person, you have to do it
Dolphin Adventure (Deep Water). One of the best experiences of my life. The kids loved it and wanted to do it again. If you go to Dubai then this is a must do!
Not worth the money. We had to wait an extra 40 minutes whilst one of the group took forever with her very young baby. Was it really appropriate? It ruined everyone else's session

Not as much interaction as you would like.... We purchased the Royal experience for 800dh each. Six of us in the group and overall we may have spent 3 minutes interacting with the dolphins each. We still all loved it but if you think you are going to swim a lot with the dolphins - think again. Staff were very professional. Be prepared to spend over US$100 for pictures of your experience.
Best day out ever. Expensive but well worth it - my two girls (7 & 4) had the best day out ever. Loved it myself and i'm 37!

Wonderful Experience. Great way to spend a day ....Swimming with Dolphins experience was fantastic although quite expensive ..
The staff were friendly and welcoming .
A once in a lifetime experience ...Highly Recommended .
Fantastic Family Experience. We all loved Dolphin Bay. Meeting the Dolphin was a life time experience and it was very educational for the whole family.
Well run, educational and fun!. I worried it would be cheezy and exploit the dolphins, but found it educational, well run, fun and the dolphins appear well cared for and respected.

fun and great experience. try to get there early to skip the crowds - prebook a ticket and then your family will have the lifetime experience to swim with dolphins. we loved it - try to escape the merchandising store - otherwise you will end up like us with 4 new dolphin pets in a new suitcase ;-)

A Family Delight.. My family and I stayed at the Atlantis in February 2012, which is not our first visit as we just love the place. My grandchildren particularly like the Dolphin Bay area. The Dolphins are a delight to see and I would certainly recommend a trip to see the wonderful Bay where they live, a real treat.

Amazing experience even for non-swimmers. We got the dolphin ecounter package which was amazing,we got to touch,play,dance with a Dolphin and the staff took plenty of photos for you to purchase at the end of our session. Really worth it for all ages, staff are fantastic too!
Remember to buy the photos. I wasn't made aware that there would be affordable photo packages after the experience which are so worth it.
Awesome experience. For my 40th birthday it was a special treat & an excellent time was had.
Great for Kids. Great for all the family. Who doesn't like Dolphins doing trips
A great experience. The staff was friendly and welcoming and the experience was really coll!

First time with dolphins. I went with two grandchildren to swim with the dolphins at Dolphin Bay, when staying at Atlantis. I have to say I was bowled over by the experience, as were the kids. I recommend it, though it is not cheap - it is a lifetime experience.
Loving Dubai. The kids really love this of course. getting in the water with dolphins, who wouldn't. I'm just not sure if it's a good thing for the dolphins.
Loving Dubai. Great way to spend the day. The kids will love it.

Very expensive but worthy if really wished. We didnt do as the budget was closed! First price is aroud 120€ per person to spend 20minutes close to dolphins. You will be really with them and touching them and even swimming if wished so those for whom it is a dream you will be happy!First day go and check if you want to do to book in advance. If 1 person pay the others can enjoy the beach close to all dolphins.

Doplhins at your service. You like to swim with dolphins? This is the best place in Dubai to have some fun with them. Ofcourse if you are willing to pay the price. Without paying you won't be able to enter the area, you have just to watch and envy behind the small fence.

AGAIN! And YES it was EVEN BETTER!!!. What can I say that has not been said before? This place is incredibly special with a team of dedicated people who share their love of the animals with us in a unique and beautiful way.The privilege of being able to experience dolphins at such close range is one aspect that must never be taken for granted. Simply to enter the environment they live in is a humbling experience and one that will be cherished for a life time. I applaud the passion of the dolphin trainers in being the voice of these magnificent creatures and inspiring us to live our lives more consciously in a way that respects nature and the longevity of our planet. These dolphins are powerful ambassadors that are making a very real difference in changing the way humanity interacts with their environment.My friends and I decided to book an exclusive experience whereby the four of us did a dolphin adventure and were able to have a dolphin all to ourselves. WOW!!! WE WERE TOTALLY BLOWN AWAY. Having the financial means to afford such an experience is a gift that I am grateful for and give thanks for every single day. If you can afford it then all I can say is your money cannot be spent in any better way.Having done the experiences before I enjoyed it even more on my repeat visit than before. I would like to extend my thanks and appreciation to the team and the wonderful dolphins.
AMAZING EXPERIENCE. WOW!!!! A once in a life time experience!! awesome 2 dolphins for 30 mins just me and my partner, pure luck we didnt have to share with other guests!!
Amazing. A must do. Dolphin encounter or royal swim, there is something for everyone.

Once in a time experience. Went to Atlantis on the 25th Feb 12. Both myself and my wife went on the dolphin experience. The whole experience was great, from the initial briefing, the welcoming staff and the wonderful dolphins. We spent a good 30 minutes in the water with the beautiful dolphins. We got the chance to hug, kiss the dolphins which was great. Also got pushed and pulled by 2 of the dolphins. Highlight was the beautiful singing of happy birthday to my wife. Never to be forgotten. Thank you Central, our dolphin for the day.

I wasn't sure I would, but I loved it!. Being a vegan, I wasn't sure how I felt about the whole 'animals in captivity' thing. I have never visited a dolphinarium or watched a water show with whales and dolphins. So I was dubious about swimming with dolphins. However, Dolphin Bay was excellent. The dolphins are really well looked after and well cared for by the trainers. Yes, it is quite pricey, but I would rather pay the extra to know that the dolphins have an excellent standard of living. This is an awesome experience, the trainers are good fun, the bay itself is an excellent size and is very clean. I really learned a lot.
see my review for aquaventure !!. love love love the dolphins. you learn a lot about them and their lives so educational as well as extremely enjoyable

Ethical or not?. The dolphin centre here is very well maintained with a good balance of education and entertainment. The group leader and trainer were very good. My only criticism would be that I would have liked the group leader to take charge a bit more; i.e. ask people talking during the presentation to be quiet because you couldn't hear what he was saying, and making sure that people kept to time. There was a lot of waiting around for stragglers. After the dolphin experience I really questionned myself as to whether the entire set up was ethical or not. The dolphins at the centre were caught in the wild just North of Australia. I don't think I agree with that. I'm also not sure that it is appropriate to train such beautiful animals to entertain us. There are other options for coming close to dolphins in the wild, and I think that these might be a better investment, albeit not a guaranteed experience.

Fun - But expensive.. A short swim, and playing in 20 min. with a dolphine, for the children it was a wonderfull time, but I think it was expensive, we touch the dolphine 8 times, "one touch 150 dollars"It is a activitet for young children.

Amazing experience. This was not cheap, worked out about £400 for a family of three but I have to say it was one hell of an experience and you really get up close to interact with the dolphins. My 7yr old was utterly mesmorised!
Expensive but Awsome!. The adventure with dolphins was amazing. It was a bit expansive but for once a life time, it was worth it.

Dolphin Adventure. My daughter is not a confident swimmer so chose the Dolphin Adventure package. Once in a wetsuit, we were shown into a room and shown a presentation giving information about dolphins and what to expect.Once in the water, there was the opportunity to 'hold' a dolphin, to kiss the dolphin and to dance with the dolphin. There was a professional photographer and photos were available to purchase afterwards. In order to spectate, there was an additional cost to gain access to the beach where you were able to take your own photos.My daughter loved it and thought it was a fabulous experience.

Amazing to swim with dolphins!. It was an experience of a lifetime! While it was not one-on-one, it was in groups of 5-6 which is almost close enough and relativly cheap when considering the prices for this type of event worldwide.
dancing with dolphins!!!. this experience allows to up close and personal with the dolphins including kissing and dancing!!!

Always wanted to swim with Dolphins!. During our stay in Dubai we had pre booked a Dolphin Encounter online. It cost approx £100 for the encounter which includes an educational talk and then time in the water with the dolphins learning about them and then opportunities to hug, kiss, stroke and play with the dolphins. Refreshments are also included, a can of pop or water.The staff are friendly and good at their jobs, they are also great with the little ones especially in the educational part. Staff at the Atlantis are from all over the World so you will find someone who speaks your language without any problems.Photographs must be purchased separately at the end of your encounter and when we travelled the package included 2 photos and you were not able to buy just the one. I think we paid 300 Dirhams for the 2 if I remember correctly.Lockers are provided to keep your belongings safe and are simple to use, all explained in the short briefing. Wetsuits or vests are also provided and the guys are experienced in getting you into the right sizes etc.Be aware, you cannot wear anything loose when getting in the water so all jewellery and any hair bands/clips must be removed...this led to some outrageous hair dos after having my hair in a bobble all day which looked just delightful on our photos!!I have always wanted to swim with the Dolphins and am glad that we had this experience in Duabi.

Amazing experience........... ................but 20 minutes with the dolphins really isn't long enough. By the time you enter the pool with the other four members of your group and the instructors explain proceedures the time just disappears!
A Wonderful Experience. Just simply, a wonderful experience and exceptionally well done by the trainers and staff, a very special moment.
Great Experience with a hefty price tag!. Staff were nice and friendly, experience was one of a life time, though price is high.
Unforgettable. went with the kids aged 5 and 8, it was great. photos were fabulous too which we will treasure forever.
What a way to spend your birthday!. Amazing experience. Very educational and then a great opportunity to spend time in the pool with the dolphins.
Wonderful. " sons swam with dolphins. It is a little expensive (about £120 each) so ensure that you budget well before you go.
The dolphin experience. If you like dolphins, you must try the dolphin experience. It's absolutely fantastic!

Dolphins. Good attraction with the dolphins, a little expensive as its part of the Atlantis and anything attached to the Atlantis is expensive.
Good couple of hours if your going to the water park.
Wife loved it.

Royal Swim. The only reason why I would give this lower than a five is the price. But the professionalism, the fascilities and the wonderful dolphins make me hit the five. We did the Royal Swim which set us back 850 Dirhams, worth every penny,
good place. we like a lot it was a good experience, the persons are very nice

Dolphin encounter. This was a well organised event that many adults and children enjoyed. The location is nice,having spent a huge amount of money even just to observe from the beach it was kept to very strict timings. It did feel very mechanical rather than a relaxing enjoyable experience.

disappointing. All the expereinece is a bath in a pool where a nice girl talks about dolphins. You'll learn a lot of things and you can ask questions. She is very prepared. She is a dolphin instructor so you will see dolphin jumping or playing with a ball. This is the positive, the negative thing is that the real interaction with the animals is very little, only caressing him. In my opinion, the show aims to have you some photos with the dolphin, then you can see them and decide if buying or not and usually people buy them. Considering that the whole experience is VERY EXPENSIVE, I wouldn't advice to do it, especially if you can go to the Caribbean , where our experience was much better.More interaction, no shallow waters, but deep waters where you could swim with the dolphins, wearing a lifejackets so that even young children could swim. Nothing at all at he Dolphin bay. Believe me: you can skip it.
Swimming. Great fun for all especially the photo's. Staff where very pleasant
Expensive but fun. All of us liked it very much, as it is somethin you do not normally get to do.

about 20 dolphines to make cash. the dolphins are kept in a big area. You can book either to just touch them, get pulled slowly holding their two lower fins or the most expensive one is being pulled on their back fin for about 15 seconds. The price starts at about 60,-€ to 130,-€ for the back fin one.

must be done once in a lifetime. I did with my 3 year old daughter the dolphin encounter in shallow water, and it was a lifetime experience, and you get all what is wrttien in the website , you hvae your trun to dance with the dolphin to touch multiple times, information, kiss and hug photos................and with good service from the staff,My daughter loved it and hopefully we may get back but it is very expensive,get the CD of photos at least (very expensive) as you will not do it again!!!

An Amazing Experience. Swimming with dolphins had always been a dream of mine so when the opportunity arose for me to come to Atlantis & swim with dolphins I couldnt wait & I wasn't disappointed! I chose the shallow water experience, it was great. There were 8 of us on the experience & we all had several opportunities to interact with "Alice" & there were lots of photos for me to choose from at the end.There are always Buy One Get One Free or Half Price offers at the Hotel too.

great experience. go early; take with you shampoo as you need to shower and although you pay 895 DHS; teh showers are not equipped with shampoo! also make sure to factor an additional 1100 DHS for the leather album and USB. this is what you take with you.

Mass Production Feeling. We visited Dubai for 1 day and were told to go and visit the Dolphins as the children (age 8 and 9) would really enjoy it.I felt that for the cost of each person to see the dolphin we should have had more time with the dolphin. We sat through the orientation, which had interesting facts but was way too long (30'); the staff seemed tired. Then we got out and there were only 2 hot showers for all of us to use or take a cold one. No soap available but we got to use complimentary towels. We were told that we'd get a drink and a snack right after but what they offered was pop and water and we needed to ask. The photos cost for 1 CD and 5 photos was 150 Euros! I think that for a family these prices are too high!
A humbling experience!. The beauty of these mammals are breathtaking. Their gentleness and the interaction we had with them was very humbling! Well as for the kiss.....exquiste!
very expensive. I love dolphines . It is my dream to be close with theme . even you could swim ,touch and ride theme , fantastic
Disney hits Dubai!. We had a brilliant experience and the staff and trainers were excellent - even if 'disney' enthusiasts - made the day

Dolphinarium is a must see. The dolphinarium at the Creek Park is a must see in Dubai. Unlike other places it is an enclosed space so you don't have to squint your eyes to avoid the sunshine. The dolphins are wonderfully trained. Some of their antics were really endearing. The seals were also an enjoyable experience. The show lasts for about 45 minutes and you get an ample view of the dolphins. Go for the VIP seats. They only cost 20 dh more but you are at splashing distance from the dolphins.

One-in-a-lifetime-experience. Dolphin Bay facilities are remarkable and you really get to work and swim with the dolphins. This does not put too much strain on the dolphins as there are many and one dolphin works with very few people. The downside to it is the price - more than 700 dirhams per person. Also, the water is cold despite the fact that they offer you a neoprene swimsuit .. and we couldn't find a hairdryer to dry the girls' vey long hair.

Excellent, fun, informative, great experience!. The children loved touching a real dolphin, it was a small breed and the guide was a bit dull. The dolphin was right in front of you and you could ask questions, how do they feed young, etc. Small group of you at once, so the photos all have strangers in them-very annoying! Had to wear suit and lifejacket for shallow water!
OBO. Mother went with friends said it was great to get to interact with them so closely

Our first close encounter with a bottle-nosed friend. This being our first encounter, we were already wide-eyed before it all began. The encounter starts with changing into wetsuits and then a 20-minute briefing after which small groups or pods are assembled for the encounter on the beach. You don't plunge into a tank but rather are given the illusion that you're walking out into the shallows of a tropical beach to spend some quality time with a dolphin. Our kids loved every minute of the encounter which took us through group and individual activities with our dolphin (one dolphin to a group or pod) under the watchful eye of our coordinator and trainer. Morning seems to be a better time to have the encounter. This was a Shallow Water encounter that we opted for.

Magnificent. Whilst staying at Atlantis we did the Dolphin encounter. It was really well organised and informative. There was plenty of time for everyone to spend time with the dolphins and the trainers were very knowledgeable and able to answer any questions
Amazing!. This part of our holiday was quite costly but it was well worth every penny. It was the chance of a lifetime. My children had the most amazing time!
A good experience. A visit without a visit to Dolphin bay is not complete. Not cheap but worth the money we paid. Overall very good indeed.

Who the *%$( is Alice?. Alice was the name of our dolphin! Really fun experience, but not cheap. Got suited out in wetsuits, had a good orientation from the staff, got to play with the dolphins for around 30 minutes - kissing, hugging, pushing, towing, etc. Very well done. Photos made by staff were fair (at least mine were), but purchasing them, prints and/or CDs, will require a second mortgage on your home. It's probably a once-in-a-lifetime experience, so you may as well bite the bullet and enjoy; you can buy that Porsche next year. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable and they make the experience one of the best around.
Best experience of my life!. Swimming with the dolphins at Atlantis, was the best experience of my life. You can swim with them for 30mins.
nice. something you do once, tried at orlando but had a awiting list of mths here no probs

Amazing experience. I am usually not a big fan of any Marine park of zoo and hate to see captive animals. But the Dolphin bay experience is completely different. The facilities are great and you can see the dolphins are really well treated. They have a lot of room and seem to enjoy the interaction with Humans.The organisation is impeccable and even though this is quitre pricy, it is worth it. Better to spend the extra Aed 100 to to do the royal swim (you then can swim with the dolphins).Same for the picture. Budget it out so you can afford to buy the pictures. They are expensive, but the quality is great and they are part of the experience!

Good experience but not enough time. Fantastic experience, its not cheap, but certainly worth it! My only comment is that it is a little short, and felt abit short changed. Abit more time would have give that added value, but I understand they need to run a business.

In Atlantis Park. My little grandaughter went into the water to have her photo taken with the dolphins, they were so gentle. She was alittle nervous at first but the trainer was excellent and stayed there with her all the time.

Superb, what a fantastic experience.. We decided to treat our grandchildren while staying in Dubai as an extended birthday present. We booked well in advance as it does book up quickly so I’m told.. The overall cost for 2 adults and 2 children aged 5 was around £440.00 so not cheap but as ever “you get what you pay for” and it was worth every penny. We asked whether other family members could watch from the water’s edge and we’re told that they had to pay which I found hard to understand. I suspect that part of the reason is that they have a person taking photographs the whole time and if family members are there they will lose out on people buying expensive photos at the end. In any case the experience was excellent and I would certainly recommend that you give it a go.
once in a life time opportunity. Loved every minute of Dolphin bay, it was so great to meet Cathy the Dolphin, a real must do in Dubai!

Loved it!. Definitely worth experiencing once in your life! Really enjoyed it and the set up is brilliant. My only concern is ive since heard the dolphins come from the same place as the film "The Cove" was made which I found disappointing but I'm not sure how true this is, they seemed well looked after to me despite being in captivity.

One of the best experiences of my life. I had booked the Royal Swim at The Atlantis. You can get here by buggy from the hotel. Or you can walk there its a short walk from aquaventure. The reception area is beautiful with a entire dolphin theme from the floor to the lights. From there you taken to a room in which they educate you on dolphins and brief you . Next up you get changed into a wet suit for the swim. The area which they've created is truly remarkable, the sand was great and the water was clear and they had beach chairs with umbrellas for friends and family to view from at an extra 100 AED per person. The Royal Swim package requires you to be a strong swimmer cause the water is deep. The dolphins were really well taken care off and friendly. All in all one of the best experiences of my life totally worth the money. Highly recommended.

Great experience....but be prepared for overpriced merchandise and photos!. This is the second time we have swum with dolphins and the experience here was fabulous. It is a well organised and run operation and the staff were really knowledgeable and friendly. Our only gripe was the cost of buying photos afterwards. About £20 per photo and £200 for a disc of all the photos. We bought a couple as a sounvenir but couldn't justify spending the £200 - especially since we paid about £20 for the disc of photos when we'd swam with dolphins before.
Really enjoyed this & well worth if you haven't done it. This was great experience but don't recommend purchasing the photos it was far to expensive - £90 for the CD of about 20 photos!

Very Commercial. I was expecting to see dolphins allowed to swim in an almost natural envirionment but instead there were about 10 trainers in the water at one time with a group of up to 10 people each ! Didnt like it.

Superb!!. It was excellent to swin with the dolphins and be kissed by them..!! Must do for all. Knowing how to swin is essential for the royal swim. They charge 975AED for the swim and 1000AED for the photographs which is ridiculious...!!!!

poor caretaking. it was my birthday present and they forgot to submit my booking in the Atlantis
Not to mention the hideous price for pictures

For those who love dolphins - amazing!. The most expensive (Royal) ticket is highly recommended. You will spend with dolphin almost 40 minutes doing different tricks. Dolphins love people and are treated extremely well.

What a fantastic experience...a must when visiting Dubai. We have now been to Dolphin Bay twice. The first time in a group and the second last week for a private session. It did cost 6000AED but was worth every penny to see my daughter face when taking a belly ride on the dolphin - its not cheap and neither are the photos but these prices are available before you go to Dolphin Bay there are no hidden extras - say hello to Blade for us if you go :-)

Sensational Experience. The Atlantis Royal Swim is action packed from beginning to end. With 30 minutes in the water and a maximum of 6 guests per dolphin, guests swim out to the depths of the lagoon where they can witness the power of dolphins as they jump overhead then enjoy the thrill of a dorsal fin tow and a foot push in addition to hugs and kisses!Truly magical experience, well worth the money paid.

The most awesome experience of my life!. I have lived in Dubai for a few years now and finally decided to treat myself to the Dolphin Experience at Atlantis on the Palm Island. My partner and I went all out and booked a Dolphin Encounter, Dolphin Adventure and a Royal Swim.The Dolphin Encounter was done on a Maldivian style beach in crystal clear water. We spent 30 minutes perched on our knees in the lagoon and thoroughly enjoyed the close contact we had with our dolphin. The encounter involved kissing, hugging, touching and playing with our dolphin. A truly wonderful experience. The trainers were superb and the close bond they share with their dolphins is inspirational.Next on our list was the Dolphin Adventure (Possibly my favorite). Plunging into the surprisingly cool water we had a spectacular time bonding with our new dolphin friend. The entire experience was finished off with a belly ride to the beach... phenomenal! This program is spent in the deeper section of the dolphin's habitat and the ability to swim is necessary. Last on our program list was the Royal Swim. Once again we absolutely loved the program and really enjoyed holding on to our two dolphins as they took us for a fantastic ride to the beach from the deep water. Another highlight was being pushed by the foot, whilst on a boogie board , by our dolphin at break neck speed! Lots of fun. This program is designed for the adventurous folk out there. A note on pricing and group sizes. We paid between AED 595 p/p and AED 925 p/p for the various programs and I would happily have paid much more for the professional and safe way the programs have been set up. Our group size for the encounter was 8 (Maximum 10 per dolphin), our adventure was 6 (Maximum 6 per dolphin) and the royal swim was 5 (Maximum 6 per dolphin). Although we enjoyed all three programs beyond our wildest expectations, my personal favorite was probably the Adventure. We will most definitely be back again and again and again!!!I purchased a CD with a range of photos from the entire interaction for around AED 500 and am extremely happy with the quality of the photos. It was mentioned at some stage during the briefings that photographers would be there to capture the experience and although I noticed their presence it was by no means intrusive.During my last program the trainer mentioned a new dive interaction which sounded absolutely exciting and unique... I will be sure to book it as soon as I see availability. A big thank you to the amazing people and dolphins who make it possible for us to experience our dreams coming true.

the most amazing experience of my life. For me and my family it's one of those things that is on the "list of life" - swimming with dolphins.Yes it's expensive (but cheaper if you stay at the resort) and the briefing and introduction lasts longer than the encounter, but it is still up there with one of the most memorable moments of my life.The shallow encounter is great for the kids but if you can swim, the deep water encounter is much better value if you want to interact with the dolphins.Bring lots of spare money because the photos are insanely expensive but you will buy them anyway.Most importnantly for me and my family, it is obvious that the dolphins are not "over worked" and have lots of free "play time" just by themselves. The trainers really care for their dolphins.

Amazing Experience. My sister has wanted to swim with dolphins since she was 5 years old so when I was arranging a trip for her 21st birthday staying at the Atlantis and arranging an experience at Dolphin Bay seemed a great idea, and it was! She absolutely loved it. We had the Royal Swim which was not cheap but in our minds worth the extra - it means you have a group of up to 6, have a dorsal swim, hugs, kisses, etc. The time goes way to quick but we would highly recommend the experience. The staff at Dolphin Bay are amazing to.Beware the cost for photos - not cheap but you will definately want some of them!!

Dolphin Bay at Atlantis Resort's Aquaventure is an excellent experience!!. The shallow water dolphin interaction at Dolphin Bay in Aquaventure Park at the Atlantis resort of Dubai is truly an amazing experience! You get a great opportunity to get up close and personal with the dolphins in a small group of 10 or less (unless you spring for the extra charge to have a private interaction but probably not necessary) and you get admission to the waterpark. The dolphin adventure begins with you changing into appropriate attire and then sitting through a training session where you learn some interesting trivia about dolphins and where not to touch them, then you are broken into groups and sent into the water with a trainer. The organization does a great job of ensuring that you will get hands on experience with the dolphin. The trainers are friendly and make sure that you'll have many photo opportunities (but, the resort has a photographer snapping all the shots which you will feel compelled to buy because they're actually quite good).After the 45 minutes with the dolphins, you should definitely take advantage of the rest of the waterpark. Dubai is HOT so you'll enjoy floating along the several water tube rides and may even get brave and ride on some of the larger rides including the leap of faith (very high, quite fast, not that scary). The aquarium and shark exhibits are good and you might want to do the interaction with the manta rays too but we preferred the dolphins.Atlantis is a bit away from the downtown area but worth the trip. Taxis are reasonable (like New York) and typically easy to get. Do not plan to eat at the waterpark since, like most amusement parks, the food is not very good but is very expensive. You are better served to make reservations in a restaurant at Atlantis resort.

Great Experience, would highly recommend. However, budget appropriately!. What a great experience! The facilities are magnificent and the way the whole Atlantis park is laid out is great. However, major gripe! Not well sign posted!We did the shallow interaction and were in a group of 7-10. It was however, fine as you got lots of time to touch the dolphin as well as your one on one or couple moments and got half an hour or so in the water. The trainer we had was brilliant, very knowledgeable, entertaining, and had such control over the dolphin it was incredible.Would highly recommend the experience to anyone.However, and this is the thing that I think they could overcome very easily. You book the package you want, great, and pay the money fine. It warns of no photography and that is ok (we were just two so no one watching from the beach). But this is the bit I hadn't put two and two together on. When you finish, you want the photos and in order to get them you have to pay. Now, it is worth it as the photos are great but is expensive (£95-100) for a cd with all images you are in (about 30 in our case) and 3 prints.The thing that annoyed me, is that I wasn't expecting it. If I had have known, I would have allowed for it and I would not have begrudged it at all.Solution: send the photo pricelist with the booking confirmation and make a sales point of it upfront, "we have professional photographers that will capture your once in a lifetime moment in crystal clear clarity e.t.c." Then everyone knows the deal upfront and can't complain.I know I have gone on about it a bit about the photo thing, and maybe it is me being naive, but it just annoyed me a bit. However, what it did not do is ruin the experience which was magical and worth every penny, and now we have the photos to prove it!!

Great experience, just not long enough. Swimming with dolphins was something both me and my husband always wanted to do so we decided to take the opportunity on our honeymoon. We booked the deep water encounter and were not disappointed. Although the introduction and pre-experience quiz is all quite long and drawn out, the time you get in the water with the dolphins is amazing. We were put in a group of 6 and assigned a dolphin and trainer. You get a lot of hands on experience including riding on the dolphin's belly and hugging and kissing it. In total we were in the water about half an hour which gave you a decent amount of time with the dolphin but would have been great if it was just a little bit longer for the amount of money you're paying. One of those once in a lifetime things though! The photos were a bit disapopinting though as they were all action shots, we had our eyes closed or face srewed up in most of them, it would have been nice to get 5 minutes at the end to pose for photos with the dolphin.A major bonus of the package is that it includes access to the Aquaventure park which is a great day out and has rides for everyone.

Brilliant experience, but not quite sure whether the 'Roayl Swim' is worth it. Myself and my husband just recently did this as we were in Dubai for our honeymoon and we have always wanted to swim with the dolphins. We did the 'Royal Swim', which was great but not as great as they sell it on the website. You only get to actually swim with the dolphins just the once and then all the other 'things' you do with the dolphins are covered in the dolphin adventure, so if you can live without the actual swim, just save a few quid and go for the encounter/adventure. The free pass into the aqua venture makes going to swim with the dolphins a fun day out, so that's def a bonus you get the pass. There is a photgrapher who takes photos of you....warning...the cost of the pictures are extortionate!!! If you're with someone who is there on a observer pass, get them to take pictures of you. We just got on with it and paid the money for the photos, but the price is mad...to be expected I guess in a 5* hotel!

Excellent experience for the whole family. This was a fantastic way to spend a day in Dubai. A ticket included entry to the Atlantis Waterpark, as well as the dolphin experience. The dolphin experience was great for kids and adults alike. After a half-hour induction where you learnt about the dolphins which you would shortly get to meet, you were then split into groups of ten and assigned a dolphin and a trainer. This small number, meant that in the hour-long session, you were able to have a lot of interaction with your dolphin. This interaction included dancing with the dolphin, hugging it, throwing it a ball and kissing it. Throughout the whole experience, a photographer was in the water with you, catching these moments on camera (although these photos were at a price). However, there was also the option for family members to take photos (although the distance did require a good camera for this to be possible!) and again, this was at high extra cost! With these hidden extras, it does not end up being a cheap day out, however, it was worth every penny, and I would definitely both do this again, and recommend it to others!

Once in a lifetime experience. We (husband, wife and son aged 14) went to Dolphin bay at Atlantis the Palm, Dubai for the deep water interaction.It was great fun and wonderful to be so close to a magnificent creature. We learnt a lot about dolphins too. It was our son's birthday and he was totally thrilled. Included in the price is the water park admission (aquaventure) with great water rides etc. Although it costs about 150-200 pounds per person (depending on exchange rate) it was well worth it as we had a full day of activities plus the chance to be very close to a dolphin. We had previously been on diving trips to see them and been unlucky.Dolphin bay also do a shallow water interaction which is similar to the deep water interaction for people who can't swim or for younger children. Dolphin bay is about 20-30 minutes walk from the water park so allow enough time to reach it. Well worth going to dolphin bay.

Great - expensive experiance. The Dolphin Bay attraction is a very nice activity to do if you are in Dubai. it requiers early booking and its non refundable if less than two weeks. you will get to get in full contact with trained Dolphins and feed them and swim with them if you have no kids. you will be in a group of 10 ( which is alot in my opinion ) I was lucky to be total 5 in my group but I thinks its not common - we were the last five to be assigned with a trainer so we were grouped. you will not regret doing this especially if you were in a small group. its a bit expensive about USD 300 for me, my wife and 2 years old girl ( all same fare ) you are not allowed to have a camera while your with the Dolphins but a camera man will be taking all sorts of photos you can buy after your done, about USD 40 for 1st photo and 18 for any additional ones. They are expensive but worth a try

An excellent experience!. I'd never experienced a Dolphin interaction before, so staying at the Atlantis Palm for our honeymoon proved an exciting opportunity. The price (a "Ramadan Special", although I'm unsure how this rate differs outside of Ramadan) seemed very reasonable, at 495 AED.I was slightly taken aback that it would cost us another 100 AED for my wife (who swam with Dolphins herself on a previous holiday, so didn't mind sitting out to take photos!) to view from the shore, but decided it would be worth it for the photos.The orientation was excellent - not only did we get given the expected safety information, but also some interesting facts and information about Dolphins themselves, and the ones we'd be meeting.We were very clearly told that photography was permitted, but that videoing the experience was not allowed. The beach area for observers was as close as you could get to the water without getting wet - it would never have been possible to take those kinds of photographs from the waiting area - and shaded sun loungers were provided.The interaction itself felt very personal, even though there were several other people in the group with each dolphin. We each got to kiss and hug the adorable creature, smooth its surface and play with it - throughout which the staff were happy to answer any questions we had.After a group pose with the dolphin jumping behind us, we were taken back inside for complimentary(and very much needed) refreshments, and the chance to chat further with the trainers there.The photographs taken by the staff didn't seem all that different from the ones my wife was able to take, and they were certainly pricey (despite being discounted after the first two). It was certainly worth paying the 100 AED for us to have our own to do with as we liked!My father-in-law paid several times what we paid for an interaction for my wife in Florida, and she told me afterward that both the orientation and interaction itself were longer and more involved than the experience she'd had!Pros:- Informative staff and orientation- Excellent up-close interaction with a dolphin- Complimentary refreshments afterward!Cons:- Pricey photographs / paying to take your ownAdditionally, the fact that a portion of all proceeds went to the foundation who ran the centre was a heart-warming touch!

Dolphin Bay Rip Off. Very Excited about visiting this attraction.We went along looking forward to not only meeting a dolphin but having some photos and video to show friends and family.The booking form said no photos and video but when we arrived and asked staff there we were told it was fine and you could take them to the beach side of the facility.Great! Left the tiny low res camera filming from the sun lounger on a mini tripod. We waded into the water and met Alice the dolphin.Upon returning to the hotel and watching the video we saw that the staff had gone over to it and switched it off, without permission or even asking or telling us.The interaction was great and the trainers were pretty good but to be forced to buy their photos at a really high price. £55 for 4 pictures. Mmmm, thats worth it. And no video of the experience? Not great from such a prestigious hotel.I have wrote to them and they couldn't care less. "you were told no filming and thats our policy, our staff did not touch the camera"So they called me a liar too.You tube has the video evidence.We were so upset and disappointed and the attitude of the Kerzner company has been awful.Be Warned! You will love the dolphin but you won't be able to share it with anyone.
